title: Japanese Brown Fried Rice
ingredients: ['1 1/2  cups quick cooking brown Basmati rice', 'Salt to taste', '1 1/2  tablespoons sesame oil', '2 tablespoons pine nuts', '2-3 fresh red chillies, diagonally sliced', '2-3 spring onion bulbs, chopped', '2 medium carrots, peeled, cut into  1/2  cm cubes and blanched', ' 1/2  cup boiled edamame beans', 'Crushed black peppercorns to taste', '1 1/2  teaspoons light soy sauce', '2-3 tablespoons chopped spring onion greens + for garnish', 'Toasted white sesame seeds to sprinkle']
method: ['Take quick cooking brown Basmati rice in a bowl, add sufficient water and wash for 2-3 times. Add sufficient water and soak for 25-30 minutes. Drain.', 'Boil 5-6 cups water in a deep non-stick pan, add drained rice and salt, mix and cook for 10-12 minutes. Drain and set aside.', 'Heat sesame oil in a non-stick wok, add pine nuts and fresh red chillies and mix well.', 'Add spring onion bulbs, carrots and edamame beans and mix well.', 'Add salt and crushed black peppercorns and mix.', 'Add the cooked rice, light soy sauce and spring onion greens and toss well.', 'Cook on medium heat for 2-3 minutes or till the rice is heated thoroughly.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with spring onion greens, sprinkle white sesame seeds and serve hot.']
Main ingredients: Quick cooking brown Basmati rice, Sesame oil, Pine nuts, Fresh red chillies, Spring onions with greens, Carrots, Edamame beans, Crushed black peppercorns, Light soy sauce, Toasted white sesame seeds

title: Tamarind Cooler
method: ['Heat 3 cups water in a non-stick pan. Add sugar, tamarind paste and ginger, stir and boil for a minute. Remove from heat and cool down to room temperature.', 'Slice lemon and remove seeds. Coarsely crush cumin seeds.', 'Place lots of ice cubes into 4 individual tall glasses. Add 2-3 lemon slices and  1/4  tablespoon lemon juice in each glass.', 'Divide crushed cumin seeds and the tamarind mixture equally into each and top with drinking soda.', 'Serve chilled.']

title: Chaat
method: ['To make the sweet chutney, put tamarind pulp, dates and jaggery into a blender jar. Add a little water that was used to soak dates and jaggery and blend it all together into a smooth puree. Transfer into a bowl, add salt, chilli powder and cumin powder and mix well.', 'To make bhel, put the puffed rice into a large bowl, add sev, onion, potato, salt and red chilli powder mix and toss well.', 'Add the green chutney, garlic chutney and 2-3 tbsps sweet chutney and mix well. Add chana dal and sprouts and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish it with sev and coriander leaves and serve immediately with crisp puris.', 'To make dahi batata puri, make a hole in each puri and arrange them on a serving platter. Fill each puri with some potatoes, and sprouts. Drizzle yogurt, green chutney and sweet chutney.', 'Sprinkle salt and red chilli powder. Top with sev and garnish with coriander leaves and serve immediately.']

title: Egg Macho
method: ['Preheat oven to 180degC. Heat olive oil in a non stick pan, add onions and saute till translucent. Break eggs into a bowl, add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, salt and coriander leaves and whisk well.', 'Add capsicum, tomato, tomato basil sauce and salt to the pan and mix well.', 'Transfer the mixture into a baking dish and pour the egg mixture over it. Sprinkle cheese and chaat masala on top. Keep the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for 10 minutes. Serve hot.']

title: Ginger Raisin Whole Wheat Cookies
method: ['Preheat oven at 180deg C. Line a baking tray with a silicon mat.', 'Combine whole wheat flour, refined flour, wheat bran, butter, castor sugar and ginger powder in a bowl and mix till it resembles breadcrumbs.', 'Add raisins and mix. Add some milk and knead into a stiff dough.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions and shape them into lemon size balls. Place the balls on the lined baking tray and lightly press the balls to flatten.', 'Place the baking tray in preheated oven and bake for 16-18 minutes. Remove from oven and cool.', 'Serve.']

title: APRICOT JAM NANKHATAI
method: ['Preheat an oven at 180oC.', 'Take refined flour in a large shallow bowl. Add gram flour, baking soda, baking powder, green cardamom powder and powdered sugar and mix well. Make a well in the centre, add the melted ghee and rub well with your fingers till the mixture comes together.', 'To make the nankhatai, divide the mixture into equal portions. Shape each portion into a ball. Slightly flatten them and using your thumb, make a cavity in the centre. Place them at equidistance on a lined baking tray.', 'Place the baking tray in the preheated oven and bake for 6-8 minutes. Take the baking tray out of the oven and pipe out apricot jam in the prepared cavity of the nankhatais. Place the baking tray back in the oven and continue to bake for 2-3 minutes.', 'Bring the baking tray out of the oven and sprinkle pistachios powder. Allow the nankhatais to cool completely.', 'Arrange the nankhatais on a serving plate and serve as required.']

title: Nilgiri Mutton Curry
method: ['Boil 2-3 cups water in a deep non-stick pan, add mutton, half the cardamoms, cloves, peppercorns, bay leaves and  1/2  inch cinnamon. Mix well. Add salt and mix again. Cover and cook on low heat till the mutton is half done.', 'Grind together coconut, green chillies, coriander leaves reserving some for garnishing, mint leaves ginger, garlic, remaining cardamoms, cloves, peppercorns, cinnamon with little water to a smooth paste.', 'Strain the half cooked mutton in a bowl. Discard bay leaves and cinnamon.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add curry leaves, turmeric powder and onion and saute till brown. Add ground paste and saute for a minute.', 'Add half cooked mutton and mix well. Add salt, cumin powder, coriander powder, fennel powder and mix well. Add stock and mix well. Cover and cook on low for 5-8 minutes.', 'Add yogurt and mix well. Cook for 5 minutes.', 'Serve hot garnished with coriander leaves and serve hot.']

title: Cherry, Fresh Prunes And Almond Bread Pudding
method: ['Take bread cubes in a bowl. Pour brandy, two tablespoons of cherry juice over them and set aside. In another bowl mix egg, cream and sugar.', 'Add canned cherries and two tablespoons of cherry juice and mix. Add prunes and mix. Add brandy-soaked bread, sliced almonds, cinnamon powder and mix well.', 'Transfer the mixture into a Microwave glass bowl and cook on Microwave HIGH (100%) for five minutes. Allow standing time of two minutes. Turn out onto a serving dish.', 'For sauce, wash and dry fresh cherries. Take cherry jam, remaining cherry juice, fresh cherries in a pan and cook for five minutes.', 'Pour the sauce over the pudding and serve warm.']

title: Cheesy Chicken Sandwiches - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat butter in a non-stick pan, add green chilli and onion and saute for 2 minutes. Add refined flour and saute for 1 minute. Add milk and mix well to avoid lumps.', 'Add  1/2  cup cheese, shredded chicken, salt, crushed black peppercorns and mix well. Let the mixture cool slightly.', 'Preheat a sandwich griller.', 'Apply butter on bread slices and top it with a portion of the chicken mixture. Sprinkle some of the remaining mozzarella cheese on each slice and cover with another buttered bread slice.', 'Apply some butter on both sides of the sandwiches, place them on the griller and grill the sandwiches for 5 minutes or till grill marks appear on both sides.', 'Cut each sandwich in half, arrange them on a serving platter and serve hot with tomato ketchup.']

title: Sakhreche Talele Modak
method: ['To make the stuffing, heat ghee in a non-stick pan, add poppy seeds and coconut, mix well and saute for 1 minute or till the coconut gets heated through. Add sugar, mix well and saute on medium heat for 1-2 minutes or till sugar mixes well with the coconut.', 'Add charoli, cashewnuts and raisins and mix well. Add green cardamom powder and nutmeg powder and mix well. Switch off the heat, transfer into a bowl and set aside to cool.', 'To make the dough, take refined flour in a mixing bowl, add semolina, salt and warm ghee. Add milk, little by little and knead into stiff dough. Cover with a moist muslin cloth and set aside for 30 minutes.', 'Divide the dough into large balls. Dust the worktop with some dry flour, place a dough ball on it and roll out into a thin and large disc. Cut into equal sized discs with a cookie cutter. Place a teaspoonful of stuffing in centre of each disc, pinch the edges into small pleats, bring them together and press to seal and shape into modaks.', 'Use up the remaining dough and stuffing to make more modaks.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai, slide in the modaks, a few at a time, and deep-fry on medium heat for 5-6 minutes till they turn golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving plate and serve warm. Or cool them and store in an airtight container.']

title: Lavash
method: ['Mix refined flour, sugar, egg white, salt and butter in a bowl. Add sufficient water and knead into a soft dough. Add oil and knead again. Cover with damp muslin cloth and set aside for 10-15 minutes.', 'Preheat oven to 180o C.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions, shape them into balls and rest for 5-7 minutes. Roll out the balls into thin discs.', 'Grease baking tray with oil, place the discs on it, brush them with egg white and sprinkle black sesame seeds on top. Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes.', 'Remove the tray from the oven, roughly tear lavashandplace them on a serving plate.Serve with muhammara dip.']

title: Stuffed Potato Shells
method: ['Halve the potatoes lengthways and arrange them in a microwave proof dish. Cook in the microwave on HIGH for one to one and a half minutes.', 'Take paneer in a bowl. Add green chillies, salt, quarter teaspoon chaat masala, quarter teaspoon red chilli powder, quarter teaspoon roasted cumin power, ginger and coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Add two tablespoons grated cheese and mix well. Remove the potatoes from the microwave and with a spoon scoop out the centre like a disc, leaving a shell all around.', 'Reserve the scooped out portions. Stuff the potato shells with the paneer mixture. Place the scooped out potato discs over the stuffing. Arrange the potatoes on a baking dish.', 'Drizzle oil over the potatoes, sprinkle the remaining red chilli powder, chaat masala and roasted cumin powder along with lemon juice and the remaining cheese. Bake in the preheated oven for fifteen minutes.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Sadak Chaap Egg Fried Rice
method: ['Heat 2 tbsps rice bran oil in a non-stick pan.', 'Break eggs in a bowl, beat well and add to the pan. Mix and cook, stirring continuously, till fully done. Add salt, mix and transfer in a bowl.', 'Heat remaining rice bran oil in another non-stick pan. Add ginger, garlic and green chillies, mix and saute till fragrant.', 'Add Basmati rice, soy sauce, red chilli sauce, vinegar and salt and mix well.', 'Add green gram sprouts, mixed bean sprouts and spring onions and mix well. Add cooked egg, masala peanuts and fried noodles and mix well.', 'Garnish with spring onions and sev and serve hot.']

title: Batata Nu Shaak
method: ['Heat sufficient oil in a deep pan, slide in the potato cubes in 2 batches, and deep-fry till light golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Heat 2 tbsps oil in a non-stick pan, add white sesame seeds and saute till the seeds change colour. Add the fried potatoes and mix well on high heat.', 'Add turmeric powder, coriander powder and red chilli powder, reduce heat and mix well. Add salt and sugar and mix well.', 'Switch the heat off, add coriander leaves and lemon juice and mix well.', 'Transfer to a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprigs and serve hot.']

title: Raw Mango Chutney
ingredients: ['1 medium raw mango, peeled, seeded and roughly chopped', ' 1/2  cup fresh mint leaves', '6-8 fresh coriander sprigs', '1-2 green chillies', '2-3 garlic cloves', ' 1/2  inch ginger, roughly chopped', 'Salt to taste']
Main ingredients: Raw mango, Fresh mint leaves, Fresh coriander leaves, Green chillies, Garlic, Ginger

title: Jackfruit Crepe Rolls
method: ['Take rice flour in a bowl. Add refined flour, salt and some water and whisk to make a semi-thick batter.', 'Heat jackfruit in a non-stick pan. Add coconut and jaggery, mix and cook for 1 minute.', 'Add 1 tablespoon water, mix and cook till jaggery melts. Add cardamom powder and mix.', 'Heat a non-stick pan. Grease with some oil and pour a ladleful of batter and swirl to make a thin disc. Drizzle some oil on top and roast from both sides till golden. Use up the remaining batter similarly.', 'Transfer on individual serving plates, put some jackfruit mixture on one side of the disc and wrap.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Vegan No-Bake Cookies- SK Khazana
method: ['Put rolled oats into a blender jar blend to a powder. Add cashewnuts, pumpkin seeds, ginger powder, rock salt and cinnamon powder and blend to a fine powder.', 'Add dates and vanilla extract and blend till well combined. Transfer into a large bowl. Add raisins and mix well.', 'To make the cookies, take small portions of the mixture and shape each into a ball and flatten slightly.', 'Make a dent in the centre of the cookie and place a cahsewnut half in it and press gently. .', 'Arrange the cookies on a serving plate and serve.']

title: Noodle Wrapped Crispy Chicken
method: ['Preheat oven to 180deg C. Grease a baking tray with some oil.', 'Take chicken strips in a bowl, add egg, cornflour, Schezwan sauce, garam masala powder, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, salt and lemon juice, mix well.', 'Take the noodles in a plate, and wrap each chicken strip with some noodles. Keep these on a plate.', 'Place the noodle coated chicken strips on the greased tray and brush some oil on each strip. Put the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes.', 'Take the tray out of the oven, arrange the chicken strips on a serving platter and serve hot with Schezwan sauce or tomato ketchup.']

title: Chickpeas Spinach Kofta
method: ['Place chickpeas, cumin powder, paprika powder, salt in a blender and blend coarsely. Transfer the mixture into a bowl.', 'Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a non-stick pan. Add spinach leaves and saute for 1 minute. Remove from heat, cool and chop finely.', 'Add chopped spinach to chickpeas mixture and mix well. Add gram flour and mix well.', 'Heat remaining oil in a non-stick pan.', 'Divide the chickpeas-spinach mixture into equal portions and shape them into quennels. Place them in the pan and fry till golden from each side.', 'To make dip, combine yogurt, tahini paste, salt, chopped coriander and lemon juice in a bowl and mix well.', 'Serve hot koftas with the dip.']

title: Dragon Seafood Rolls
method: ['Whisk refined flour, cornflour, salt and eggs together with enough water in a bowl to make a smooth batter. Strain into another bowl and rest for half an hour.', 'To make the filling, heat one tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan, add garlic, ginger and green chilli and saute for half a minute. Add red chilli paste and spring onion and saute for a minute. Add crabmeat, shrimps and fish.', 'Add salt, soy sauce and vinegar and mix well. Cook till the mixture dries up and starts sizzling. Remove, cool and blend coarsely.', 'Heat a non-stick pan and brush a little oil on it. Mix the batter well and pour a ladle full into the pan, rotate the pan to coat it entirely and pour back the excess batter. Cook on medium to low heat, till it starts leaving the sides of the pan.', 'Remove the pancake carefully and cool. Repeat to make twelve pancakes.', 'Divide the filling into twelve equal portions. Place a portion of the filling at lower end of each pancake and roll, folding the sides while rolling. Brush the edges with egg and seal tightly. Repeat with all the pancakes and keep the rolls ready.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a wok and deep-fry the rolls in moderately hot oil, turning them frequently, until crisp and golden. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving plate and serve hot with a dipping sauce of your choice.']

title: Raw Banana Curry
method: ['In a grinding jar take coconut, red chilli powder, salt, turmeric and tamarind. Add sufficient water and grind to a smooth paste.', 'Take a nonstick pan. Add bananas, onions, ground paste, garam masala and salt. Add 1 1/2  cup water and mix well. Now put the pan on heat.', 'Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer for 8-10 minutes or till the bananas are cooked.', 'Add coconut oil mix and further cook for a minute.', 'Transfer into a bowl and serve hot.']

title: Chocolate Walnut Tart
method: ['Melt chocolate and butter together on a double boiler. Remove from heat and mix well till smooth. Add maple syrup, cream and orange zest and mix well.', 'Cool down to room temperature. Add walnuts and mix well.', 'Pour the mixture equally into the tart shell and refrigerate for two to three hours.', 'Garnish with chopped walnuts and serve chilled.']

title: Cheesy Rolls
method: ['Heat milk and half cup of butter together in a non-stick pan until warm.', 'Sieve together two cups of flour and salt in a bowl. Make a well in the center and add yeast and sugar. Add the warm milk and set aside for five to ten minutes.', 'Once the yeast becomes frothy, add egg and remaining flour. Mix and knead into a soft, slightly sticky dough.', 'Place the dough in a large bowl that has been greased with oil. Turn the dough to coat completely in the oil. Cover and put in a warm place to prove for one hour.', 'Heat one tablespoon of butter in a non-stick pan. Add garlic and saute for a minute. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Take parmesan cheese powder in another bowl. Add herbs, mix well and set aside.', 'Remove the dough from the bowl and divide into eight equal portions. Place a cube of cheese in the middle of the dough and roll.', 'Place the rolls on a baking tray about half inch apart. Cover and put in a warm place to prove for thirty minutes.', 'Preheat oven to 180degC.', 'Put the tray in the preheated oven and bake for twenty to thirty minutes. Remove from oven, brush with sauteed garlic and sprinkle herbed parmesan on top.', 'Serve immediately.']

title: Bajra Burfi
method: ['Heat ghee in a non stick kadai. Add bajra flour and saute for 6-8 minutes. Add khoya and jaggery and mix. Switch off the heat and continue mixing.', 'Grease an aluminium tray with ghee and spread the mixture evenly. Cut into squares while still hot.', 'When it cools down separate the squares and arrange on a serving plate. Serve.']

title: Kurmure ki Chikki - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat ghee in a deep non-stick pan, add jaggery and cook, stirring continuously, till jaggery melts and colour changes and becomes light.', 'Drizzle a few drops of the melted jaggery on the back side of a thali and if the jaggery hardens to a soft ball it is ready. Add puffed rice in pan and mix till all the puffed rice are well coated with the jaggery. Cook for 1-2 minutes.', 'Brush ghee on the backside of 2 medium steel thalis. While the mixture is still warm, spread it on the thalis with greased hands.', 'While the mixture is still warm and cut into 1 inch cubes. Separate the cubes and serve or store in an air-tight container and use as required.']

title: Prawns Inteha
method: ['Remove head and shell jumbo prawns. Remove the vein. Slit into two lengthwise.', 'Dry roast fennel seeds, cloves and coriander seeds. Cool and powder.', 'Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves and caraway seeds. When the seeds crackle, add onion and saute. Add green garlic and green chillies, stir and add coconut. Saute for two to three minutes.', 'Add prawns and stir. Sprinkle some water and add salt to taste. Add roasted masala powder and mix with a light hand. Add coriander leaves and mix.', 'Sprinkle some more water and cook. Add lemon juice, mix and cook for two to three minutes.', 'Transfer onto a dish.', 'Sprinkle grated cheese on top and serve hot.']

title: Honey and Lemon Chicken on Rice
method: ['Slice 2 lemons into thick roundels. Make light gashes on the chicken breast on both sides. Sprinkle salt and red chilli flakes on both sides.', 'Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick grill pan and place 6 lemon roundels in 2 rows. Place the chicken breast over them. Squeeze the juice of  1/2  lemon and let it cook.', 'Halve the shallots. Heat 2 tbsps oil in a non-stick wok, add shallots and ginger and saute.', 'Turn the chicken breast over, add 2 tbsps water and let it cook.', 'Add orange juice to the wok. Cut carrot into roundels and halve them and add to the wok and cook.', 'Add salt, honey, red chilli flakes, juice of  1/2  lemon and mix. Add  1/2  cup cooked brown rice and mix and let it get heated through.', 'Drizzle a little oil over the chicken breast and cook till both sides are golden. Remove from the pan and thickly slice diagonally without cutting through.', 'Transfer the rice into a serving plate, place the chicken over it. Garnish with a sprig of curly parsley and grilled lemon slices and serve hot.']

title: Peas and Raw Banana Subzi
method: ['Apply salt to banana cubes and put in a bowl. Steam in a steamer for five to seven minutes.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and let them change colour. Add chilli paste and mix well and saute.', 'Add crushed peas, mix and saute for two minutes. Add coriander powder, cumin powder and turmeric powder and mix well.', 'Add salt and banana cubes and mix well. Add coconut and mix. Cover and cook for three to four minutes. Add dried mango powder and mix well.', 'Add coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot with chapatti or phulka.']

title: Masala Khichdi
method: ['Peel and chop the onions. Wash and chop the green chilies. Peel and cube the potatoes. Peel and mince the ginger and garlic. Clean, wash and chop the coriander leaves. Wash and soak the dal and rice for half an hour. Drain.', 'Grind the coconut piece to a fine paste. Fry onions in a combination of 1 tablespoon ghee and 1 tablespoon oil. When the onions are light brown add the cumin seeds, minced garlic, ginger and green chillies. Then add the red chilli powder, turmeric powder and garam masala powder together with the ground coconut.', 'Fry for a while, put in the rice and dal and fry both for 2-3 minutes. Pour in warm water till it is about two inches above the level of the rice. If the water dries up, more warm water may be added. Add potato cubes and salt. When the water starts bubbling, lower the heat and simmer till rice and dal are cooked.', 'Sprinkle coriander leaves on top and serve hot.']

title: Sitaphal Ice Cream - SK Khazana
method: ['Blend together custard apple pulp, condensed milk, castor sugar, milk powder, cream and milk in a blender till smooth.', 'Pour this mixture into an airtight container, put on the lid and freeze till set.', 'Put scoops in individual serving bowls and serve.']

title: Pasta In Rice Cooker
method: ['Set the rice cooker on cook mode and pour olive oil in it. Crush garlic and add and saute for a minute.', 'Add onions and continue to saute till lightly browned. Add tomato puree and continue to saute.', 'Add penne pasta, 2 cups water and mix. Add salt, dried herbs, crushed red chillies and sugar and mix well.', 'When the mixture starts boiling add torn basil leaves, parmesan cheese and cover the cooker. Cook till done.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Chocolate Walnut Burfi
method: ['Cut the shelled walnuts into small pieces. Heat the crumbled mawa in a pan and roast for a while. Add sugar and a little milk and cook till it thickens.', 'Grease a baking tray with oil. Pour half the mawa mixture onto it and spread it evenly. In the remaining mixture add the cocoa powder and the walnut pieces.', 'Spread this on top of the earlier layer, which by now has cooled slightly. Shake the tray so that the mixture spreads evenly. Spread silver varq on top.', 'When completely cooled cut into square or diamond shaped pieces and serve or store.']

title: Rajma Chawal
method: ['Heat ghee and oil in a non-stick pan. Add cumin seeds and saute till seeds change colour.', 'Add ginger and garlic, mix well and saute for a minute. Add onion, mix and saute till onion is well browned.', 'Add tomato puree and mix. Add chilli powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder and cumin powder, mix, cover and cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add kidney beans and mix. Add salt and kidney beans stock, mix, cover and cook for 3-4 minutes.', 'Add dried mango powder_ and garam masala powder and mix well. Add cream and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, drizzle some cream on top, garnish with a coriander sprig and serve hot with jeera rice.']

title: Punjabi Samosa Gujiya
method: ['To prepare gujiya dough, sift flour in a bowl. Add ghee and some cold water and knead into a dough. Set aside.', 'To prepare stuffing, heat 1 tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan. Add cumin seeds, ginger, green chillies and potatoes, mix and cook for 1 minute. Add red chilli powder, dried mango powder, garam masala powder and salt and mix well.', 'Sprinkle some water on top, cover and cook till potatoes are done.', 'Add green peas and cook for 5 minutes on low heat. Add chopped coriander and mix well. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.', 'Divide the dough into twelve equal portions and shape into balls. Roll out each ball into a puri. Place one portion of the stuffing on one half of the puri, lightly moisten the edges, fold the other half over the stuffing and press the edges to seal. Pinch the edges to make a design.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Deep fry the gujiyas on low heat till they become crisp and golden. Drain onto an absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Warm Farfalle Salad
method: ['Cook pasta in 2 cups water. Heat 2 tbsps oil in a non stick pan. Add corn and cook on high heat for 3-4 minutes.', 'Halve baby tomatoes and olives. Add garlic to the oil in the pan, mix well and saute till burnt. Mix olives, tomatoes, onions and corn-garlic mixture in a bowl. Tear basil leaves and add.', 'Add broccoli florets to pasta, mix well and cook till al dante. Add remaining oil, salt and vinegar to the bowl. Drain water from cooked pasta and broccoli and add to bowl. Mix well. Serve immediately.']

title: Kanda Poha- Sk Khazana
method: ['Wash pressed rice thoroughly with water. Drain and set aside.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add asafoetida, green chillies and curry leaves, mix and saute for 1 minute.', 'Add onion, mix and saute till translucent. Add turmeric powder, mix and saute.', 'Add pressed rice, salt, roasted peanuts and coriander leaves and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Take the pan off the heat.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot with lemon wedge.']

title: Multi Grain Dal Dhokli
method: ['Heat a pressure cooker, add split pigeon peas, salt,  1/2  tsp turmeric powder, peanuts and 2 cups water. Cover the cooker and cook under pressure till 4-5 whistles are released.', 'Meanwhile take multigrain flour, gram flour, salt, remaining turmeric powder and red chilli powder in a bowl and mix well. Add sufficient water and knead into stiff dough. Cover with a damp muslin cloth and set aside for 10-15 minutes.', 'Take small portions of dough and roll them on back of a fork to shape into gnocchis.', 'Uncover the cooker when the pressure settles completely.', 'Heat ghee in a deep non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add asafoetida, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, dried red chillies and the cooked pigeon peas. Mix well for 1 minute on medium heat. Add dal tadka masala and mix well. Add sufficient water to get the required consistency and mix well.', 'Add the gnocchis and mix well. Cover and cook on medium heat for 15-20 minutes.', 'Adjust salt, add jaggery and coriander leaves and mix till jaggery dissolves. Switch the heat off.', 'Put ladles full of cooked dal dhokli into serving plates and serve hot with khakras.']

title: Pear Payasam with Malpua
method: ['To prepare pear payasam, heat 2 cups milk in a non-stick pan and bring to boil.', 'Grind soaked rice alongwith some water to make a coarse paste. Add it to boiled milk, mix and cook for a minute.', 'Discard stem and bottom of a pear, peel and finely chop. Add to payasam mixture, mix and cook for 3-5 minutes.', 'To prepare malpua, take flour in a bowl. Add baking powder and rabdi and whisk. Add some milk and whisk well to make a smooth batter.', 'Heat sufficient ghee in a kadai.', 'Add saffron to the batter and whisk. Add  1/2  tsp cardamom powder and whisk well.', 'Add castor sugar to payasam mixture and mix. Add remaining cardamom powder, mix and cook till sugar melts.', 'Heat sugar syrup in another non-stick pan. Switch off heat.', 'Put a ladle of malpua batter in hot ghee and shallow-fry till golden. Drain in hot sugar syrup and soak for a minute.', 'Finely slice blanched pistachios.', 'Transfer soaked malpuas on a plate and halve. Put halved malpuas in 2 different serving martini glasses and pour some pear payasam.', 'Serve immediately garnished with sliced pistachios and saffron strands.']

title: Truffle Brownie
method: ['Preheat the oven to 180degC/350degF.', 'Place the butter in a bowl, add sugar and beat together till the sugar dissolves. Melt one hundred and seventy grams of chocolate in the microwave oven for one minute and whisk till smooth.', 'Add to the butter mixture and mix well. Break the eggs into a bowl and whisk them well. Add the vanilla essence and whisk again. Sift the flour and baking powder into the bowl with eggs and whisk with a hand blender.', 'Add the butter-sugar-chocolate mixture and whisk again. Add the walnuts and mix. Pour the batter into silicone moulds and place them in the preheated oven. Bake for twenty to twenty five minutes. When done take them out and set aside to cool a little.', 'Heat the cream and the remaining chocolate in separate bowls in the microwave oven. Whisk the chocolate and add the cream and whisk again till well blended.', 'When the brownies have cooled a little spread the truffle over and serve.']

title: Angoor Aur Khajur Ki Chutney
method: ['Dry roast cumin seeds, cool and powder. Cook together grapes and dates along with few drops of water till the grapes are completely mashed.', 'Add red chilli powder and roasted cumin powder, raisins and cook for five minutes. Add salt and jaggery and mix well till the jaggery is completely dissolved and well blended.', 'Serve at room temperature.']

title: Yogurt Cheese
method: ['Mash chenna in a bowl. Add yogurt and salt and mix well. Refrigerate for 5-10 minutes.', 'Spread parsley, red chilli powder, crushed peanuts and crushed peppercorns on 4 individual plates.', 'Grease your palms with a little oil, divide chenna-yogurt mixture into equal portions and shape into small balls. Roll each of them in the four ingredients separately and place on a serving plate.', 'You can also serve in this manner: fill a small serving bowl with a spoonful of olive oil and place a ball in it.', 'Chill and serve.']

title: Bomras Tomato Salad
method: ['Blanch the tomatoes to remove the skin. Peel and quarter to get 4 slices from each tomato. Remove the seeds.', 'In a bowl massage the tomatoes with tamarind and jaggery water.', 'Toss in all other ingredients into the bowl. Mix well.', 'Garnish with some more garlic chips and serve.']

title: Apple Walnut Salad - SK Khazana
method: ['Slice the apples thinly and set aside.', 'Mix together yogurt, grainy mustard, salt, crushed peppercorns and olive oil in a bowl.', 'Add cabbage, purple cabbage, carrot, radish, celery, cranberries, sliced apples and walnuts and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve immediately.']

title: Pepper Garlic Malai Prawns
method: ['Place prawns in a bowl. Rub lemon juice and salt on them and set aside.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Crush garlic cloves, add to the pan and saute till they become light golden.', 'Add 1 tbsp butter, prawns and mix. Add crushed black peppercorns, mint powder and mix.', 'Add coconut milk, fresh cream and mix well. Cook till the prawns are done.', 'Burn a piece of coal over direct flame. Transfer the prawns into a serving bowl.', 'Place a katori over the prawns. Place the burnt coal in the katori, put the remaining butter on the coal. Add 2 cloves and immediately cover with aluminium foil for smoky effect.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Chicken Caesar Burger
method: ['To make the dressing, take egg yolk in a bowl. Add vinegar and 1 teaspoon garlic and beat well, adding  3/4  cup olive oil gradually, till well combined.Add salt and crushed peppercorns and mix well.', 'Halve burger buns horizontally; apply butter on the inner side of the upper half and on the base bun. Sprinkle 1 teaspoon garlic on each base half.', 'Slit chicken breasts horizontally into halves and place in another bowl. Add 2 teaspoons garlic, crushed peppercorns, salt, chilli flakes and 1 tablespoon olive oil and mix well. Set aside to marinate for 10-15 minutes.', 'Add parmesan cheese powder to the dressing and mix well. Set aside.', 'Heat a griller and grease with butter. Place the bun halves and grill them till marks appear. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Place the marinated chicken on the griller and grill till fully cooked and grill marks appear on both sides.', 'Place some lettuce on each base half of the buns. Top with a grilled chicken piece, sprinkle some parmesan cheese powder and drizzle some dressing. Cover with the top halfof the buns.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Prawn in Black Bean Sauce
method: ['Put prawns in a bowl, add 1 tablespoon soy sauce and salt and mix well. Set aside to marinate.', 'To prepare sauce, heat oil in a non-stick pan, add red chillies and garlic and saute till garlic turns golden.', 'Add marinated prawns and toss. Add black bean sauce, remaining soy sauce and fish stock and mix well.', 'Add onion and capsicum, mix and cook for a minute.', 'Mix cornstarch in some stock to make a smooth slurry, add to the pan and mix well. Add sugar and peanuts and mix well. Cook for a minute.', 'Roughly chop basil leaves, add to the mixture and mix well.', 'Serve hot garnished with a basil leaf.']

title: Mango Thandai
method: ['Boil milk in a deep non-stick pan. Add saffron and castor sugar, stir well and boil further till it reduces to half the original quantity.', 'Grind cardamoms, rose petals, peppercorns and cinnamon to a fine powder. Put it into a bowl.', 'Peel almonds and pistachios and grind them with melon seeds, cashewnuts and poppy seeds to a fine paste with a little water.', 'Add the ground paste to the pan, mix well and boil further. Add ground powder and mix well. Remove from heat and cool.', 'Add the mango pulp and mix well. Refrigerate till chilled. Serve chilled.']

title: Anzac Biscuits -SK Khazana
method: ['Preheat the oven at 180@C. Line a baking tray with parchment sheet and set aside.', 'Take oats in a large bowl and add desiccated coconut. Sieve flour into the bowl and add castor sugar. Mix it all well.', 'Heat butter in a non-stick pan and let it melt. Add golden syrup and mix well.', 'Take baking soda in a small bowl, add 1 tbsp water and mix well. Add it to the pan and mix well till the mixture starts foaming. Take it off the heat and add to the flour mixture and mix till well combined.', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions, shape each into a ball and flatten it slightly. Keep these biscuits on the prepared baking tray.', 'Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 12 minutes. Take them out of the oven and allow to cool down to room temperature.', 'Arrange them on a serving plate and serve or store in an air-tight container.']

title: Chura Vada Pav
method: ['Heat 2 tsps oil in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add curry leaves and saute for  1/2  minute. Transfer into a bowl of mashed potatoes.', 'Add  1/2  tsp turmeric powder, salt, coriander leaves and green chutney and mix well. Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into balls.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Take gram flour in a large bowl, add baking soda, salt, remaining turmeric powder and sufficient water and whisk to a smooth semi-thick batter of coating consistency.', 'Dip each potato ball into the batter till they are well coated, gently slide into hot oil and deep-fry till  3/4  done. Drain onto a plate.', 'For making chura, drizzle the batter into the hot oil and deep fry for a few seconds. Add the  3/4  done vadas and deep fry till the churas and vadas are golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Slit a set of 2 pavs for each portion without cutting through. Drizzle tamarind chutney and green chutney over one half. Sprinkle dry lasoon chutney and fold the pavs so that the other side so that the chutnies get on to the other side too. Place 1 vada between each pav, sprinkle dry lasoon chutney, chopped onions and some churas.', 'Drizzle date and tamarind chutney, green chutney, dry lasoon chutney and sprinkle coriander leaves. Bring the other half over and press gently. Serve immediately.']

title: Cheese Biscuits
method: ['Preheat oven at 180oC. Line a baking tray with parchment paper.', 'Sieve refined flour in a bowl. Add salt, crushed peppercorns and baking soda and mix well. Add cheese and mix well. Add cream, mix and knead into a soft dough.', 'Dust the worktop with some flour, place the prepared dough and roll out into a thick disc. Cut roundels with a medium cookie cutter and place on the parchment paper. Set aside for 10-15 minutes.', 'Put the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 10-15 minutes.', 'Remove from heat, cool and serve.']

title: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Bread
method: ['Preheat oven to 170deg C. Grease a loaf tin with some oil and dust with some flour.', 'Put flour, baking soda, cinnamon powder, nutmeg powder, clove powder and salt in a bowl and mix well.', 'Put eggs, granulated sugar and brown sugar in another bowl and whisk together till combined. Add pumpkin puree, oil and orange juice and mix well. Add this mixture to the flour mixture and mix gently.', 'Fold in the chocolate chips and mix until well combined. Pour the batter into the prepared tin, place the tin in the preheated oven and bake for sixty to sixty-five minutes.', 'Remove from oven and cool. Remove from the mould, slice and serve.']

title: Khoya Matar
method: ['Heat ghee in a non-stick pan. Add cumin seeds and saute till the seeds change colour. Add green chillies and onions, mix and saute till translucent.', 'Add khoya and mix well. Add coriander powder, chilli powder, garam masala powder, fennel powder and salt, mix well and cook for 2 minutes.', 'Add tomatoes and green peas, mix and cook till tomatoes turn soft and pulpy. Add cashewnuts and  1/2  cup water, mix, cover and cook till oil separates.', 'Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.']

title: Cornflakes Crusted Chicken Nuggets
method: ['Cut chicken breasts into cubes.', 'Crush cornflakes and place into a bowl. Add herb mix and paprika powder and mix well.', 'Spread refined flour and breadcrumbs onto two separate plates.', 'Break egg in another bowl and whisk well.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Sprinkle salt and crushed peppercorns on chicken cubes and mix well.', 'Coat chicken cubes in flour, dip in whisked egg, coat in breadcrumbs and finally coat in cornflakes mixture and shape into nuggets.', 'Deep-fry nuggets in medium hot oil till golden. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'To make dip, combine mayonnaise, tomato ketchup, Tabasco sauce, salt and crushed peppercorns into a bowl and mix well.', 'Place Iceberg lettuce on serving dish. Put dip in a small bowl and place on the dish. Arrange nuggets along the bowl and serve immediately.']

title: Burnt Garlic And Mint Chutney
method: ['Heat oil in a pan, add garlic and saute. Sprinkle black salt and saute till well browned.', 'Put the mint leaves into a mixer. Add ginger and green chillies. Add sauteed garlic. Add two tablespoons of water with salt and grind to a fine paste.', 'Add the paste to yogurt and mix well. Add lemon juice and salt and mix. Pass this mixture through a muslin cloth, squeezing well to get a smooth chutney.', 'Serve chilled.']

title: Arbi Seekh Kabab-SK Khazana
method: ['Put colocassia in a pressure cooker, add turmeric powder and sufficient water, close with the lid and cook under pressure till 1 whistle is given out.', 'Blend together dried rose petals, fried onions, cashewnuts and poppy seeds with sufficient water to a fine paste.', 'Open the lid of the cooker when the pressure reduces and drain the colocassia and let them cool down to room temperature.', 'Peel and mash boiled colocassia into a bowl. Add the ground paste, black cardamom powder, clove powder, crushed peppercorns, green cardamom powder, salt and cornflour and mix well. Add coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Grease your palms with some oil and wrap small portions of colocassia mixture around individual seekhs.', 'Heat some ghee in a non-stick pan. Add seekh kababs and shallow-fry, rolling the seekhs occasionally, till golden brown and evenly done from all around.', 'Serve hot with onion rings, lemon slices and green chutney.']

title: Eggs in a Bread Bowl
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add garlic and saute well. Add onion and saute till light brown.', 'Add mixed capsicums, mix and saute for 2 minutes. Add sausages, salt and crushed peppercorns and toss well. Cook for a minute and transfer the mixture into a bowl. Break eggs into the bowl.', 'Discard the top portion of the breads and scoop out to make a bread bowl.', 'Add cheddar cheese and processed cheese to the cooked mixture and mix well.', 'Fill the bread bowl with the egg mixture, place it on a baking tray, place the tray in the preheated oven and bake till the egg is cooked.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Kesari Shrikhand-SK Khazana
method: ['Whisk together hung yogurt and powdered sugar in a bowl till smooth and creamy.', 'Add saffron milk and whisk till well blended. Add nutmeg powder and cardamom powder and mix well. Refrigerate to chill.', 'Garnish with almonds, pistachios, saffron and serve chilled.']

title: Dahi Wale Aloo
method: ['Take potato cubes in a bowl, add salt, red chilli powder and turmeric powder and mix well.', 'Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and saute till their colour changes. Add green chillies and asafoetida and mix well.', 'Add potatoes and mix well. Add sugar and coriander leaves and mix well. Add 1 cup water and a pinch of salt and mix well. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.', 'Add lemon juice, and mix well. Take the pan off the heat and transfer into a bowl. Add yogurt and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve.']

title: Kadalai Paruppu Chutney
Main ingredients: Split Bengal gram (chana dal), Garlic, Onion, Tomato,Tamarind, Scraped fresh coconut, Coconut oil, Split skinless black gram, Mustard seeds, Curry leaves

title: Cabbage Parantha
method: ['Take whole wheat flour in a mixing bowl, add gram flour, carom seeds, green chillies, asafoetida, red chilli powder and salt. Add cabbage and coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Add sufficient milk and knead into semi soft dough. Add oil and knead again. Cover the dough with a damp muslin cloth and rest for 10-15 minutes.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions and shape them into balls. Dust each ball with a little dry flour and roll out into a parantha.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa on medium heat. Place a parantha on it and cook for 1 minute. Flip, apply a little ghee and flip again. Apply a little ghee on the other side too and continue to cook, turning sides, till both sides are evenly cooked. Similarly, make more paranthas with the remaining dough.', 'Place them on serving plates and serve hot with a pickle of your choice.']

title: Pear Bread Pudding
method: ['Preheat oven to 180deg C.', 'Take vanilla custard powder in a bowl, add milk and mix till smooth. Pour into a deep non-stick pan and cook, stirring intermittently, till thick.', 'Quarter pears, remove core and slice roughly.', 'Heat butter in another non-stick pan, add pear slices and saute. Add raisins and 3 tbsps sugar and mix.', 'Slice fruit buns and spread one layer in a baking dish.', 'Add remaining sugar to the custard and mix.', 'Put the sauteed pears over the bun layer in the dish. Place another layer of fruit bun slices.', 'Pour the custard over and tap the dish lightly so that custard drizzles to the bottom of the dish.', 'Serve warm.Keep the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes. Serve hot.']

title: Lilva Rice
method: ['Grind ginger, green chillies, coriander leaves and lemon juice to a smooth paste.', 'Heat ghee in a pan, add cinnamon, cloves and rice and saute for two to three minutes.', 'Add surti papdi and the papdi beans along with salt and mix.', 'Add the ground paste diluted in half cup of water. Mix well.', 'Add two and a half cups of water and mix.', 'Once the mixture comes to a boil, reduce heat, cover and let it cook till done.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Cajun Prawn Wrap
ingredients: ['4 large whole wheat rotis', '200 grams small prawns, peeled and deveined', '1 1/2  teaspoons Cajun spice', '1 tablespoon oil', '1 tablespoon chopped garlic', '3-4 spring onion bulbs, sliced', 'Salt to taste', 'Crushed black peppercorns to taste', 'Mayonnaise for spreading', ' 1/4  medium purple cabbage, shredded', '1 medium carrot, peeled and cut into thin strips', '1 medium cucumber, peeled, deseeded and sliced', 'Tomato ketchup for serving']
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add garlic and spring onion bulbs and saute for 1 minute.', 'Add prawns, mix and cook for 1 minute. Add salt, crushed peppercorns and Cajun spice, mix and cook till prawns are done. Transfer on a plate.', 'Warm the rotis on a non-stick tawa and transfer on a plate.', 'Spread some mayonnaise on each roti. Put some shredded purple cabbage, carrot strips, cucumber slices and cooked prawns mixture in the center and roll.', 'Serve with tomato ketchup.']

title: Herb Garlic Bread - SK Khazana
method: ['Put yeast in a bowl, add castor sugar and 2 tablespoons warm water, mix well and set aside to activate.', 'Sift flour in another bowl. Add garlic, fresh herbs and activated yeast and mix well.', 'Add some water and knead well. Transfer the dough onto the worktop, add butter and knead to a soft dough. Transfer the dough into the same bowl, cover with a damp muslin cloth and set aside to prove for 20 minutes.', 'Preheat oven to 180degC.', 'Transfer the dough back onto the worktop, add oil and knead lightly. Shape into a loaf and keep it on a baking tray. Cover with a damp muslin cloth and set aside to prove for 20 minutes.', 'Brush the dough with some milk and sprinkle garlic powder and dried herbs on top. Put the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes.', 'Brush some butter on top and serve.']

title: Fajita
method: ['Mix together capsicum strips, mixed zucchini, cottage cheese, salt, dried mixed herbs, Mexican sauce and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a bowl. Set aside to marinate for 5 minutes.', 'Heat  1/2  tablespoon olive oil in a non-stick pan. Put marinated cottage cheese strips and on one side and remaining vegetables on the other side of the pan and saute them for 2-3 minutes.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa.  Place each tortillas and warm them from both sides, basting with some olive oil. Transfer on the worktop.', 'To prepare one fajita, put 2-3 tablespoons refried beans in the center of the warm tortilla. Place one lollo rosso and iceberg lettuce leaves on top. Put some sauteed vegetables and cottage cheese on top. Drizzle some sour cream and roll it.', 'Serve immediately.']

title: Fried Cheese Burger
Main ingredients: Mozzarella cheese, Mini burger bungs, Breadcrumbs, Garlic powder, Onion powder, Dried mixed herbs, Refined flour, Oil

title: Coconut Buttermilk Pound Cake
method: ['Preheat oven to 180degC. Grease a cake tin with some butter and dust with some flour.', 'Mix together flour, baking powder and salt in a bowl.', 'Cream together butter and sugar in another bowl till light and fluffy. Add vanilla essence and mix. Add eggs, one at a time, and beat well.', 'Add flour mixture and fold in well. Add buttermilk and beat till well combined. Add 1 1/4  cups coconut and fold in well.', 'Pour the batter into the prepared tin, place the tin in the preheated oven and bake for 60 minutes. Remove from oven, cool and demould.', 'Dry roast the remaining coconut in a non-stick pan till golden brown.', 'Sprinkle the roasted coconut on the cake, slice and serve.']

title: Adana Kabab
method: ['Finely chop capsicum.', 'Take mutton mince in a bowl. Add chopped capsicum, onion, all-spice powder, paprika powder, salt and crushed peppercorns and mix well.', 'Finely chop parsley and add. Mix well and set aside for 1 hour.', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into kababs.', 'Heat some oil in anon-stick grill pan. Place the kababs on it and grill till evenly golden from both sides.', 'Place a thin flat bread on a serving plate. Put the kababs on it and serve hot with your choice of salad.']

title: Gulab Jamun Icecream
method: ['Dissolve cornflour in a little cold milk. Heat the remaining milk in a pan.', 'Meanwhile in another pan heat sugar with a few drops of water and caramelize. Add fresh cream to the boiling milk and mix. Add sugar and continue to boil.', 'Add the dissolved cornflour and stir continuously to avoid lumps. Boil for ten more minutes.', 'Strain through a muslin cloth. Add icecream essence to the icecream mix and mix well. Dissolve GMS and CMC in a little water and add to the mixture and mix well. Strain again if there are any lumps remaining.', 'Pour the ice cream mixture into an ice-cream tin. Add some gulab jamuns, mix, cover with the lid and put in the deep freezer to set.', 'Take out after an hour or two. Open the lid, add some more gulab jamuns on top.', 'Again keep it in the deep freezer to set. Allow to set for ten to twelve hours. Demould, slice and serve when firmly set.']

title: Lemon Risotto
method: ['Heat the oil in a non stick pan, add the onions and rice and saute for a couple of minutes.', 'Add the garlic and continue to saute for another couple of minutes. Add half cup of vegetable stock, lemon zest and salt and stir. Once this stock is absorbed add more stock, cover and cook.', 'Continue in this way till all the stock is used up.', 'Add two tablespoons parmesan cheese and broccoli and mix. Add the lemon juice and mix. Cover and cook for two to three minutes. Add the butter and mix.', 'Sprinkle the remaining parmesan cheese over the top and serve hot.']

title: Cheela - SK Khazana
method: ['Spread green chillies and coriander leaves in 2 separate microwave safe plates and microwave for 4-5 minutes or till dried completely.', 'Take gram flour in a large bowl, add dried green chillies, dried coriander leaves, onion flakes, salt, baking soda, red chilli powder, carom seeds, black pepper powder and asafoetida and mix well. Add turmeric powder and mix well, store in an air tight container for up to 21 days.', 'To make the cheela, mix together  1/2  cup of the premix and add 1 cup water and whisk till smooth. Add  1/2  cup water and mix well.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa, drizzle oil on it and pour a ladle full of batter and spread it evenly. Drizzle a little oil on the sides and cook for 2-3 minutes or till golden, flip the cheela and cook further for 1-2 minutes. Make more cheelas in the same way.\nServe hot with yogurt and tomato ketchup.']

title: Himachali Rara Gosht - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat oil in a pressure cooker, add onion and saute till translucent.', 'Add mutton and mix well. Add ginger-garlic paste, salt and sufficient water, mix well. Cover and cook for 4-5 whistles.', 'Once the pressure settles down, open the lid and add tomato, garam masala powder, red chilli powder, cumin powder, coriander powder and cook for 5-10 minutes.', 'Add yogurt and mix well. Add mutton mince, mix well and cook for 25-30 minutes.', 'Add coriander leaves, mix well and cook for 5 minutes. Transfer into a serving dish, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.']

title: Lau Chingri - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat 3-4 tbsps oil in a deep non-stick pan and add cumin seeds, halve the dried red chilli and add. Mix well and saute till the cumin seeds change colour. Reduce heat, add ginger-garlic paste, mix well and saute till the mixture loses its raw smell. Add  1/4  tsp turmeric powder, mix well and saute for 1 minute', 'Drain and add bottle gourd and mix well. Increase heat and cook.', 'Take prawns in a small bowl, add remaining turmeric powder and salt and mix well.', 'Heat remaining oil in another non-stick pan.', 'Cover the bottle gourd and let it cook. Add prawns to the second pan, reduce heat and shallow-fry till the prawns turn pink.', 'Add salt, sugar and green chillies to the bottle gourd mixture, mix well and cook for 1 minute.', 'Add fried prawns and mix well, cover and cook for 5 minutes or till the bottle gourd is soft.', 'Transfer lau chingri into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.']

title: Date and Walnut Spring Rolls
method: ['Heat sufficient oil in a deep pan.', 'Combine dates and walnuts in a bowl and mix well. Set aside.', 'Dissolve flour in some water to make a thick slurry.', 'Take each spring roll sheet, take some date-walnut mixture and shape into a thin roll. Place the filling in the center of sheet, roll and apply some slurry on the edges to seal.', 'Deep-fry each roll in hot oil till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange rolls on a serving plate, sprinkle some sesame seeds and drizzle some honey on top and serve hot.']

title: Bavarian Salad
method: ['To make dressing, combine yogurt, mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt, chilli flakes and mustard powder in a bowl. Whisk well.', 'Combine cabbage, carrot, capsicum and celery in another bowl and toss well. Add dressing and mix well. Add cheese cubes and toss to mix. Refrigerate for 15-20 minutes.', 'Serve chilled on a bed of Romaine lettuce.']

title: Sushila
ingredients: ['4 cups puffed rice', '3 tablespoons oil', '3 tablespoons raw peanuts', '1 teaspoon mustard seeds', '2 teaspoons cumin seeds', '12-16 curry leaves', '2 large onions, chopped', 'Salt to taste', '1 teaspoon turmeric powder', '1 teaspoon sugar', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves', 'Fresh coriander sprig for garnish']
method: ['Take puffed rice in a strainer and rinse well.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add peanuts and fry on medium heat for 2 minutes or till golden brown and crisp. Drain and set aside in a small bowl.', 'Add mustard seeds to the oil remaining in the pan and once they start to splutter, add cumin seeds, curry leaves and green chillies, mix and saute for 30 seconds.', 'Add onion, mix and saute till translucent. Add salt, turmeric powder and mix well. Saute for 30 seconds.', 'Add sugar, puffed rice and mix well. Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes on medium heat.', 'Add fried peanuts, coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot garnished with coriander sprig.']
Main ingredients: Puffed rice, Raw peanuts, Mustard seeds, Cumin seeds, Curry leaves, Onions, Turmeric powder, Sugar, Fresh coriander leaves

title: Babycorn Manchurian
method: ['Cut babycorns in to 1 inch pieces and transfer into a bowl.', 'Finely chop green chillies and spring onion greens. Thinly slice spring onion bulbs.', 'Add salt,  1/2  tsp dark soy sauce, ginger-garlic paste, refined flour and cornflour to the babycorns and mix well.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai, slide in the babycorns and deep-fry till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'To make the gravy, heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick wok. Add garlic, ginger, and green chillies and saute till golden brown.', 'Add spring onion bulbs and saute till translucent. Add vegetable stock and mix well.', 'Add remaining dark soy sauce, red chilli sauce salt and sugar and mix well. Let it come to a boil.', 'Add cornflour slurry and mix well. Cook till the mixture thickens.', 'Add the fried baby corns and  1/2  the chopped spring onion greens and mix well. Add vinegar and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving plate, garnish with remaining chopped spring onion greens and serve hot with fried rice.']

title: Junglee Paneer Sandwich - SK Khazana
method: ['Take cottage cheese cubes in a large bowl, add carrots, onion, green chilli, coriander leaves, green chutney, salt and mayonnaise and mix well.', 'Apply butter on one side of all the bread slices, place a portion of the stuffing on 4 slices and cover with the remaining slices with the butter side facing down.', 'Heat a griller. Apply butter on top of all the sandwiches, place them, butter side downwards, and apply butter on the other side too.', 'Grill till the sandwiches till golden and crisp on both sides.', 'Cut them into triangles and transfer them onto a serving plate. Serve hot with French fries and tomato ketchup.']

title: Dark Chocolate And Banana Cake
method: ['Preheat oven to 180degC.', 'Sieve together maida, cocoa powder, baking powder and baking soda in a bowl. In another bowl, whisk together eggs and castor sugar. Whisk till the mixture becomes light, fluffy and creamy.', 'Add milk and 1 tbsp rum and whisk well. Add clarified butter and whisk. Slowly add the maida and cocoa powder mixture and whisk well. Cover the lower portion of a loose bottom cake tin with an aluminium foil.', 'Pour the batter into the cake tin. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-20 minutes. Take it out of the oven and set aside to cool for a while. Melt butter in a non-stick pan. Then add brown sugar and cook till the sugar becomes soft.', 'Add remaining rum and banana pieces and cook till the banana pieces become soft. Cut the cake into two pieces horizontally. Place the lower half of the cake in a plate and spread half the whipped cream and half the banana sauce over it. Place the other h', 'Serve hot or cold.']

title: Iced Mocha Coffee
method: ['Put a coffee capsule into the coffee machine and switch it on.', 'Collect one shot. Put another capsule and take one more shot. Put the decoction into a mixer jar.', 'Add cocoa powder, sugar and milk and blend. Add ice cubes and blend again till the ice gets crushed.', 'Pour into tall glasses and serve immediately.']

title: Mahi Murgh
method: ['Dry roast coriander seeds and cumin seeds in a non stick pan. Add peanuts, sesame seeds, poppy seeds and roast till fragrant. Add desiccated coconut and roast for 1 minute more. Heat oil in another non stick pan, add onions and saute till lightly browned. Add ginger and garlic pastes and saute.', 'Cool the roasted spices slightly and grind to a smooth paste with  1/2  cup water. When the onion-garlic-ginger mixture browns, add chicken, turmeric powder, red chilli powder and salt and mix well. Add the ground masala and 1 cup water. Mix well. Add tamarind pulp, jaggery and mix well. Cover and cook till the chicken is completely cooked. Serve hot.']

title: Koraishutir Kochuri with Cholar Dal
ingredients: ['1 cup blanched and crushed green peas (koraishuti)', 'Refined flour (maida) dough as required', '1 cup split Bengal gram (cholar/chana dal), blanched', '1 tablespoon ghee', ' 1/2  teaspoon fennel seeds (saunf)', ' 1/2  inch ginger, finely chopped', '1-2 green chillies, finely chopped', 'Salt to taste', '1 teaspoon sugar', '3-4 cloves', ' 1/2  inch cinnamon', '1 bay leaf', ' 1/2  teaspoon cumin seeds (jeera)', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh coconut', ' 1/4  teaspoon turmeric powder', '6-8 raisins', '1 1/2  cups Bengal gram (chana dal) water', ' 1/2  tablespoon oil + for deep-frying', '1 dried red chilli, broken', '1-2 green chillies, slit']
method: ['To make the stuffing, heat  1/2  tablespoon ghee in a non-stick pan. Add fennel seeds, ginger and chopped green chillies and saute for 30 seconds.', 'Add green peas, salt and  1/2  teaspoon sugar, mix and saute till the moisture dries. Remove from pan and cool.In the same pan, heat  1/2  tablespoon ghee. Add cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf, cumin seeds and coconut and saute till the coconut turns golden brown.', 'Add turmeric powder and Bengal gram and mix well. Add remaining sugar, salt and raisins and cook for a minute. Add Bengal gram water, stir and bring to a boil.', 'Heat  1/2  tablespoon oil in a small non-stick tempering pan. Add dried red chillies and slit green chillies, saute for 15 seconds and pour over the Bengal gram. Simmer for 4-5 minutes.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions and stuff with some cooked green peas mixture. Dip the stuffed portions in hot oil and roll out into small discs.', 'Deep-fry in hot oil till golden brown and drain on an absorbent paper.']

title: Thandai Mousse
method: ['Heat milk in a non-stick pan, remove 2 tbsps milk from the pan and add it to the gelatin in a small bowl and mix well.', 'When milk comes to a boil, add thandai mixture and condensed milk and mix well.', 'Pour the mixture into a bowl and keep the bowl in an ice bath.', 'Strain gelatin mixture into the mixture and mix well. Add lemon rind mix well.', 'Add whipped cream and mix till the mixture is lump free.', 'Pour the mixture into each martini glasses and drizzle 1 tsp Rooh afza on top and refrigerate it for 2-3 hours or until set.', 'Serve chilled.']

title: Potato Omelette
method: ['Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a non stick pan. Add quarter of the grated potato and spread into a fairly thick and even layer. Sprinkle a little salt and let it cook on low heat. Chop onion, tomato and spring onion greens.', 'Drizzle a little olive oil over the potatoes and when the underside is lightly browned, flip it over carefully and cook. Place a quarter of the onion-tomato mixture in the centre and sprinkle a quarter of the cheese over. When the cheese begins to melt, fold one side over the topping and cook till golden.', 'Make more omelettes similarly. Serve hot immediately.']

title: Khowsuey
method: ['Heat a deep non-stick pan, add gram flour and roast it on medium heat, stirring continuously, till raw smell disappears and the colour changes to light brown.', 'Switch off heat and transfer the gram flour into a blender jar. Add coconut milk, a little water, green chilli paste and salt and blend to a fine mixture.', 'Heat another deep non-stick pan, add blended mixture and  1/2  cup water and mix well. . Let it come to a boil on low heat, stirring occasionally.', 'Add sliced baby corns, green zucchini, broccoli and carrot,mix well and let it cook for 4-5 minutes.', 'Put some of this gravy into each serving bowl, add some noodles, spring onion greens and bulbs, fried sliced onion, , some fried noodles, peanuts, fried garlic slices, red chilli flakes, black pepper powder and some lemon juice and serve hot.']

title: Pineapple Upside Down Cake
method: ['Preheat the oven to 190oC/375oF/Gas Mark 5. Grease and line a nine-inch round cake tin. Mix soft butter and demerara sugar and spread it in at the bottom of the cake tin. Arrange a layer of pineapple slices over the butter sugar mixture.', 'For the cake batter, sift together the flour and baking powder. Beat the egg yolks in a small bowl; mix in the butter and vanilla essence. Whisk the egg whites until stiff but not dry.', 'Fold in the sifted sugar, one tablespoon at a time. Fold the egg yolk mixture into the egg whites, then fold in the sifted flour, one fourth cup at a time.', 'Pour the batter over the pineapple slices and bake in the tin and bake for about half an hour. Allow to cool a little before removing from the tin.', 'Turn the cake upside- down, onto a serving dish with the glazed pineapple slices on top.']

title: Stuffed Roast Chicken
method: ['Take whole chicken with skin. Remove neck and clean the inside. Wash it thoroughly and wipe dry. Apply salt inside and outside.', 'Peel, wash and chop onions. Clean, wash and chop button mushrooms. Wash and grate the pear and apple. Wash and cut chicken liver into small pieces. Chop cashewnuts and walnuts. Break eggs and beat them lightly.', 'Preheat the oven to 200degC.', 'Heat oil in a pan. Add onions, mushrooms and stir. Add grated pear and apple to the onion and mushroom mixture. Add liver and stir. Add salt and pepper powder and stir. Add chopped cashewnuts and walnuts.', 'Place breadcrumbs in a bowl and add milk. Mix well. Add beaten eggs and mix. Add pepper powder and salt to taste. Add to the cooked mixture and mix well.', 'Put the stuffing inside the chicken and press slightly. Tie the legs and fold in the wings.', 'Put the stuffed chicken on a rack and bake in the preheated oven for thirty to forty minutes at 200degC. Baste with butter or oil in between twice or thrice.', 'When done, take it out and let it cool slightly before carving into slices.']

title: Root Vegetables Medley
method: ['Preheat the oven to 170degC.', 'Heat oil in a deep non stick pan. Add onions, ginger and garlic and saute till light brown. Add tomatoes and salt and continue to saute for two to three minutes.', 'Add red chilli powder, cumin powder, black pepper powder and clove powder and mix. Saute for one minute.', 'Add one cup water, tomato ketchup and fresh red chillies and mix. Add potatoes, carrot and green peas and mix.', 'Arrange the bread slices over the top to cover the vegetables completely. Cover and cook the pan in the preheated oven for about forty minutes. You can also keep the pan on a heated tawa and cook for thirty five to forty minutes.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Cheela Quesadilla
method: ['Take moong dal chilla mix in a bowl, add 1 1/2  cups of water and whisk well into a smooth batter.', 'Heat a little oil on a non-stick tawa and spread it all over the tawa with a damp tissue. Pour a ladle full of batter and spread it, drizzle some oil all around and on top and cook until the underside turns golden brown. Flip it over and cook for 2-3 minutes on other side as well. Set aside and similarly make one more chilla.', 'Sprinkle half the processed cheese and mozzarella cheese on top of this chilla, spread rajma masala, green capsicum, red capsicum, yellow capsicum and onions.', 'Sprinkle remaining processed cheese and mozzarella cheese on top. Cover with another chilla and press gently and cook for 1 minute. Flip and cook on the other side for 1 minute.', 'Transfer onto a serving plate, cut into quarters and serve hot with micro greens and tomato salsa.']

title: Dates and Anjeer Modak
method: ['Put pistachios, raisins and almonds in a food processor and process to a coarse powder. Add dried coconut, poppy seeds and green cardamom powder and process to a coarse paste.', 'Transfer the coarse paste into a large bowl and mix. Take a portion of the mixture and stuff into a modak mould, gently press and demould. *', 'Arrange the dates and anjeer modaks on a serving plate and serve.']

title: Mantu - SK Khazana
method: ['To make the yogurt sauce, take yogurt in a large bowl, add garlic paste, squeeze the juice of  1/2  lemon and add salt. Mix well and set aside.', 'Heat ghee in a non-stick pan, add garlic and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add onions, mix well and saute till translucent.', 'Add mutton mince, mix breaking the lumps, and saute on high heat for 2-3 minutes. Add salt, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chilli powder, garam masala powder and black pepper powder, mix well and saute till the mince is cooked.', 'Add mint leaves, coriander leaves and squeeze the juice of remaining  1/2  lemon, mix well and saute for a few seconds. Take the pan off the heat, transfer into a bowl and set aside to cool.', 'Place a portion of the mince mixture in the centre of each wonton sheet, apply a little water on the edges, bring the opposite corners together and pinch to seal and shape into mantu.', 'Heat sufficient water in the lower pan a steamer, grease the upper pan, place the mantus in it, cover and steam for 10-15 minutes.', 'To make the dal, heat ghee in another non-stick pan. Add garlic and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add onions, mix and saute till golden brown.', 'Add turmeric powder, garam masala powder, salt, coriander powder ,cumin powder and  1/2  cup water and mix well.', 'Add tamarind pulp and mix well. Add Bengal gram, mix well. Add  3/4  cup water, mix and cook till the mixture thickens. Add mint leaves and mix well. Take it off the heat.', 'Remove the mantus from the steamer and place on a plate.', 'To serve, spread some yogurt sauce in a circle on a serving plate and place the mantus on top.', 'Drizzle yogurt sauce on top of each mantu and top it with dal mixture . Garnish each mantu with a mint sprig and serve immediately.']

title: Jain Veg Ring
method: ['Preheat the oven to 180oC.', 'Cut bread slices into roundels with a round cookie cutter.', 'Place a smaller round cutter in the middle of four bigger roundels and cut to get the shape of a doughnut.', 'Put cottage cheese, capsicum, tomato, green chillies, crushed black peppercorn, salt, oregano, chilli flakes and coriander leaves in a bowl and mix well.', 'Add one tablespoon of cheese and mix again.', 'Mix butter, cheese and tomato ketchup in another bowl to make a paste.', 'Take a bigger bread roundel and apply the butter-ketchup mixturegenerously and place the doughnut shaped roundels over these roundels.', 'Top it with butter and cheese mixture generously.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for about seven to eight minutes.', 'Serve hot with tomato ketchup.']

title: Puff Pastry
method: ['Preheat oven at 210oC.', 'Take the flour on the worktop and make well in the centre. Pour in 250 ml chilled water, salt and softened butter and work together with your fingertips.', 'When all ingredients are well mixed, work the dough with the palm of your hand until it is completely homogenous, but not too firm. Wrap in the cling film and chill in the fridge for 2-3 hours.', 'Dust the worktopwith some flour and roll the dough in four different places. Roll the dough in to thin sheet.', '5. Spread  1/4  cup margarine evenly on the rolled sheet and fold to make a book fold. And chilled in the fridge for 15 minutes.', 'Dust the worktopwith some flour and progressively roll the dough gently away from you in to a rectangle spread another  1/4  cup of margarine and fold over the ends and make 3 layers.', 'Wrap the dough in a cling film and place it in the fridge for 15 minutes to rest and firm up. Make 4 more turns bringing total to 6. This pastry is now ready to use.', 'Once you have cut the puff pastry in to your desired shape, you must let it rest in a cool place for at least 30 minutes before baking.', 'Bake the puff pastry in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes. Use as required.']

title: Roasted Garlic and Potato Soup
ingredients: ['10-12 garlic cloves', '3-4 medium potatoes, boiled, peeled and grated', '1 teaspoon oil', ' 1/4  cup butter', '1 cup chopped onions', 'A few fresh thyme sprigs + for garnishing', ' 1/4  cup refined flour (maida)', '4 cups vegetable stock', '1 cup milk', ' 1/4  cup heavy cream', 'Salt, to taste', 'Crushed black peppercorns, to taste', 'Fresh cream, for garnishing']
method: ['Preheat oven to 180deg C.', 'Spread the garlic cloves on a baking tray and drizzle oil on top. Place the tray in the preheated oven and roast well.', 'Heat butter in a non-stick pan. Add onions, thyme and cook for 3-4 minutes or till the onions turn translucent.', 'Add flour, mix well and cook for 1 minute. Add vegetable stock, milk, cream, salt and crushed peppercorns, stir and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 2-3 minutes, mixing at intervals.', 'Add potatoes and roasted garlic cloves and mix. Blend with a hand blender till smooth.', 'Serve warm garnished with some cream and thyme sprig.']

title: Choco Ragi Cake
method: ['Preheat oven at 180degC.', 'Put chocolate and butterin a bowl and melt on a double boiler. Set it aside to cool completely.', 'Break eggs into a bowl and whisk them till light and fluffy. Add castorsugar, little by little, and continue whisking till well combined.', 'Pour chocolate mixture into the egg and sugar mixture and whisk well.', 'Sift together ragi flour and baking powder into it and mix well.', 'Add whisky and mix well. Transfer the mixture into a baking tin, level it out, place the tin in the preheated oven and bake for fifty-five minutes. Remove from oven, cool and remove from the tin.', 'Cut into slices and serve.']

title: Bhugi
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add onions and saute till golden.', 'Add green chillies, ginger and asafoetida and mix well. Add little water and mix well.', 'Add garam masala powder, chilli powder and coriander powder and mix well. Add little water, mix and cook till the oil separates.', 'Add brinjal, potatoes and green peas and mix well. Add little water, mix, cover and cook till the vegetables are fully done.', 'Add salt, mix well and let it get heated through.', 'Serve hot garnished with a coriander sprig.']

title: Lachcha Parantha
method: ['Take whole wheat flour in a mixing bowl, add salt, crush and add carom seeds and add 1 1/2  tsps ghee and mix well. Add sufficient water gradually and knead into soft dough. Apply a little ghee on the surface of dough, cover with a damp muslin cloth and rest it for 10-15 minutes.', 'Divide dough into big equal portions and shape them into balls. Dust the worktop with some dry flour, keep each ball on it, flatten it slightly and roll out into a big thin disc.', 'Apply 1 tsp ghee on top of each disc with your hand. Sprinkle a little dry flour and spread it with a light hand. Starting from one end, make pleats just like one does to make a Japanese paper fan and press lightly after each pleat. Stretch the dough slightly and start rolling from one end to the other and shove the end into the centre of the roll. Make more rolls similarly with the remaining balls. Rest these rolls for 5 minutes.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa.', 'Sprinkle a little dry flour on the worktop and roll out each roll with a light hand into a not too thin parantha. Dampen your fingers and rub them lightly on the top of each parantha. Crush and sprinkle some dried mint leaves. Crush and sprinkle some kasuri methi. Dampen your fingers again and lightly dab on top the leaves so that they stick to the parantha.', 'Place one lachcha paratha at a time, the leaf side upwards, on it and cook on medium heat till the underside gets light golden brown specs on it. Flip and cook till the other side is similarly done.', 'Apply1 tsp ghee on top, turn it over and apply 1 tsp ghee on other side too and cook, turning side till both sides are a nice golden brown.', 'Crush each parantha in between palms to separate the layers and arrange them on a serving plate. Drizzle some ghee on top and serve hot with pickle.']

title: Sausages Stuffed Tortillas
method: ['Deseed and cut red and yellow capsicums into thin strips.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add capsicum strip and salt and toss. Saute for a minute and transfer into a bowl.', 'Cut sausages lengthwise and saute in the same pan till golden all around and transfer into another bowl.', 'Put mayonnaise and mustard in another bowl and mix well. Add very little water and mix well.', 'Heat tortillas on a non-stick pan.', 'Roughly shred lettuce leaves.', 'Place tortillas on a worktop. Put some shredded lettuce and sauteed capsicums on top. Place 4 sausage slices on each and drizzle generous amount of mayonnaise-mustard mixture on top. Cover with 2 cheese slices on each and roll tightly.', 'Serve immediately.']

title: Hercules Bar
ingredients: ['1 cup walnuts', '3 tablespoons ghee + for greasing', '1 cup finger millet (nachni) flour', ' 1/2  cup roasted peanuts', '1 cup Indian gooseberry (amla) candies', '1 1/2  cups chopped jaggery', ' 1/2  teaspoon green cardamom powder']

title: Jain Vegetable Handvo
method: ['Combine handvo flour and yogurt in a bowl. Add water as required and whisk well into a thick smooth batter.', 'Add green peas, bottle gourd, capsicum, corn and green chillies and mix well. Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder, sugar and salt and mix well. Add little water and mix well.', 'Heat some oil in a non-stick pan.', 'Add fruit salt to the batter and mix well.', 'Add  1/2  teaspoon mustard seeds and 1 teaspoon sesame seeds in the pan and when the seeds start to splutter, pour a ladleful of batter on it and spread into a 1 inch thick large disc. Cover and cook on the underside for 5-10 minutes.', 'Flip, drizzle some more oil all around, cover and cook on the other side for 3-4 minutes. Similarly prepare the rest of the handvos.', 'Cut into wedges and serve hot.']

title: Exotic Vegetable Soft Tacos
method: ['To prepare vegetable mixture, heat olive oil in a non-stick pan. Add garlic, mix and saute for 30 seconds. Add onions, mix and saute till golden.', 'Add zucchini,  1/2  bell peppers, jalapenos, salt and toss to mix well. Add corn kernels, broccoli, tomato, crushed peppercorns and toss to mix. Switch off the heat and add chopped coriander, mix and cook for a minute.', 'To prepare salad topping, slice jalapeno.', 'Take red cabbage in a bowl. Add sliced jalapenos, salt, crushed peppercorns and olive oil and mix well. Add chopped coriander and mix well.', 'Deseed and slice avocado. Take in another bowl, add salt and lemon juice and mix well. Refrigerate to chill.', 'Add lemon juice to the prepared salad, mix and refrigerate to chill.', 'Heat the tortillasin a non-stick pan.Shape them into tacos and fill with prepared vegetable mixture. Top withprepared salad, avocado slices and some goat cheese.', 'Serve immediately.']

title: Strawberry Tiramisu
method: ['Take mascarpone cream cheese in a bowl and whisk it till smooth. Add coffee decoction, 2 tbsps melted chocolate and whisk together. Add the melted gelatin and mix. Fold in whipped cream and keep the bowl in a refrigerator to set.', 'Boil sufficient water in a deep non-stick pan, place a fitting bowl on it. Put egg yolks in the bowl, add the sugar and whisk for 3-4 minutes or till the sugar melts and the mixture becomes light.', 'Halve the chocolate sponge horizontally. Cut 4 pieces with a rectangular cutter mould. Keep the pieces at the base of 4 rectangular moulds. Arrange most of the strawberry pieces over the cake and chill for a while.', 'Cool the egg yolk mixture slightly and fold into the mascarpone cream mixture and chill again. Pour this mixture over the cake pieces and keep them in the refrigerator to set. When completely set unmould them onto a serving plate.', 'Drizzle the remaining melted chocolate over them and sprinkle cocoa powder through a small sieve.', 'Decorate with the remaining strawberry slices and serve immediately.']

title: Junglee Mutton - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat ghee in a deep pan, add dried red chillies and garlic cloves and saute for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add mutton and saute on high heat for 3-4 minutes. Add salt, coriander powder and mix well.', 'Add 5-6 cups water, mix well and let it come to a boil. Cover and cook on medium heat for 35-40 minutes or till the mutton is completely cooked.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprigs and lemon wedges and serve hot.']

title: Quick Chicken Biryani
method: ['Take chicken in a bowl, add salt, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, 2 tsps chicken masala, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, 2 tbsps coriander leaves, green chillies, 15 mint leaves and 3 tbsps fried onions and mix so that all the chicken pieces are well coated. Set aside to marinate for 10-15 minutes.', 'Meanwhile to make the rice, heat plenty of water in a deep non-stick pan, add 1 black cardamom, break open and add green cardamoms, bay leaf, cinnamon and salt and let the water to come to a boil.', 'Add rice and cook till  3/4  done.
