title: Badam ka Halwa
method: ['Put the peeled California Almonds in an electric chopper and chop coarsely.', 'Heat  1/2  cup ghee in a non-stick pan, add semolina and cook till light golden and fragrant. Add the almonds and mix well and continue to cook till the mixture turns golden and fragrant.', 'Add 1 cup water, mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add saffron and mix. Add milk, mix and cook, stirring continuously, for 2-3 minutes or till the mixture thickens.', 'Add sugar, mix and cook, stirring continuously, till the sugar melts and the mixture thickens.', 'Drizzle remaining ghee along the sides of the pan, mix, cook for 2-3 minutes and take the pan off the heat.', 'Transfer the badam ka halwa into a serving bowl, garnish with slivered California Almonds and serve hot.']

title: Chicken Club Sandwich
method: ['Combine chicken and mayonnaise in a bowl. Mix well.', 'Add pepper powder, chilli sauce, salt and mix well.', 'Toast bread slices in a toaster.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Crack eggs one by one in the pan and double fry them. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Place two toasted slices on a worktop. Spread butter on one side of each toast and spread chicken mixture on one of them. Cover with another toast, place 2 tablespoons grated cheese and 4-5 tomato slices on top. Sprinkle pepper powder on top and place a fried egg on it. Sprinkle little salt and pepper powder on the fried egg. Butter the third toast and place it over egg. Press and cut into triangles. Make remaining sandwiches in the similar way.', 'Serve with potato chips and tomato ketchup.']

title: Madras Mutton Fry
ingredients: ['750 grams mutton, cut into 2 inch pieces on the bone', '1 1/2  tablespoons Madras curry powder', '4 tablespoons oil', 'Salt to taste', ' 3/4  teaspoon turmeric powder', '1 inch ginger, roughly chopped', '8-10 garlic cloves', '2 green chillies', '4-5 dried red chillies', '1 star anise', '4-5 green cardamoms', '10-12 black peppercorns', ' 1/2  inch cinnamon', ' 1/2  teaspoon mustard seeds', '20-25 shallots, peeled', '10-15 curry leaves', '1 1/2  teaspoons red chilli powder', '2-3 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves', 'Fried curry leaves for garnish']
method: ['Heat oil in a pressure cooker, add mutton and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add salt,  1/2  tsp turmeric powder, mix well and saute for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add 1 1/2  cups water and mix well. Cover with the lid and cook on medium heat till the pressure is released 4-5 times. Open the cooker once the pressure settles completely.', 'Put ginger, garlic, green chillies, dried red chillies, star anise, green cardamoms, black peppercorns and cinnamon into a grinder jar. Add  1/4  cup water and grind to fine paste.', 'Heat remaining oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and once they begin to splutter, add shallots and saute for 2 minutes.', 'Add curry leaves, mix and saute for 1 minute. Add the prepared paste and saute, stirring continuously, on medium heat for 4-5 minutes or till oil separates.', 'Add remaining turmeric powder, red chilli powder and Madras curry powder and mix well.', 'Add the cooked mutton to this mixture, mix well and cook for 4-5 minutes on medium heat or till the mixture is thick.', 'Add coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with fried curry leaves and serve hot.']
Main ingredients: Mutton on the bone, Madras curry powder, Ginger, Garlic, Green chillies, Dried red chillies, Star anise, Black peppercorns, Shallots, Curry leaves

title: Shakkarkand Tuk Tuk
ingredients: ['2-3 medium sweet potatoes (shakkarkand), parboiled with skin', 'Oil for deep-frying', 'Spice mix', 'Salt to taste', '1 teaspoon red chili powder', '2 teaspoons coriander powder', ' 1/2  teaspoon dried mango (amchur) powder', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh coriander leaves', 'Tomato ketchup to serve', 'Green chutney to serve']
method: ['Heat sufficient oil in a deep pan.', 'Cut the sweet potato into thick slices. Flatten the slices between your palms by pressing a little and deep-fry in hot oil till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'To prepare the spice mix, mix together salt, red chilli powder, coriander powder, amchur powder and coriander leaves in a bowl. While tuk is still hot, sprinkle spice mix over them and toss well.', 'Insert a toothpick in each tuk and arrange them on a serving plate.', 'Serve hot with tomato ketchup and green chutney.']

title: Tootak
method: ['Preheat oven to 200deg C.', 'Mix together semolina, khoya, salt, milk and ghee in a bowl and knead to a semi soft dough. Cover and rest the dough for a while.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and once they begin to change colour, add ginger and saute for half a minute. Add cottage cheese, coriander powder, red chilli powder and garam masala powder and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Transfer this into another bowl and mix well. Add raisins, cashewnuts, potatoes and salt and mix well.', 'Finely chop coriander and add and mix well.', 'Divide the dough into 16 equal portions. Shape each portion into a katori, place one portion of the paneer-potato mixture, gather the edges and roll into a ball. Seal neatly, flatten slightly and shape into an oval. These are tootaks. Arrange them on a baking tray.', 'Melt saffron in 2 tbsps water in a small bowl in microwave for 15 seconds. Add rose water and mix well.', 'Brush the tootaks with saffron-rose water and put the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 10-15 minutes.', 'Arrange them on a serving plate and serve hot.']

title: Keema Korma
method: ['Take mutton mince in a bowl, add yogurt and salt and mix well. Keep in the refrigerator to marinate for 4-6 hours.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan.', 'Slice ginger and put it into a mixer jar with garlic, green chilli and boiled onions and grind to a smooth paste.', 'Add cardamoms, cloves, mace and ground paste to the pan and mix well and saute till fragrant. Add the ground onion mixture, mix and saute.', 'Add coriander powder and mix well. Add marinated mutton. Rinse the mixer jar with  1/4  cup water and add to the mince and mix well. Cover and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes.', 'Add cashewnut paste and mix well. Add saffron, white pepper powder and cardamom powder and mix well.', 'Add rose water and fresh cream and mix well. Cook for a minute.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with few saffron strands and serve hot.']

title: Chocolate And Prune Cake
method: ['Preheat oven to 180degC.', 'Grease an aluminium cake tin with butter and dust with a little flour.', 'Whisk butter and sugar in a bowl till light and fluffy.Add vanilla essence and mix again.', 'Mix prunes and orange juice and add this to butter mixture and mix well.', 'Break eggs one by one and add and mix well.', 'Sift together refined flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder and cocoa powder into butter mixture and mix well. Add buttermilk and mix again.', 'Pour batter into the prepared aluminium cake tin and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Remove and let the cake cool.', 'Slice and serve.']

title: Red Velvet Cheese Cake Brownie
method: ['Preheat oven to 180o C. Grease an 8-inch baking tin with some butter and dust with some flour.', 'Cream together butter and 1 cup castor sugar in a bowl with an electric beater.Add cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon vanilla essence, cochineal and salt and whisk. Add vinegar and whisk well.', 'Break in eggs and whisk. Add flour and whisk well. Transfer  3/4  of batter into the greased baking tin,reserving the remaining,and level it out.', 'Take cream cheese in another bowl. Add 3 tablespoons castor sugar, remaining vanilla essence and egg yolk and whisk with an electric beater.', 'Put the cream cheese mixture on top of the batter and level it out. Spread remaining batter on top.', 'Place the tin on the baking tray. Place the baking tray in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes. Remove from oven, cool and demould.', 'Serve.']

title: Simple Egg Curry
method: ['Chop onions finely. Scrape the coconut. Boil sufficient water in a deep pan, add eggs and boil for 10 minutes. Drain, cool, peel and halve each egg vertically.', 'Transfer the scraped coconut into a grinder jar, add half the chopped onion, cinnamon, black peppercorns, cloves, green chilli, garlic, ginger, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, coriander sprigs and a little water and grind into a smooth paste.', 'Heat oil in a deep non-stick pan, add the remaining onions and saute on high heat for 1 minute. Add salt, mix and saute for 2-3 minutes or till onions turn golden brown.', 'Add ground coconut paste, mix and saute on high heat for 4-5 minutes or till the oil separates.', 'Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder and salt and mix well. Add 2 1/2  cups water, mix, cover and cook for 2 minutes or till the mixture comes to a rolling boil.', 'Reduce heat, add kokum petals and halved eggs, mix gently, cover and cook for 2 minutes.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.']

title: Sofiyani Chicken Tikka
method: ['Take chicken pieces in a bowl, add hung yogurt, coriander-mint paste, gram flour, ginger-garlic paste, green-chilli paste, fennel powder, mustard oil, salt and mayonnaise and mix well. Set aside to marinate for 15 minutes.', 'Preheat the air fryer to 200@C.', 'Grease the air fryer basket with oil, arrange the marinated chicken pieces in it, fit the basket to the fryer and air fry for 15minutes.', 'Remove the cooked chicken pieces from the air fryer and baste with butter.', 'Arrange them on a serving platter, garnish with onion rings and lemon wedge and serve hot with green chutney.']

title: Lamb Boulangere
method: ['Pre-heat the oven to 200degF and grease a deep baking dish with one tablespoon butter. Clean and wash mutton leg and wipe it dry.', 'Thinly slice half the garlic cloves and crush the remaining. Make small incisions in the mutton leg and insert garlic slices into the incisions. Arrange potatoes, onions, crushed garlic, thyme, bay leaf, salt and black pepper powder in the buttered dish.', 'Add stock, dot with remaining butter, cover with foil and bake in the preheated oven at 200degF for thirty minutes. Grease a heavy frying pan with a little oil, add the mutton and sear quickly until browned all over.', 'Put the lamb on top of the potatoes and cover with a foil and bake for one hour at 200degF. Remove the foil and bake it open for ten minutes so that the top browns well.', 'Remove mutton, slice, garnish with parsley leaves and serve hot with the potatoes.']

title: Khamang Kakdi
method: ['Halve, remove seeds and finely chop cucumbers. Crush roasted peanuts to a coarse powder.', 'Mix cucumbers with peanut powder, coconut, green chillies, lemon juice and sugar.', 'Heat pure ghee in a small non stick pan, add mustard seeds and as they begin to splutter add cumin seeds.', 'Stir briefly and add this tempering to the cucumber mixture and mix well.', 'Add salt, mix and serve immediately, garnished with coriander leaves.']

title: Chocolate Hazelnut Bomb - SK Khazana
method: ['Preheat the oven at 120@C. Spread hazelnuts on a baking tray, keep the tray in the preheated oven and roast for 10-15 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, gently simmer fresh cream in a non-stick pan. Take the pan off the heat.', 'Break dark chocolate and add to the hot cream and mix till it melts. Add chocolate hazelnut spread and mix well. Transfer into a bowl and refrigerate till set.', 'Take the tray out of the oven and let the hazelnuts cool slightly. Place half of them on the worktop and chop finely. Reserve the rest as whole.', 'Transfer the chocolate-hazelnut mixture into a piping bag and snip the tip of the bag.', 'Arrange the wafer shells on the work top and pipe the mixture into each wafer shell. . Place a whole hazelnut in half of them and cover each with one of the remaining shells to make a ball.', 'Place milk chocolate bars on the worktop, chop them roughly and transfer into a large bowl. Place the bowl on a double boiler and melt the chocolate. Take the bowl off the heat and temper the chocolate by mixing continuously till it reaches 30@C-32@C. Add the chopped hazelnut and mix. Place each stuffed wafer ball on a fork and dip into this mixture till they are well coated and place them on a plate. Keep the plate in the refrigerator till they are set.', 'Once they are set wrap each one in a piece of gold wrapper and serve.']

title: Aloo Wadiyan With Garlic Honey Chilli Sauce
method: ['Mix together potatoes, refined flour, cornflour,  1/4  tsp chaat masala, salt.', 'Heat 4 tbsps oil in a non stick pan.', 'Divide potato mixture into small equal portions and shape them into round balls.', 'Press each ball lightly on the back of the fork and shape into a roll. Shallow fry the rolls, stirring lightly, till evenly golden.', 'Heat the remaining oil in another non stick pan. Add garlic and saute for a minute.', 'Add red chilli flakes, remaining chaat masala, honey, salt and mix well.', 'Add the aloo wadiyan to the pan and toss lightly. Transfer onto a serving plate and serve hot.']

title: Peri Peri Paneer Sliders - SK Khazana
method: ['Put peri peri seasoning in a plate, add salt and mix well. Roll the 8 cottage cheese cubes in this mixture.', 'Heat oil in non-stick grill pan, place the marinated cottage cheese cubes in it and grill till evenly done on all sides. Transfer them onto a plate.', 'Halve all the burger buns. Apply 1 tbsp mayonnaise and  1/2  tbsp mustard paste on the base half of all the buns and top with the grilled cottage cheese cube.', 'Top each cottage cheese cube with some lettuce leaves, an onion roundel and a tomato slice and cover with the bun top halves. Secure each burger with a cherry tomato skewered on a toothpick.', 'Arrange the burgers on a serving platter and serve immediately with French fries.']

title: Chilli Pakora
method: ['Slit the green chillies and remove the seeds.', 'Add the chilli powder, garam masala powder, chaat masala, chopped coriander and salt to the grated potatoes. Mix well. Divide this into sixteen equal portions.', 'Stuff a little of this mixture into the green chillies.', 'To make the batter, place the gram flour, baking powder, chilli powder, salt in a deep bowl and add about one cup of water. Mix well to make a smooth batter and allow it to stand for ten minutes.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Dip the stuffed green chillies in the gram flour batter and deep-fry until golden brown.', 'Drain on absorbent paper and serve hot.']

title: Kung Pao Paneer
method: ['Put cottage cheese cubes in a bowl. Add cornflour, chilli powder, pepper powder and salt and mix well.', 'Heat some oil in a non-stick pan. Add cottage cheese cubes and shallow-fry, turning sides, till golden brown on both sides. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Heat 1 tablespoon oil in another non-stick pan. Add garlic and saute till lightly browned.', 'Add red chillies and onion, mix and saute till onion turns translucent. Add three coloured capsicums, mix and saute for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add chilli sauce and mix well. Add peanuts, soy sauce and cornflour slurry, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add spring onions and mix well. Add fried cottage cheese cubes and mix. Adjust salt, mix and cook for 1-2 minutes.', 'Garnish with spring onion greens and serve hot.']

title: Dal Amritsari
method: ['Mix the two dals and soak in four cups of water for one hour. Drain. Place the soaked dals in a pan with four cups of water, salt to taste, turmeric powder, half the ginger and green chillies.', 'Cover and cook over low heat till the dals are soft. Stir well with a ladle to mix the dals without mashing them.', 'Heat the ghee and butter in a kadai; add the cumin seeds, remaining ginger and green chillies. Stir and add the onion and saute till light brown. Add the tomatoes and saute till the tomatoes soften. Add the chilli powder and saute for half a minute. Add t', 'Simmer for a few minutes and serve hot, garnished with coriander leaves.']

title: Soya Chunks Fry
method: ['Squeeze excess water from the soya chunks and put them into a blender jar and grind into a coarse paste.', 'Transfer the paste into a bowl, add salt, curry leaves, garam masala powder, ginger-garlic paste, red chilli powder, cornflour and coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Take some cornflour on a plate. Divide the soya chunk mixture into equal portions and shape them into balls.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai, coat the balls with cornflour, slide them into hot oil and deep-fry till golden and crisp. Drain them on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving platter and serve hot with tomato ketchup.']

title: Spinach Feta Samosa
method: ['Preheat oven to 180o C.', 'Heat butter in a non-stick pan, add garlic and onion and saute till onion turns translucent.', 'Add spinach leaves and saute for a minute. Add thyme, red chilli flakes and salt, mix well and saute for a minute.', 'Add raisins and cashewnuts and mix well. Remove from heat and cool down to room temperature. Add feta cheese and mix well.', 'Take the flour in a bowl, add sufficient water and mix well into a thick paste.', 'Place each samosa patti on the worktop and rub it lightly with the flour paste. Place a small portion of the spinach-cheese mixture at one end and fold into a triangular samosa. Seal the edges by applying the flour paste and then pressing gently.', 'Place samosas on a baking tray, keep the tray in the preheated oven and bake for eight to ten minutes, turning them a few times.', 'Serve hot with tomato ketchup or green chutney.']

title: Fruit Chaat
method: ['Peel and cut papaya and kiwi fruits into one inch sized cubes.', 'Peel and separate pearls of pomegranate. Peel and cut orange and sweet lime into quarters.', 'Cut apples and pear into one inch sized cubes.', 'Put all the fruits into a large bowl. Add red chilli powder, chaat masala, salt and lemon juice. Mix well.', 'Serve cold.']

title: Kaleji Fry
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and saute till their colour changes. Add onions, green chillies and ginger-garlic paste, mix well and saute till onions turn a light brown. Add tomatoes and salt, mix well and saute on medium heat till tomatoes turn pulpy.', 'Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder and coriander powder and mix well. Add garam masala powder and mix. Add  1/4  cup water, mix well and saute on medium heat till oil separates.', 'Add chicken liver and coriander leaves and mix well. Cover and cook on medium heat for 15-20 minutes.', 'Transfer kaleji fry onto a serving plate, garnish with ginger strips and coriander sprig. Serve hot with pavs.']

title: Potato Filling for Masala Dosa
method: ['Heat oilin a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds andonce the mustard seeds splutter,add asafoetida and split black gram. Once the gram turns a light brown, add curry leaves, green chillies and onions. Immediately add a pinch of saltand sugar, mix well and saute till the onions are golden.', 'Lightly mash the potatoes and set aside.', 'Once the onions are golden brown, add potatoes, turmeric powder and half the coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Sprinkle a little water and mix well, reduce the heat, cover with a lid and cook for two to three minutes.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl. Sprinkle remaining coriander leaves on top. Serve hot.']

title: Aloo Tarkari Recipe - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat a non-stick pan, add mustard oil and heat till it smokes. Meanwhile, take potatoes in a bowl, add turmeric powder and salt and toss well.', 'To make panch phoran, mix fenugreek seeds, cumin seeds, onion seeds, fennel seeds and mustard seeds in a small bowl.', 'Add potatoes to the heated oil, mix and saute till golden brown.', 'Slide the potatoes to one side of the pan, add 1 tsp panch phoran and dried red chillies and saute for a few seconds. Toss the potatoes with the tempering, cover and cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add tomato, adjust salt and mix well. Cook for 1 minute.', 'Add  1/2  cup water and Tata Sampann Garam Masala and mix well. Cover and cook till the potatoes are cooked completely.', 'Add sugar and mix well and take the pan off the heat.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot with hot luchis.']

title: Pasta in Creole Sauce
method: ['Horizontally slice onions.', 'Heat olive oil in a non-stick wok and add onions. Finely chop ginger and add to the wok. Crush garlic cloves and add. Mix and saute till fragrant.', 'Add penne pasta and tomato concasse. Diagonally slice green chilli and add to the wok and mix well.', 'Add  1/4  cup water and mix well and let the pasta get heated through.', 'Add fresh thyme. Roughly chop curly parsley and add along with salt and mix well. Transfer into a serving bowl, drizzle extra virgin olive oil and serve immediately.']

title: Sugar Free Chocolate Cake
method: ['Preheat oven to 180oC. Grease and dust a five inch cake tin. Take the melted chocolate in a bowl, add melted butter and vanilla essence and mix.', 'Sieve refined flour with baking powder and baking soda into the chocolate mixture and mix. Add Sugar Free and mix.', 'Add buttermilk and mix. Add crushed walnuts and mix. Adjust the consistency.', 'Pour the batter into the prepared cake tin and bake in the preheated oven at 180oC for about thirty minutes. Cool and serve.']

title: Baked Potato Wedges
method: ['Preheat oven to 180degC. Cut potatoes into wedges without removing the skin. Blanch in hot salted water. Drain into a bowl.', 'Add salt, garlic, mixed herbs, red chilli powder, four tablespoons olive oil and mix. Add lemon juice and mix. Place the wedges on a greased tray.', 'Drizzle the remaining olive oil over them.Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for fifteen to twenty minutes. Serve hot.']

title: Kolhapuri Sukha Mutton
method: ['Grind coriander leaves, green chillies, five to six garlic cloves, half the ginger, two to three peppercorns, cloves and half inch cinnamon with a little water into a fine paste.', 'Place mutton pieces in a bowl, add ground paste, salt, half teaspoon turmeric powder and mix well. Set aside to marinate for two hours in the refrigerator.', 'Heat one tablespoon oil in a large non-stick pan. Add one chopped onion and saute till it turns translucent.', 'Add the marinated mutton and saute on high heat. Add two cups of water, mix and simmer for forty-five minutes. Strain the stock and set aside.', 'Heat one tablespoon oil in another non-stick pan. Add the remaining cinnamon, remaining peppercorns, star anise, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, cloves, mace, sesame seeds, stone flower, poppy seeds and fennel seeds. Mix well and add one chopped onion. Mix and saute till the onion turns translucent.', 'Add coconut, mix and saute on low heat till it turns light brown.', 'Add bay leaf and mix. Add dried coconut, mix and saute for two to three minutes. Remove from heat and cool down the mixture to room temperature.', 'Heat remaining oil in a pressure cooker. Add remaining garlic cloves, mix and saute.', 'Add remaining onions and saute till they turn light brown.', 'Grind cooled coconut mixture into a thick and fine paste with little water.', 'Add ground coconut paste to the cooker, mix and saute for one to two minutes.', 'Add remaining turmeric powder, garam masala powder, Kolhapuri masala, red chilli powder and salt and mix well.', 'Add mutton pieces and mix well. Add half cup of strained stock and mix. Cover and cook on low heat for four to five minutes or till the mixture becomes dry.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.']

title: Warm Potato Parsley Salad
method: ['Cut potatoes into large cubes.', 'Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan, add the potato cubes and saute on high heat, stirring, till the potatoes are lightly browned.', 'Quarter onion and slice black olives. Put both of them in a chopper along with garlic and parsley and chop finely.', 'Add salt and crushed peppercorns to the pan and mix well. Add the chopped ingredients and parmesan cheese powder and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Make a bed of lettuce leaves on a serving plate, put the potato and parsley salad over it and serve warm.']

title: Mirchi Mutton
method: ['Heat mustard oil in a deep non-stick pan till it begins to smoke.', 'Roughly chop red chilli pickle pieces.', 'Reduce heat under the pan, add cloves, cardamoms, peppercorns and onions and saute for  1/2  minute.', 'Add mutton, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, salt and green chillies and mix well.', 'Add pickle masala and chopped pickle pieces and mix well.', 'Add 2 cups water and let the mixture boil. Cover and cook on low heat till the mutton is fully cooked.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.']

title: Andhra Style Curd Rice
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan.', 'Take rice in a bowl, add milk and mix. Add yogurt and mix. Add salt and mix well. Add green chilli.', 'Add black gram, mustard seeds, asafoetida and curry leaves to the hot oil in the pan and let the seeds splutter.', 'Add the tempering to rice and mix.', 'Chill in the refrigerator.', 'Transfer into serving dish, sprinkle some pomegranate pearls on top and serve.']

title: Mysore Bonda - SK Khazana
method: ['Blend together black gram, salt and asafoetida with some water to a fine paste. Transfer in a bowl.', 'Add chillies, curry leaves, ginger, crushed peppercorns and coriander leaves, coconut and rice flour and mix well.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Drop small portions in the oil and deep-fry till golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot with green coconut chutney.']

title: Paneer Tikka Kathi Roll
method: ['Mix together yogurt, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, ginger paste, gram flour, chaat masala, dried fenugreek leaves, garam masala powder, and salt in a deep bowl. Add paneer and tomatoes, toss lightly. Set aside to marinate for ten minutes.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add green capsicum and saute for two minutes. Add the paneer mixture and saute over high heat for four to five minutes, stirring occasionally. Cook till dry and set aside.', 'For chapatis, combine whole wheat flour, skimmed milk and salt to taste and knead into soft dough.', 'Divide the dough into eight equal portions. Roll out each portion into a thin chapati.', 'Heat a tawa and cook each chapati lightly on both sides. Set aside.', 'Divide the paneer tikka filling into eight equal portions. Place one portion of the filling in the centre of each chapati and roll up tightly.', 'When you want to serve, cook the rolls on a hot tawa till they get warmed up.', 'Cut into two-inch long pieces and serve hot.']

title: Chai Ice Cream
method: ['Blend together cream, powdered sugar, milk powder and tea till well mixed.', 'Pour the prepared mixture into an air-tight container, cover and freeze for 7-8 hours.', 'Scoop and serve.']

title: Ambe Dal - SK Khazana
method: ['Take Chana Dal in a large bowl and wash it a couple of times. Add freshwater and soak for 2-3 hours.', 'Drain the dal and put it into a blender jar. Add ginger and green chillies and grind to a coarse paste. Transfer the paste into a bowl.', 'To make the tempering, heat oil in a non-stick pan. Meanwhile, add raw mango to the dal mixture and mix well.', 'Add mustard seeds to the hot oil and let them splutter. Add asafoetida and reduce the heat.', 'Add curry leaves and switch the heat off. Add turmeric powder in the pan and mix well. Add the tempering to the dal mixture and mix well.', 'Add castor sugar and salt, mix well. Add coriander leaves and mix till well combined. Let it rest for 30-45 minutes.', 'Transfer into serving bowls, garnish with coriander sprigs and serve.']

title: Crepe Stack
method: ['To make crepe batter, break eggs into a bowl and beat them with a hand blender till fluffy. Add flour and beat again.', 'Add milk and continue to beat. Add melted butter and beat again.', 'Heat some butter in a non-stick pan, pour a ladle full of the batter and spread into a round crepe. Let it cook till the underside is light golden and crisp. Remove from heat and set aside. This batter will make fifteen to twenty crepes.', 'To make ganache, heat cream in a non-stick pan. Put the chocolate in another bowl, add hot cream to it and mix till it melts and is smooth.', 'Reserve some ganache in a third bowl.', 'Add whipped cream to the remaining ganache and mix till well combined.', 'Reserve some chocolate-cream in a fourth bowl.', 'Place a crepe on a large serving platter. Spread some chocolate-cream on it and top with some ganache. Repeat the process to prepare a stack and until all the ingredients are used.', 'Add the milk to the reserved chocolate-cream and mix well. Fill it in a piping bag fitted with a nozzle.', 'Pipe out the chocolate-cream to cover the entire crepe stack.', 'Dust with the cocoa powder. Serve.']

title: Andhra Mashed Brinjal
method: ['Quarter brinjals and keep them soaked in water.', 'Heat 2 tbsps oil in a non stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add onions, ginger and garlic and saute till soft.', 'Add brinjals, salt, green chillies, turmeric powder and mix well. Cover and cook on high heat for 3-4 minutes.', 'Add red chilli powder and mix well. Add  1/2  cup water and mix. Cover and cook on medium heat till brinjals become tender.', 'For the tempering, heat 1 tbsp oil in another non stick pan, add cumin seeds, red chillies and curry leaves and saute till fragrant.', 'Add tamarind pulp to the brinjals and mix. Mash everything with the back of the ladle', 'Add the tempering and cover immediately to trap the flavours.\nServe hot.']

title: Chilli Paneer
method: ['Keep paneer cubes in a bowl, add salt, ginger-garlic paste, refined flour, 1 tsp tomato chilli sauce and mix gently. Roughly chop spring onions.', 'Heat 2 tbsps oil in a non stick wok. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Cut red chillies into small pieces, remove seeds and add to the wok. Add spring onions and saute.', 'Add a few cubes of paneer at a time to the hot oil in the kadai and deep fry on high heat till golden. Add capsicums to the wok and mix well. Add salt cookfor some time.', 'Add 1 tbsp tomato chilli sauce, mix well and cook for 2 minutes. Switch off the heat.Drain paneer cubes and add to the wok and mix well.  Serve hot.']

title: Seekh Kebab Bread Omlette
ingredients: ['4 chicken seekh kebabs', '8 white bread slices', '8 eggs', '1 medium onion, finely chopped', '1 medium tomato, finely chopped', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves', '3 green chillies, finely chopped', 'Salt to taste', '2 teaspoons butter + to spread', 'Oil to drizzle', 'Green chutney to serve']
method: ['Break and add eggs in a bowl, beat it well. Add onion, tomato, coriander leaves, green chillies and salt. Mix well.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa, add butter and add kebabs, drizzle oil, and cook till golden brown from all sides. Remove set aside.', 'Add egg mixture on the same tawa, and spread it. Add 2 white bread slices. Press slightly. Cook on medium heat for 2-3 minutes.', 'Flip on another side, place cooked kebabs in center, fold the omelette on the seekh. Dip 2 white bread slices in leftover egg mixture and place over omelette.', 'Apply butter on top of the bread slices, flip and cook on another side till golden brown on both sides. Cut from the center and place one above another making a layer.', 'Serve hot with green chutney.']

title: How to Perfectly Boil Eggs
method: ['Heat sufficient water in a deep pan, add salt and vinegar and let the water come to a boil. Gently lower the eggs and boil for 10-12 minutes.', 'Drain and put into cold water. When they cool down to room temperature, crack them and peel.', 'Halve and place them on a serving plate. Sprinkle some salt and crushed peppercorns and serve.']

title: Almond Oats and Honey Biscuits
method: ['Preheat oven at 180o C.Line a baking tray with silicon sheet.', 'Combine oats, coconut, amaranth seeds, almond flakes and flour in a bowl. Mix well.', 'Heat butter in a non-stick pan. Add honey and some water and mix well till the butter melts. Switch off the heat and add soda-bi carbonate and mix well.', 'Add the butter-honey mixture to the oats mixture and mix well.', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into medium size cookies. Place the cookies on the silicon sheet. Put the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes', 'Remove from heat, cool and serve.']

title: Chicken And Prawn Laksa
method: ['For laksa paste, remove the seeds from the red chillies and put them in the mixer jar.', 'Add eight to ten shallots, garlic, lemon grass, turmeric, peanuts, salt, one tablespoon olive oil and a little water and grind to a smooth paste. Chop the remaining shallots and set aside.', 'Heat the remaining oil in a pan. Add chicken and saute for two to three minutes. Add the laksa paste and stir. Add chicken stock, prawns and coconut milk. Mix and cook till both chicken and prawns are done.', 'Put the noodles in a bowl. Pour the laksa over them. Top with bean sprouts, chopped shallots, mint leaves, fried onion slices and lemon slice and serve hot.']

title: Green Tomato Chutney
method: ['Peel, core and chop apple.', 'Tie together cinnamon, black and green cardamoms and black peppercorns in a piece of muslin cloth to make a potli.', 'Place tomatoes, apples, masala potli, onion and garlic in a heavy bottom saucepan. Add salt, half the vinegar and one cup of water and bring this mixture to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for twenty minutes, stirring frequently.', 'Remove the masala potli. Dissolve the sugar in remaining vinegar and add it to the mixture. Simmer, stirring, for twenty minutes', 'Spoon the hot chutney into sterilized jars, cover and seal while hot.']

title: Crisp Hazelnut Sandwich
method: ['Apply 1 tsp butter on each of the bread slices.', 'Heat 1 tbsp butter in a non-stick pan. Add almond slivers, walnut slivers and poppy seeds and roast till golden.', 'Spread 1 tbsp hazelnut spread on each of the buttered slices. Add generous amount of roasted nut-poppy seeds mixture on each of the slice. Place one slice on another slice and make 4 sandwiches this way.', 'Brush a non-stick griller and the sandwiches with little butter. Place a sandwich in the griller, cover and grill till golden and grill marks appear.', 'Open the cover, flip, cover and grill further till golden and grill marks appear on this side as well. Prepare remaining sandwiches in the similar way.', 'Remove sandwich from the griller. Cut into 3 fingers and serve immediately with a dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkle of icing sugar.']

title: Eggplant Roll
method: ['Preheat oven to 180degC. Remove stalks of eggplants and cut lengthwise into thin slices.Heat 2 tbsps oil in non stick pan.', 'Sprinkle salt on eggplant slices on both sides. Place them in the pan, sprinkle pepper powder on top and cook, turning sides, till well cooked on both sides.', 'Heat remaining oil in another non stick pan. Add garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and tomato puree. Mix well and cook for 1 minute.', 'Add salt, pepper powder, 3-4 tbsps water and torn basil leaves. Mix well and cook for 5-7 minutes. Mix paneer, cheese and breadcrumbs in a bowl. Divide into equal portions and shape them into cylinders.', 'Place cooked eggplant slices on worktop and place a paneer cylinder on one end of each eggplant slice and roll.', 'Pour tomato sauce in a baking dish. Place eggplant rolls compactly in standing position in it. Place dish in the preheated oven and bake for 10-15 minutes. Serve hot.']

title: Sausage and Potato Fritters
method: ['Combine sausages, potatoes, mixed herbs, red chilli flakes, salt, crushed peppercorns, cornstarch and chopped coriander in a bowl and mix well.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a pan. Spread the breadcrumbs on a plate.', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into tikkis or fritters.', 'Coat them in the breadcrumbs and deep-fry in hot oil till golden and crisp.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Vada Pav Pizza - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add ginger-garlic-green chilli paste, mix and saute for 30 seconds.', 'Add potatoes and mix well. Add salt and turmeric powder, mix well and saute for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add coriander leaves, mix well and saute for 1-2 minutes. Take the pan off the heat.', 'Heat another non-stick pan, place a pizza base on it, and brush a little olive oil on top. Spread some green chutney evenly. Sprinkle lasoon chutney and spread some potato mixture evenly. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese and coriander leaves on top.', 'Sprinkle a little lasoon chutney, crush a little boondi and sprinkle on top. Cover and cook till the cheese melts and the base is golden brown.', 'Place the pizza on serving plates, cut into wedges and serve hot with bowls of oregano and red chilli flakes.']

title: Aloo Ki Tikki
method: ['Wash, boil potatoes, peel and mash while still warm. Add green chillies, coriander leaves, rock salt, asafoetida and red chilli powder to the mashed potatoes and mix well.', 'Divide into ten to twelve portions. Shape them into round tikkis. Heat a tawa and shallow fry the tikkis on both sides with ghee till golden.', 'Drain onto an absorbent paper. Serve with green chutney or lemon pickle.']

title: Anari Vegetable Kofta
method: ['Heat 2 tbsps oil in a deep non-stick pan, add ginger and French beans, mix and saute for 1 minute. Add carrot, salt and green peas and mix crushing the peas slightly. Cover and cook.', 'Take potatoes in a bowl, add cottage cheese, salt, white pepper powder and green cardamom powder and mix. Add the cooked vegetables and mix well. Add cornflour and mix well.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Grease your palms with a little oil and divide the kofta mixture into equal portions. Spread each portion into a round disc on your palm, place some fresh pomegranate pearls in the centre and shape into round koftas.', 'Roll in cornflour, slide into hot oil and deep-fry till golden. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'To make gravy, put the boiled onions in a grinder jar and grind.', 'Heat 2 tbsps oil in the same deep non-stick pan, add black cardamom, cloves, green cardamoms, cinnamon and boiled onion paste, mix and saute till lightly coloured.', 'Add green chillies, white pepper powder and cashewnut-melon seeds (made with 3 parts cashewnuts and 1 part melon seeds), mix and saute for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add pomegranate juice and mix well till well blended. Add salt, mix, bring the mixture to a boil and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add garam masala powder and mix well.', 'Switch off the heat and strain the gravy into a clean bowl. Add fresh cream and mix well.', 'Halve each kofta. Pour the gravy into a serving bowl, arrange the halved kofte over it, garnish with a fresh mint sprig and serve hot.']

title: Vegetable Burgers
method: ['Put kidney beans in a chopper jar. Roughly chop onion, green capsicum and beetroot and add. Add brown rice, chop everything roughly and transfer into a large bowl. Add salt and breadcrumbs and mix well.', 'Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan.', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into burgers to suit the size of the burger buns.', 'Place the patties in the pan and shallow-fry medium heat. When the underside turns crisp, turn them over and shallow-fry till the other side is evenly crisp.', 'Halve the buns and heat them on another non-stick tawa.', 'Keep a cheese slice on each burger patty.', 'Apply tomato ketchup on all the bun halves. Keep a piece of iceberg lettuce over all the base halves. Top it up with a burger patty and cover with the top half of the bun.', 'Arrange them on a serving plate and serve immediately.']

title: Aloo Pyaaz Cheese Grilled Sandwich
method: ['Apply butter on four bread slices. Arrange potato slices and onion rings on each. Sprinkle two tablespoons of grated cheese, salt, chaat masala and red chilli powder on each.', 'Cover with remaining bread slices. Apply some more butter on them and toast in a sandwich toaster till evenly done on both sides.', 'Sprinkle half tablespoon dry vada pav chutney on each sandwich and serve hot.']

title: Pani Puri
method: ['To prepare imli chutney, drain the excess water from tamarind and dates. Strain the tamarind in a bowl and squeeze to get the pulp. Grind dates alongwith some water into a smooth and thick puree.', 'Add the date puree, melted jaggery, cumin powder, chilli powder and salt to the tamarind pulp and mix. Add 1 cup water and mix well.', 'To prepare pudine ka pani, separate the mint leaves from the sprigs.', 'Blend together coriander sprigs, mint leaves and broken green chillies alongwith some water into a smooth mixture. Transfer in a bowl.', 'Add salt, cumin powder, chaat masala, black salt, pani puri masala, lemon juice and 4 cups water to the ground mint leaves mixture and mix well. Add few ice cubes and mix well.', 'Mash the potatoes in another bowl. Add moong sprouts and mix. Add cumin powder, 1 teaspoon chaat masala, chilli powder, black salt and salt and mix well.', 'Add salted boondi to pudine ka pani and mix well.', 'Crack the top of each puri, put some radga, potato-moong mixture, pour some imli chutney and pudine ka pani and serve immediately.', 'To prepare sukka puri, put some potato-moong mixture on fried puris, sprinkle some salt, chaat masala, black salt and sev on top and serve immediately.']

title: Mawa Gujiya
method: ['Heat a non-stick pan. Add khoya and castor sugar, mix and cook till khoya melts.', 'Add walnuts, cashewnuts, figs, almonds and dates, mix well and cook for a minute. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.', 'Knead together flour and 3 tablespoons ghee with sufficient cold water to a stiff dough.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions, grease with some ghee and roll out into small discs. Stuff each disc with a portion of khoya mixture and shape into gujiyas.', 'Heat sufficient ghee in a kadai. Deep-fry gujiyas on medium heat till golden brown. Drain on an absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Mutton Kalimiri
method: ['Heat 2 tablespoons ghee in a non-stick pan, add cinnamon, bay leaves, green cardamoms, black cardamoms, green chillies and saute. Add onions and saute for 3-4 minutes.', 'Add mutton and saute for 2 minutes. Add ginger-garlic paste, mix well and saute for 3-4 minutes.', 'Add salt and mix well. Add 2 cups water, cover and pressure cook on high heat for 5 minutes. Reduce heat and cook for 25 minutes.', 'Heat remaining ghee in a non-stick pan. Add crushed peppercorns and cashew nut paste, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes.', 'Reduce heat and add cooked mutton with stock and spices. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes.', 'Add garam masala powder, mix well and cook further. Add cream, stir to mix and let it get heated through.', 'Sprinkle crushed peppercorns and serve hot.']

title: Chocolate Nuts
method: ['Melt the chocolate in the microwave oven or on a double boiler. Whisk till smooth. Add the nuts and mix.', 'Drop the chocolate mixture into moulds. Keep the moulds in the refrigerator to set.', 'Unmould when completely set and serve.']

title: Chocolate Truffle
method: ['Pour cream into a non-stick pan and heat.', 'Grate orange peel.', 'When the cream gets heated, add dark chocolate and switch off heat. Mix till smooth.', 'Add 1 tsp grated orange zest and mix well.', 'Pour the mixture into an aluminium tray lined with cling film and set aside to cool down to room temperature. Then keep it in the refrigerator to set.', 'Spread the cocoa powder in a plate.', 'Take the tray out of the refrigerator, take small portions of the chocolate mixture and roll into balls. Roll the balls in cocoa powder and place them in a serving platter.', 'Serve,']

title: Cheesy Broccoli Balls
method: ['Grate the potatoes and put into a large mixing bowl. Add chilli flakes, crushed black peppercorns, salt and parmesan cheese and mix well. Set aside.', 'For the broccoli mixture, heat oil in a non-stick pan and add garlic and saute for a minute or till it is light brown in colour.', 'Add onion and a pinch of salt and saute till the onions are light brown in colour. Add broccoli, lower the heat and cook for 1-2 minutes. Remove from heat.', 'Add the broccoli mixture to the potato mixture and mix well.', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions, stuff a cube of mozzarella cheese in the center of each portion and press the edges to seal and roll into medium sized balls.', 'Mix refined flour and water to make a thin batter. Dip the prepared balls in the batter, coat with breadcrumbs and keep aside.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai and deep fry the balls till golden brown in colour. Drain on absorbent paper. Serve hot.']

title: Fruity Muesli
method: ['Take oats in a bowl. Add apple juice and set aside.', 'Grate apple and add to the soaked oats. Mix well.', 'Cut almonds into slivers and roughly chop walnuts.', 'Reserve some of the nuts for garnishing and add the remaining to the oats alongwith yogurt and honey. Mix well.', 'Add pomegranate pears and mix well. Refrigerate to chill.', 'Serve chilled garnished with reserved nuts.']

title: Kimchi Rice- Sk Khazana
method: ['Heat 2 tsps oil in non-stick pan, add garlic and spring onions and saute for 1 minute.', 'Add rice, crushed black peppercorns, kimchi and salt and toss well. Add spring onion greens and take the pan off the heat.', 'Heat remaining oil in another non-stick pan, add egg and cook for 2 minutes or till egg white is cooked and the yolk firm.', 'Transfer the cooked rice into a serving bowl and place the fried egg on top. Garnish with spring onion greens and sprinkle crushed black pepper. Serve hot.']

title: Chocolate Walnut Fudge
method: ['Line a barfi tray with cling film.', 'Heat butter in a non-stick pan, add chocolate and mix continuously till it melts. Add condensed milk and cook, stirring continuously, for 5-6 minutes or till the mixture thickens.', 'Add walnuts, mix and cook for 1 minute. Add khoya and cook, stirring continuously, till mixture thickens further. Switch off the heat and keep stirring till it cools slightly.', 'Transfer the chocolate mixture into the lined tray, spread evenly and tap. Set aside till it cools down a little more. Cut into small pieces of any shape you desire.', 'Keep the tray in the refrigerator for 2-3 hours or till it sets.', 'Separate the pieces, arrange them on a serving plate, sprinkle some chopped walnuts on top and serve.']

title: Soji Appam
method: ['Take flour in a bowl, add salt, ghee and sufficient water and knead into a soft dough. Cover with damp muslin cloth and set aside for 2 hours.', 'To prepare stuffing, boil 1 cup water in a non-stick pan. Add semolina gradually, whisk and cook till the water is absorbed and the semolina is cooked.', 'Add jaggery, mix and cook till it melts. Add coconut and green cardamom powder and mix well. Transfer into a bowl and let it cool.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions. Shape each portion into a katori, stuff it with some stuffing, bring the edges together, seal and shape into balls. Further roll out each stuffed ball into a thick disc.', 'Slide each stuffed disc into hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and puffs up. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving platter and serve hot.']

title: Mozzarella Chicken with Marinara Sauce - SK Khazan
method: ['Slit the chicken breasts horizontally without cutting through. Spread them out, keep them between two butter papers and flatten it out with a rolling pin. Discard the butter paper and place the chicken breasts on the worktop.', 'Place 5-6 spinach leaves and 2 cheese slices over each flattened chicken breast, place it over cling paper and roll tightly with the cling wrap. Twist the two ends of the wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours.', 'Boil sufficient water in a deep non-stick pan. Add cling wrapped chicken rolls and cook for 4-5 minutes. Remove from heat, discard the cling wrap and set aside.', 'Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan. Add marinara sauce, mixed herbs, salt, crushed peppercorns and chilli flakes, mix well and cook for a few seconds. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Cut the chicken into roundels and arrange on a serving platter. Top with the prepared sauce.', 'Garnish with carrot strips and serve immediately.']

title: Teekha Ganthia
method: ['Take gram flour in a bowl. Add salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder and carom seeds and mix.', 'Heat one fourth cup of oil and add. Add sufficient water and knead into a stiff dough. Rest the dough for half an hour.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. You can shape the dough into small cylinders and deep fry. Alternatively put some dough into a ganthia mould and press out ganthias directly into hot oil and deep fry till deep golden brown.', 'Drain and place on an absorbent paper.', 'Cool and store in an airtight container.']

title: Cilantro And Soya Stir-Fried Bean Sprouts
method: ['Heat oil in a pan. Add spring onion, carrots and ginger and saute for a minute.', 'Add capsicum, bean sprouts, soy sauce, sea salt and stir for two minutes.', 'Add beancurd, spring onion greens, coriander and crushed peppercorns and toss.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Paneer and Spinach Bites
method: ['Heat 2 tbsps oil in a non-stick pan, add ginger and garlic and saute till lightly browned. Add green chilliesand saute further for a minute. Add gram flour and saute on low heat till brown.', 'Finely chop spinach and add and mix. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, dried mango powder andsalt and mix well and cook till spinach is done.', 'Transfer into a large bowl. Add cottage cheeseand mix. Add potato andchilli flakes and mix.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa and drizzle some oil on it.', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions, shape them into small tikkis. Shallow-fry the tikkison the hot tawa, turning sides, till brown and crisp on both sides. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving plate, sprinkle chaat masalaand serve immediately.']

title: Mango Sasam
method: ['Coarsely grind coconut, red chillies, mustard seeds with a little water. Add tamarind pulp and jaggery and grind again. Place the mango cubes in a bowl, add salt, ground paste and mix well. Chill and serve.']

title: Paneer Bruschetta with Tamarind Chutney
method: ['Heat a non-stick pan and toast the baguette slices. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Combine cherry tomatoes, onions, cottage cheese, olive oil, coriander leaves and salt in a bowl and refrigerate for twenty minutes.', 'Top each toasted slice with generous amount of the tomato mixture. Top with tamarind chutney and serve immediately.']

title: Baked Chocolate Apple
method: ['Preheat oven to 160o C.', 'Slice the top and bottom of the apples and scoop out the flesh.', 'Sprinkle sea salt and rub it uniformly inside the hollowed apples and place them on a baking tray. Chop the flesh.', 'Heat a non-stick pan, add the chopped apple flesh and saute till lightly cooked. Add coconut, mixed nuts and jaggery and mix well. Cook on low heat till jaggery melts. Switch off heat. Add green cardamom powder and cinnamon powder and mix well.', 'Wipe the apples from inside with a tissue if they are moist from inside. Fill the nut mixture into each cored apple. Break half the caramel bars into small pieces and place on top, drizzle some rabdi. Repeat the process once more.', 'Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 12-15 minutes.', 'Spread remaining stuffing in deep serving plate and place the baked apples over it. Garnish with rabdi, chocolate chips and mixed nuts and serve immediately.']

title: Eggless Sponge Cake
method: ['Preheat oven to 180degC.', 'Sift together refined flour, baking powder and baking soda in a bowl.', 'Combine butter and condensed milk in another bowl. Blend well with an electric blender.', 'Add vanilla essence and blend again.', 'Add flour mixture and blend again to mix.', 'Add milk and blend once again. Mix well with the help of a spatula and set aside for sometime.', 'Grease the cake tin with either butter and dust with flour or line with butter paper. Place batter in it and spread evenly.', 'Put the tin in the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes. Remove from heat and let it cool.', 'Demould, cut into wedges and serve.']

title: Sorshe Diye Kundri
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan and add onion seeds and saute till fragrant.', 'Add ivy gourd and saute for a minute. Cover and cook for a few minutes, stirring once in a while.', 'Add turmeric powder, salt and sugar.', 'Mix well, cover and cook again for two minutes more.', 'Add mustard paste and mix well. Cook for another minute. Serve hot.']

title: Sri Lankan Chicken Curry
method: ['Heat coconut oil in a non-stick wok, add fenugreek seeds, cinnamon, green cardamoms, curry leaves, ginger and garlic, mix well and saute for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add onion, mix and saute till translucent. Add lemon grass and green chillies and saute for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add tomato and salt, mix and saute till the tomato is pulpy.', 'Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder and fennel seeds, mix well, cover and cook for 2-3 minutes', 'Add chicken and saute on high heat for 1-2 minutes. Add 1 1/2  cups water and mix well. Add salt, mix, cover and cook for 10-15 minutes.', 'Add lemon juice and mix well. Add coconut milk, mix well and cook for 1 minute or till the mixture comes to a boil.', 'Take the pan off the heat, transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprigs and serve hot.']

title: Cheesy Bread Pakora
method: ['Preheat oven to 180degC.', 'Take butter in a bowl. Add garlic, crushed red chillies and salt and mix well.', 'Chop parsley sprigs and add. Mix well.', 'Cut bread into thick slices. Apply garlic butter on each slice and place them on a baking tray.', 'Grate mozzarella cheese and sprinkle on top of the buttered bread slices. Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 5-7 minutes or till the cheese melts.', 'Serve immediately.']

title: Mango Cucumber Rice Salad
method: ['To prepare dressing, take olive oil in a bottle, add lemon juice, vinegar, salt, chilli flakes, crushed peppercorns and sugar, cover and shake well.', 'Peel, deseed and roughly chop Kesari mangoes and put into a bowl.', 'Add cucumber, rice, spring onion bulbs, spring onion greens, lettuce leaves and dressing and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve garnished with spring onion greens and white sesame seeds.']

title: Sev and Garlic Sandwich
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add garlic cloves and saute them on medium heat till they are golden brown.', 'Transfer them into a chopper jar and let them cool down. Add jalapenos, hung yogurt and salt and chop finely.', 'For each sandwich take 2 bread slices and spread this mixture over them. Spread a generous layer of sev on one slice and cover with the second slice.', 'Grease a sandwich toaster with a little oil, place a sandwich in it, close and grill over medium heat, turning sides, till both sides turn golden and crisp.', 'Halve each sandwich diagonally, place them on a serving platter and serve hot.']

title: Bread Pakoda - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat 2 tsps oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add curry leaves, green chilli paste and saute for 1 minute.', 'Add potatoes and  1/4  tsp turmeric powder and mix till well combined. Add coriander leaves and mix well. Add salt, mix and take the pan off the heat. Transfer into a bowl and let the mixture cool down to room temperature.', 'For the batter, take gram flour in a large bowl. Add remaining turmeric powder, red chilli powder, salt and sufficient water and whisk till you get a smooth and thick batter.', 'Evenly spread a portion of the potato mixture on top of a bread slice, cover with another bread slice and cut into half diagonally.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai, coat each diagonal bread piece with the batter and slide it into the hot oil. Deep fry till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Cut each bread in half and arrange them on a serving plate. Serve hot with date and tamarind chutney, green chutney and tomato ketchup.']

title: Dal Rice Vada-SK Khazana
method: ['Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Grind split Bengal gram into thick and smooth mixture. Transfer into a bowl.', 'Add rice, green chillies, coriander leaves, salt and pepper powder and mix well.', 'Add 1 tablespoon hot oil to the mixture and mix well.', 'Dampen your hand in with water, divide the mixture into equal portions and shape into balls and flatten between your palms to make medium thick vadas.', 'Put the vadas in hot oil and deep-fry on medium heat till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot with tomato ketchup.']

title: Kala Chana Tikki Chaat
method: ['Take the chana in a large bowl. Crush the potatoes and add. Mash the mixture well.', 'Add salt, red chilli powder, crushed coriander seeds, chana masala and corn flour and mix everything well.', 'Grease your palms with oil, divide the mixture into equal portions, shape them into balls and flatten them slightly to make tikkis. Keep them on a plate.', 'Heat oil on a non-stick tawa, place the tikkis on it and shallow-fry, turning sides, for 5 minutes or till golden and crisp on both sides. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Take yogurt in a bowl, add sugar and mix well.', 'For each portion, lightly break 2 tikkis and place in a serving bowl. Drizzle some yogurt, some date and tamarind chutney and green chutney. Sprinkle a little yellow chilli powder, black salt, few potato cubes, a few soaked kale chane, a little sev and coriander leaves and serve immediately.']

title: Chicken Makhani
method: ['Make incisions with a sharp knife on the chicken breast and leg pieces. Mix red chilli powder, lemon juice and salt and apply to the chicken. Set aside for half an hour. For the marination, hang yogurt in a muslin cloth for fifteen to twenty minutes to remove extra water.', 'Add red chilli powder, salt, ginger paste, garlic paste, lemon juice, garam masala powder and mustard oil, hung yogurt and mix well. Apply this marinade to the chicken pieces and refrigerate for three to four hours.', 'String the chicken onto a skewer and cook in a moderately hot tandoor or a preheated oven (200degC) for ten to twelve minutes or until almost done. Baste it with butter and cook for another two minutes. Set aside.', 'For the makhani gravy, heat butter in a pan. Add green cardamoms, cloves, peppercorns and cinnamon. Saute for two minutes, add ginger paste, garlic paste and green chillies. Saute for two minutes. Add tomato puree, red chilli powder, garam masala powder, salt and one cup of water and mix well.', 'Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for ten minutes. Add sugar or honey and powdered kasoori methi. Add the chicken pieces and simmer for five minutes. Add fresh cream.', 'Serve hot with naan or parantha.']

title: Butter Chicken - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat 2 tablespoons butter and oil in a non-stick pan. Add mace, cardamoms and garlic and saute well.', 'Add chilli powder and fresh tomato puree and mix well. Add salt, mix and bring to a boil. Cover and cook for 2 minutes.', 'Add readymade tomato puree and mix well. Cover and cook till oil begins rises to the surface.', 'Add garam masala powder, honey, 2 tablespoons cream and  1/4  cup water, mix and bring the mixture to a boil.', 'Take the pan off the heat and strain the gravy in another non-stick pan placed on heat. Add chicken tikka pieces and mix well.', 'Add 1 tablespoon cream, fenugreek leaves powder and remaining butter and mix till the butter melts.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, drizzle some cream, sprinkle dried fenugreek leaves powder and garnish with a coriander sprig. Serve hot.']

title: Chicken Pizza
method: ['Take the yeast in a bowl. Add castor sugar and some water, mix and set aside to activate.', 'Mix together finger millet flour, refined flour, wheat flour and oats in a bowl.', 'Add the activated yeast and mix well. Add sufficient water and knead. Add salt and 1 tablespoon olive oil and knead into soft dough. Set aside to prove for 10-15 minutes.', 'Preheat oven at 200o C.', 'Heat remaining olive oil in a non-stick pan. Add onion, garlic and celery and saute till the onion turns translucent.', 'Add tomato concasse, mix well and cook for a minute. Add salt, crushed peppercorns and little water, mix and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes.', 'Place the proved dough on the worktop and knock back to release the excess air. Dust with some wheat flour and roll out into a medium size thick disc.', 'Place the prepared base on a baking tray and prick all over with a fork. Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 8-10 minutes.', 'Add oregano and 3-4 torn basil leaves in the sauce and mix well.', 'Spread the sauce evenly on the baked base. Top with chicken, green, red and yellow capsicum strips, sliced onion, jalapenos, olives, cheese cubes, remaining torn basil leaves and chilli flakes. Put the tray in the oven and bake at 180o C for 10-12 minutes.', 'Serve.']

title: Tea Time Pineapple Cake
method: ['Break eggs into a bowl, add vanilla essence and beat for about 12 minutes or till light and fluffy.', 'Cream together butter and sugar in a large bowl for about 5-8 minutes or till light.', 'Preheat oven to 180degC.', 'Sieve together refined flour and baking powder into the butter mixture. Add beaten eggs and some of the pineapple. Mix everything together in cut and fold method.', 'Add milk and mix well till all the ingredients are well incorporated.', 'Pour the mixture into an aluminum cake tin, lined with greased parchment paper. Level the surface.', 'Place the tin in the preheated oven and bake for 25 minutes.', 'Bring the cake tin out of the oven and let it cool down to room temperature.', 'Remove the cake from the tin, remove parchment paper, cut into fingers and serve immediately. Or you can store it upto 3 days.']

title: Creamy Spinach Pizza
method: ['Preheat oven to 180deg C.', 'To prepare creamy spinach, heat butter in a non-stick pan. Add onion and saute till translucent. Add 1 tablespoon garlic and saute for 30 seconds.', 'Add 1 tablespoon flour and saute for 30 seconds. Add  1/2  cup milk, mix and cook for 1 minute. Add spinach leaves, mix and cook for 30 seconds. Add remaining milk, mix and cook till mixture thickens. Add salt and mix well.', 'Divide the dough into 2 equal portions.', 'Dust the worktop with some flour and roll out each portion into  1/2  cm thick sheet.', 'Dust a baking tray with some flour, transfer the sheet on it and dork using a fork.', 'Take remaining garlic in a bowl. Add olive oil and mix. Brush the mixture on top of the sheet.', 'Put the baking tray in the preheated oven and bake for 5-8 minutes or till light golden. Remove from oven and spread some creamy spinach and mozzarella cheese on top. Sprinkle pine nuts and crushed peppercorns on top.', 'Put the baking tray back into the preheated oven and bake till cheese melts.', 'Cut into wedges and serve hot.']

title: Sesame Fish
method: ['Cut fish into thick strips.', 'Put leeks in a bowl, add capsicum and soy sauce. Mix well.', 'Roughly chop chillies and add to the bowl alongwith garlic, sesame seeds, salt, vinegar, sugar and sesame oil. Mix well.', 'Add fish and mix well. Set aside to marinate for 25 minutes in refrigerator.', 'Preheat oven to 200deg C.', 'Wrap individual marinated fish fillets in a foil paper. Place them on a tray.', 'Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 20 minutes.', 'Unwrap and serve hot.']

title: Chilkewali Dal Khichdi
method: ['Heat a pressure cooker. Add one teaspoon ghee and cumin seeds. When they begin to change colour add rice and dal and stir. Add turmeric powder, salt and mix.', 'Add four cups of water and cover with the lid. Cook under pressure till two to three whistles are given out. Open the lid when the pressure reduces, mash it up and serve it hot drizzled with the remaining ghee.']

title: Vegan Pakoda- Sk Khazana
method: ['Finely chop onions. Finely chop cabbage and transfer both the vegetables into a large bowl.', 'Finely chop potato, tomato and green chillies and transfer them into the same bowl.', 'Add rock salt, turmeric powder, coriander powder, coriander leaves, peanut powder and gram flour and mix well.', 'Heat sufficient water in the base half of a steamer, line the perforated container to be kept over it with a banana leaf. Take small portions of the mixture, shape into logs and place them on the banana leaf. Cover and steam for 10-15 minutes.', 'Insert the tip of the knife in the pakodas and if it comes out clean then take them off the heat. Allow them to cool down to room temperature.', 'Preheat the oven to 200@C. Line a baking tray with parchment sheet.', 'Break the pakodas into small portions and place them on the baking tray. Keep the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes or till they turn brown and crisp.', 'Transfer them onto a serving tray and serve hot with green chutney.']

title: Potato Bravas
method: ['Cut potatoes into big pieces. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Heat 2 tbsps extra virgin olive oil in a non stick pan, add onions and garlic and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add tomatoes and continue to saute for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add potatoes to the oil in the kadai and deep fry. Add salt and paprika to onion-tomato mixture and saute. Add a little water and cook till tomatoes soften. Cool the onion-tomato mixture and grind till smooth.', 'Deep fry potatoes till golden and drain on absorbent paper. Sprinkle a little wine salt on them. Pour the sauce over and serve hot.']

title: Kurmura Energy Bars - SK Khazana
method: ['Grease a burfi tray with ghee and set aside.', 'Heat a non-stick wok, add jaggery, ghee and peanut butter, mix and let the jaggery melt. Add jam and mix well. Add puffed rice and crushed peanuts and mix well.', 'Take the pan off the heat and transfer the mixture into the greased burfi tray. Spread it evenly. Place a parchment sheet on top and press it with a rolling pin to level out the top. Set aside to cool down to room temperature.', 'Cut the mixture into equal bars and loosen them from the tray and keep on a plate.', 'Take melted dark chocolate in a glass, dip the  1/4  portion of each bar into it and place it on a wire rack to let the excess chocolate drip. Sprinkle walnuts and a little sea salt on the chocolate covered portion. Refrigerate till set.', 'Wrap each bar with a piece of parchment paper, secure with a string and pack in tiffin box.']

title: Awadhi Pasanda
method: ['Take mutton pieces in a mixing bowl, add papaya paste, salt, green cardamom powder, fennel seed powder, mace powder, red chilli powder, cumin powder, crushed black peppercorns, clove powder, garam masala powder, ginger-garlic paste, green chillies, hung yogurt, fresh cream, cashewnut paste, roasted chana dal powder, browned onion paste, saffron, screw pine essence, rose water and coriander leaves and mix well together. Set aside in the refrigerator to marinate for 1-2 hours.', 'Heat ghee in a non-stick pan, add the marinated mutton, piece by piece, and cook for 20-25 minutes or till well done.', 'Transfer onto a serving plate, garnish with mint leaves and serve hot with with parantha.']

title: Mexican Corn on the Cob
method: ['Remove the husk off the corn.', 'Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, chopped coriander, paprika powder and salt in a bowl and mix well.', 'Roast the corn on direct flame till evenly done.', 'Spread the prepared mixture over the roasted corn. Grate cheese over the corn.', 'Sprinkle paprika on corn and serve hot garnished with chopped coriander and lemon wedges.']

title: Cheese Stuffed Smoked Salmon
method: ['Take cream cheese in a bowl. Add capers, lemon segments and dill and mix well.', 'Add crushed peppercorns and salt and mix well. Fill a piping bag with the mixture.', 'Place the fish slices on the worktop. Pipe out the mixture atone end of each fish slice and roll.', 'Place the fish rolls on cucumber slices and roll.', 'Place the rolls on a serving platter, sprinkle some salt and crushed peppercorns on top and serve immediately garnished with dill sprigs.']

title: Schezwan Bonda
method: ['Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan, add spring onion bulbs, garlic and ginger, mix and saute till translucent.', 'Add carrot, mix well and saute for 1 minute. Add French beans, mix well and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add 2 tbsps water, mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add Schezwan sauce and soy sauce and mix well.', 'Mash the potatoes and add to the pan. Add crushed black peppercorns and salt, mix till well combined.', 'Add spring onion greens and mix well. Transfer onto a plate and set aside to cool down to room temperature.', 'To make the batter, take Tata Sampann Pakoda/ Bonda Mix in a mixing bowl, add sufficient water, whisk well to make a smooth semi-thick batter.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into balls. Dip each ball in the batter and slide into hot oil and deep-fry on medium heat till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot with green chutney and Schezwan sauce.']

title: Oven Roasted Tomato Chutney
method: ['Preheat the oven at 200deg C. Combine the tomatoes, sea salt, olive oil, garlic and ginger in a baking dish.', 'Place the dish in the preheated oven and roast for twenty to twenty-five minutes or till dry.', 'Remove from oven and cool down to room temperature.Blend the roasted tomato mixture with coriander leaves and tamarind pulp till smooth.', 'Serve as an accompaniment with your choice of bread.']

title: Paneer Nuggets- SK Khazana
method: ['Cut cottage cheese into  1/2  inch cubes.', 'Mix together soy sauce, chilli sauce, ginger-garlic paste, crushed peppercorns and salt in a bowl. Add cottage cheese cubes and mix well.', 'Dust cottage cheese cubes with refined flour, coat with panko crumbs and dip in cornflour slurry. Dust with refined flour and coat with panko crumbs and keep on a plate.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Deep-fry the cottage cheese cubes till golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving plate and serve hot with a bowl of sweet chilli sauce.']

title: Chocolate Wontons
method: ['Heat cream in a non-stick pan till just warm.', 'Using a cookie cutter, cut out discs from half the wonton sheets and let the remaining be as it is.', 'Add chocolate to warm cream, switch off heat and mix well till the chocolate melts completely. Add walnuts and almonds and mix well. Transfer the ganache into a bowl and chill in the refrigerator.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a wok.', 'Place round and square wonton sheets on the worktop. Apply flour slurry on the edges and place a spoonful of ganache in the centre. Bring the edges together to seal, fold using flour slurry and give your choice of shape to the wontons.', 'Deep-fry wontons in hot oil till crisp and lightly browned. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange on a serving plate and serve immediately.']

title: Chicken Tikka Bites - SK Khazana
method: ['Take chicken pieces in a large bowl, add salt, ginger paste, garlic powder, egg white, red chilli paste, carom seeds, dried fenugreek leaf powder and hung yogurt. Squeeze the juice of  1/2  lemon and mix well. Set aside to marinate for 15-20 minutes.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Take dried bread crumbs on a plate, coat each chicken piece with it, slide into hot oil and deep-fry till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Transfer the chicken bites into a serving bowl and serve hot with mayonnaise.']

title: Stuffed Pancake
method: ['To make batter, put rice flour in a bowl, add coconut milk, eggs and salt and mix well to make a thick batter.', 'Heat a little oil in a non-stick pan, pour a ladleful of batter and spread into a pancake. Cook till the underside turns golden. Flip and cook till the other side is also done. Use the remaining batter to make more pancakes.', 'To make filling, heat one tablespoon oil in another non-stick pan, add ginger, garlic and onions and saute for a minute.', 'Add beansprouts, mushrooms and crabmeat and toss well.', 'Add white sauce, soy sauce, salt and crushed peppercorns and mix well. Cook for five to seven minutes.', 'Place a portion of the filling in the centre of each pancake, bring the edges together and seal to make a square shaped pancake.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Break eggs into another bowl and beat. Spread refined flour and breadcrumbs on two different plates.', 'Coat the stuffed pancakes with refined flour, dip in egg and finally coat with breadcrumbs.', 'Slide into hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp all over. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange on a serving plate and serve hot.']

title: Paneer Khurchan
method: ['Heat oil in a wide shallow non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and saute till they change colour. Add onions and mix well. Cook till they turn golden brown.', 'Meanwhile, cut cottage cheese into thick strips.', 'Add ginger-garlic paste to the pan and saute. Add a little water so that the masala does not burn and continue to saute for 1-2 minutes or till raw smells disappear.', 'Add tomato puree, mix well and saute till the oil separates.', 'Add Tata Sampann Paneer Masala and mix well. Add salt,  1/4  cup water, mix well and cook for 2 minutes.', 'Add onion, tomatoes, mixed colored capsicums and toss well.', 'Add cottage cheese strips and mix gently. Cook till the cottage cheese strips are slightly crisp on the outside, mixing gently occasionally.', 'Add butter and sprinkle dried fenugreek leaves powder. Mix gently and take the pan off the heat.', 'Transfer the prepared mixture into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.']

title: Chilli Tuna Fettuccine
method: ['Toast pine nuts in a non-stick pan till lightly browned. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Heat olive oil in the same pan. Add garlic and saute. Add chilli and saute. Add capers and saute for a minute.', 'Add tuna, mix and cook for 2 minutes. Add toasted pine nuts, mix and cook for a minute. Add salt, pepper powder and mix well.', 'Add fettuccine and  1/2  tablespoon chopped parsley. Mix well and switch off heat.', 'Serve hot garnished with remaining chopped parsley.']

title: Ukdiche Modak
method: ['Heat one and one-fourth cups of water with salt and one teaspoon oil in a deep non-stick pan.', 'Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and add the rice flour in a steady flow, stirring continuously to prevent lumps from forming. Cover the pan with a deep lid and pour some water into the lid. Cook on low heat for three minutes.', 'Remove the lid, sprinkle some cold water on the rice flour and cover again with the lid wBring to a boil, reduce heat, and add the rice flour in a steady flow, stirring continuously to prevent lumps from forming water in it; cook for another three minutes. Repeat this process twice more. Take the pan off the heat and keep it covered for two minutes.', 'Transfer the mixture to a large plate (parat), grease the palms of your hands with oil and knead the dough till completely smooth and pliable. The dough should not stick to your palms. Rest the dough covered with a damp cloth.', 'For the stuffing, combine the coconut and jaggery in a non-stick pan and cook on medium heat for one or two minutes till light golden brown. Make sure that you do not overcook the mixture. Add the roasted poppy seeds, cardamom powder and nutmeg powder, an', 'Divide the dough into twelve equal portions and shape them into balls. Grease the palms of your hands and spread each ball to form a three-inch bowl. Press the edges of the bowls to reduce the thickness.', 'Place a portion of the stuffing in the centre; pleat the edges of the dough and gather them together to form a bundle. Pinch to seal the edges at the top.', 'Heat sufficient water in a steamer. Place the modak on a perforated plate in the steamer and steam for ten to twelve minutes.', 'Serve hot modak with pure ghee.']

title: Queen Of Puddings
method: ['Preheat oven to 160degC/ 325degF. Grease an ovenproof mould with 2 tbsps butter.', 'Heat milk in a non stick pan. Place the breadcrumbs in a bowl. Add remaining butter and mix well.', 'Add lemon rind. Add sugar to milk and stir till it dissolves. Break eggs into a bowl and beat. Add hot milk to the breadcrumbs and let it soak. Add raisins and eggs and mix.', 'Pour the mixture into the prepared mould, taking care that it is not filled to the top.', 'Pour some water into a baking tray, keep the mould in it and bake in the preheated oven for 50-60 minutes.', 'Mix a jam of your choice with a little water to make a sauce. Drizzle the sauce over the pudding and serve hot.']

title: Chingri Macher Malai Curry
method: ['Take prawns in a bowl. Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder and salt, mix well and set aside to marinate.', 'Heat  1/2  tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan. Add the marinated prawns and saute for 2-3 minutes. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Heat remaining oil in a deep non-stick pan. Add onions and saute till they turn translucent. Add garlic and saute for a minute.', 'Add cashewnut paste and mix well. Add little water, mix and cook for a minute. Add mustard past and mix well.', 'Add coconut milk, mix well and simmer for 2 minutes. Add green chillies and mix well. Add sauteed prawns, mix well, add little water and mix well. Add salt, mix well and cook for a minute.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Breakfast Casserole
method: ['Preheat an oven at 180o C. Preheat an electric griller and grease it with some butter.', 'Fill a piping bag fitted with star nozzle with mashed potatoes.', 'Grill the tomato roundels on preheated griller from both sides till grill marks appear. Transfer on a plate. Similarly, grill bacons trips and bread slices brushing with some butter and transfer on 2 different plates.', 'Line an oval glass baking dish with grilled tomatoes. Pipe out mashed potato and place grilled bacon strips on top.', 'Break eggs on top. Sprinkle some salt, crushed peppercorns and mixed dried herbs on top.', 'Put the baking dish on a baking tray. Place the baking tray on preheated oven and bake for 8-10 minutes.', 'Garnish with coriander leaves and serve with grilled bread slices.']

title: Paya Soup
ingredients: ['12-16 lamb trotters (paya)', ' 3/4  cup onion paste', '1 tablespoon finely chopped ginger', '1 tablespoon finely chopped garlic', '4 green cardamoms', '1 inch cinnamon stick', '5-6 cloves', 'Salt to taste', ' 1/4  teaspoon turmeric powder', '2 tablespoons ghee', '2 medium onions, sliced', '1 teaspoon red chilli powder', '1 teaspoon crushed black peppercorns', '1 teaspoon garam masala powder', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves', '1 tablespoon lemon juice']
method: ['Heat a pressure cooker. Add lamb trotters, onion paste, ginger, garlic, cardamoms, cinnamon, cloves, salt, turmeric powder and 1 litre water and stir well. Cover and pressure cook till the pressure is released 4-5 times.', 'Heat ghee in a non-stick pan. Add onions and saute till translucent. Add chilli powder and crushed peppercorns and mix well. Add this to the cooker and simmer for 15 minutes.', 'Strain the soup into another non-stick pan on heat. Add lamb trotters, garam masala powder and coriander leaves, mix and boil. Add lemon juice and mix well.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Quinoa Sweet Potato and Orange Salad
method: ['Take quinoa in a bowl. Add walnuts, orange, arugula leaves and sweet potato pieces and mix well.', 'Add lemon juice, salt and crushed peppercorns and mix well.', 'Serve immediately.']

title: Khubani ka Meetha
method: ['Soak the apricots in three cups of water overnight. Remove the seeds. Crack open the seeds. Remove the kernels and blanch them. Remove the skin and set aside the kernels for garnishing.', 'Boil the apricots using the same water in which they were soaked. Add the Sugarfree Natura after ten minutes and mix well till well blended.', 'Remove from heat and cool slightly. Keeping aside some apricots, puree the rest.
