ingredients: ['2 tablespoons cocoa powder', '1 3/4  cups muesli + for garnish', '2 ripe bananas', '2 cups soy milk', '6-7 seedless dates, chopped', '1 apple', '8-10 orange segments', '2 tablespoons chia seeds', '2 tablespoons honey', 'Chopped mixed nuts for garnish', '10-12 black berries for garnish', '2-3 strawberries for garnish', '8-10 blueberries for garnish']
method: ['Peel and break bananas in half and put into a blender jar, add soy milk, dates and cocoa powder and blend to a find paste.', 'Grate apple into a large bowl, add orange segments, muesli and the blended mixture. Add chia seeds and honey and mix well. Cover and refrigerate overnight.', 'Transfer into serving bowls, sprinkle chopped mixed nuts and some muesli on top, garnish with a few black berries. Slice the strawberries and place on top, arrange a few blueberries and serve.']

title: Sattu Baingan Masala
method: ['Take sufficient water in a bowl, add  1/2  tsp turmeric powder and mix well. Slit brinjals without cutting through and immerse in turmeric water.', 'To prepare the stuffing, take sattu in another bowl, add onion, green chillies, ginger, 2 tsps red chilli powder, remaining turmeric powder,  1/4  tsp asafoetida, fennel powder, 1 1/2  tsps dried mango powder, coriander powder, cumin seeds, salt and 6 tsps mustard oil and mix well.', 'Heat 5 tsps mustard oil in a stainless steel pan till it begins to smoke.', 'Stuff the brinjals with the sattu mixture, place them in the hot pan, cover and shallow fry on low heat, stirring occasionally, till golden brown on all sides.', 'Heat another non-stick pan, add remaining mixture of sattu and dry roast till colour darkens. Spread this on a serving plate.', 'Heat remaining mustard oil in the same pan, add remaining asafoetida, brinjals, remaining red chilli powder, remaining dried mango powder and mix lightly. Cook for 1-2 minutes.', 'Place the brinjals over the sattu mixture spread on the serving plate. Garnish with coriander sprigs and serve hot.']

title: Persian Cake
method: ['Preheat oven to 180deg C. Grease a baking tin with some butter.', 'Mix together almond flour, refined flour, semolina, pistachios, baking powder and cardamom powder in a bowl.', 'Cream together castor sugar and eggs in another bowl till light and fluffy. Add yogurt and beat till well mixed.', 'Add flour mixture and fold in till well combined. Add orange zest, rose water and saffron and fold in well. Add little milk to adjust the consistency.', 'Pour batter into the prepared tin, place the tin in the preheated oven and bake for 30-40 minutes. Remove from oven, cool and demould.', 'Cut into wedges and serve.']

title: Grilled Banana And Custard Crumble
method: ['Peel bananas and trim them to fit into a baking dish. Heat butter in a non stick pan, add brown sugar and mix. Halve the bananas vertically and put them into the pan and saute on medium heat. Pour the custard into a baking dish.', 'Turn the banana halves so that they get cooked even on both the sides. To make the crumble, take rolled oats, refined flour and chilled butter in a bowl and mix with fingertips. Do not overwork the mixture. Preheat the oven to 200degC / 375degF.', 'Place the grilled bananas over the custard. Sprinkle the oats mixture over so as to cover the bananas completely. Sprinkle the remaining brown sugar on top. Bake in the preheated oven till the top becomes golden brown. Serve hot.']

title: Matar Mushroom Bharta
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and let them change colour. Add onion and saute till translucent.', 'Finely chop mushrooms in a food processor.', 'Add ginger and garlic to the onion and saute till fragrant. Add mushrooms and mix well. Add salt, turmeric powder, coriander powder and red chilli powder and mix well. Add tomato puree and mix well. Cover and cook on medium heat for 2-3 minutes or till the mushrooms are done.', 'Add green peas and mix well and cook till the peas are heated through. Transfer onto a serving plate, garnish with ginger strips and serve hot.']

title: Lemon Chicken With Chickpeas
method: ['Heat olive oil in a deep non stick pan. Crush garlic and add and saute for 1 minute. Add chicken and saute, stirring occasionally, for 4-5 minutes. Cut each lemon into 8 equal parts and remove the seeds.', 'Add refined flour to the chicken and mix well. Saute for 1 minute and add salt, peppercorns and mix well. Add chicken stock and mix. Add chickpeas and mix again. Add tomato puree and mix. Add the lemon pieces and mix gently. Cover and cook on high heat for 5-7 minutes. Reduce heat and cook for 15-20 minutes or till chicken is completely done. Serve hot.']

title: Anda Parantha - SK Khazana
method: ['Break eggs in toa bowl. Add cumin powder, chilli powder, turmeric powder, green chillies, salt, onions and coriander leaves and beat well.', 'Dust the worktop with some flour.', 'Divide the dough into equal balls and roll out each into a medium sized disc. Apply some ghee on top, dust some flour, fold  2/3  of the disc. Apply some ghee on top of this portion and fold the remaining  1/3  over. Again apply some ghee. Again fold  2/3  over, apply ghee and fold the remaining  1/3  over to make a square. Roll out into square parantha.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa. Place each parantha on it and roast, turning sides, till lightly browned from both the sides.', 'Open the layers of the parantha, spoon in some egg mixture and press. Cook applying ghee and turning sides, till egg is fully cooked and the parantha golden brown on both the sides.', 'Cut into squares and serve hot with tomato ketchup.']

title: Cheesy Cheela Sandwich
method: ['Take Tata Sampann Multi Grain Chilla Mix in a bowl, add 1 1/2  cups water and whisk to a smooth and thick batter. .', 'For each sandwich, heat  1/2  tsp oil of in a small non-stick pan, spread it with a tissue paper and pour a ladle of batter and spread it by rotating the pan. Heat  1/2  tsp in another small non-stick pan, spread it with a tissue paper and pour a ladle of batter and spread it by rotating the pan.', 'Drizzle a little oil all around both the chillas and cook for 2-3 minutes on low heat.', 'Meanwhile, grate cheddar cheese and mozzarella cheese in a bowl.', 'Flip both the chillas and cook for 2-3 minutes on the other side too.', 'Snip and add basil leaves, dried oregano and dried red chilli flakes to the cheese and mix well.', 'Keep both the chillas on the worktop, place a portion of the prepared stuffing on one chilla and cover it with the other to make a sandwich.', 'Heat another non-stick pan, drizzle a little oil in the hot pan, place the chilla sandwich in it and cook, turning sides, till golden brown and crisp on both sides.', 'Make more chilla sandwiches in the same way.', 'Cut them into half and place them on a serving plate and serve hot with green chutney.']

title: Gulab Jamun Tartlets
method: ['Heat cream in a non-stick pan, stirring continuously with a spatula. Transfer into a bowl. Break caramel chocolate bars and put into the same bowl, keep the bowl in a Microwave and heat for 1 minute. Take the bowl out and mix well till the chocolate melts completely and becomes smooth.', 'Chop walnuts, add to the melted chocolate and mix well. Add mini gulab jamuns and mix well.', 'Place the tartlet shells on the worktop, fill them up with this chocolate mixture. Garnish with rabdi and pistachios.', 'Arrange the tartlets on a serving platter and serve immediately.']

title: Instant Ragi Uttapam
method: ['Combine semolina and  3/4  cup yogurt in a bowl and mix. Add finger millet flour, onion, capsicum, ginger, green chillies, cumin seeds and mustard seeds and mix well.', 'Add remaining yogurt and mix. Add some water,mix well and set aside for 5 minutes.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa.', 'Add curry leaves, baking soda and salt to prepared flour mixture and mix well.', 'Put some oil on hot tawaand wipe with a tissue. Pour a ladleful of prepared flourmixture, spread into a shape of uttapam and roast till the underside turnslight golden. Make incisions on each cooked uttapam and roast from the other side till golden and crisp.', 'Cut into 4 equal pieces and serve hot.']

title: Dalia Porridge - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat ghee in a pressure cooker, add broken wheat, mix and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add 4 cups water, mix, cover the cooker and cook under pressure till 4-5 whistles are released. Open the cooker once the pressure is reduced completely.', 'Keep the cooker back on heat, add seedless dates, cashewnut powderand honey and blend to a coarse mixture with an electric hand blender.', 'Add milk and mix well and cook for a minute on medium heat.\nTransfer into serving bowls. Top up with apple, garnish with mint sprig and serve warm.']

title: Mohanthaal
method: ['Place the gram flour in a bowl. Heat a non-stick pan; add one and a half tablespoons ghee and two tablespoons milk and warm slightly. Add this to the gram flour and mix with your fingertips till the mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Pass through a thick sieve so that the crumbs are smooth.\nGrease an eight inch thali.', 'Heat the remaining ghee in a thick-bottomed non-stick pan. Add the gram flour mixture and cook on medium heat till fragrant and darker in colour.', 'Meanwhile, cook the sugar and half a cup of water, stirring till the sugar dissolves. Add the 2 teaspoons milk and collect the scum which rises to the surface with a ladle, and discard. Cook to make a syrup of one-and-a-half string consistency.', 'Soak the saffron in one tablespoon of warm milk for ten minutes. Add it to sugar syrup and mix well.', 'Add half the green cardamom powder and nutmeg powder to the gram flour and mix. Take the pan off the heat and keep stirring till the mixture cools completely.', 'Add the syrup to the gram flour mixture and stir continuously, till all the liquid is absorbed and the mixture thickens and becomes a little dry.', 'Pour the mixture into the greased thali and spread evenly. Smooth the top and sprinkle the almonds and pistachios. Sprinkle the remaining cardamom powder and set aside to cool.', 'Cut into squares and serve.\nMakes 500 grams']

title: Bacon Breadsticks
method: ['Preheat oven at 180oC. Grease the baking tray with some oil.', 'Heat a non-stick pan. Add the bacon rashers and fry till crisp. Remove the fried bacon onto a plate and reserve the fat.', 'Take 1 tablespoon water in a bowl. Add sugar and heat in a microwave for 10 seconds.', 'Take flour in another bowl. Add salt and crushed peppercorns.', 'Add yeast to the sweetened water, mix and set aside till the yeast activates.', 'Heat the bacon fat in a non-stick pan. Add garlic and saute lightly. Remove from heat and let it cool.', 'Chop parsley sprigs and add to the flour mixture.', 'Cut the fried bacon into small pieces and add to the flour mixture along with the garlic and bacon fat. Mix well.', 'Add the yeast and mix well. Add  3/4  cup water and knead into a soft dough.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions and roll them into thin long sticks. Twist them, place on the greased tray, put in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes.', 'Remove from heat, cool and serve as an accompaniment.']

title: Jain Chole Bhature
method: ['Take refined flour in a large bowl, add baking powder, baking soda, powdered sugar and salt and mix well. Add yogurt and 2 tsps oil and mix well with your hand. Add sufficient water and knead into soft dough. Set aside to rest for 15-20 minutes.', 'To make chole, heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan, add cinnamon, cloves, black peppercorns, bay leaves and dried red chilli, mix and saute till fragrant.', 'Add cabbage, mix and saute well till it turns golden brown. Discard bay leaves and saute the mixture for a few seconds.', 'Add tomatoes, green chillies, 1 tbsp coriander leaves, salt, turmeric powder and red chilli powder, mix well and saute for 1 minute.', 'Add sugar, mix well, cover and cook for 3-4 minutes or till oil separates. Switch off the heat and let the mixture cool slightly. Transfer the mixture into a blender jar, add a little of the reserved cooking liquour and blend to a fine paste,', 'Heat 2 tbsps oil in another non-stick pan, add remaining turmeric powder, remaining red chilli powder, coriander-cumin powder, garam masala powder and Tata Sampann Chole Masala, mix well and saute on low heat for 1 minute. Add the ground paste and mix well. Rinse the blender jar with  1/4  cup water and add to the pan, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.', 'Add cooked chickpeas and mix well. Add a little cooking liquour and mix well. Cover and cook for 3-4 minutes. Remover the cover, add remaining coriander leaves and dried fenugreek leaves and mix well. Cover the pan till it is time to serve.', 'To make bhature, heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Drizzle 2 tsps oil on the dough and knead lightly. Divide the dough into equal portions and shape them into balls.', 'Grease the worktop with some oil and roll each dough ball into an oval shaped disc. Gently slide the bhature, one at a time, into hot oil and deep fry till they puff up. Turn over and fry till they turn a light golden on both sides. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Transfer the chole into a serving bowl, garnish with fried green chillies and serve hot with bhature.']

title: Jain Sichuan Fried Rice
method: ['To make Jain Sichuan sauce, heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add red capsicum and yellow capsicum and saute. Add salt, mix and saute till capsicums turn soft.', 'Add celery, mix well and cook for two minutes. Add chilli sauce, mix well and cook till the oil leaves the sides of the pan. Transfer into a bowl.', 'Heat one teaspoon oil in a non-stick wok, add cabbage and saute. Add red cabbage and saute. Add capsicum, yellow and green zucchini, mix well and saute.', 'Add black pepper powder, salt, sugar and soy sauce, mix well and cook.', 'Add rice, Sichuan sauce and mix well. Cook for two minutes.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Spinach Cheese Balls-SK Khazana
method: ['Mix together spinach puree, cornflour, breadcrumbs, panko breadcrumbs, salt and pepper powder in a bowl.', 'Mix together cheddar cheese, processed cheese, salt, pepper powder and chilli flakes in another bowl.', 'Divide the cheese mixture into equal balls. Divide the spinach mixture into equal portions.', 'Spread each spinach portion in your palm, place a cheese ball in the centre, bring the edges together and shape into a ball. .', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Deep-fry balls golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Mix together cabbage, carrot, pepper powder, salt and lemon juice in a bowl.', 'Spread this salad on a serving platter, keep the spinach cheese balls over it and serve immediately.']

title: Balti Pear Chicken
method: ['Marinate boneless chicken for about an hour preferably in a refrigerator in a mixture of yogurt, salt, half teaspoon red chilli powder, half teaspoon garam masala powder and pear puree. Add one fourth teaspoon of turmeric powder. Chop a few sprigs of coriander', 'Grill the marinated chicken pieces on a bar-be-que, turning sides a few times, till evenly cooked all around. Once done cut into medium sized pieces.', 'Heat oil in a balti (or a pan), add black peppercorns, green cardamoms, bay leaves, cinnamon, whole red chillies and saute. Add chopped onions and saute till onions turn golden. Add garlic paste and continue to saute. Add tomato puree and mix. Add half teaspoon turmeric powder, half teaspoon red chilli powder and saute for a few minutes.', 'Add the remaining marinade and mix well. Add one cup of water and let it cook for three to four minutes. Add chopped pear and mix.', 'Remove the bay leaf and adjust salt. Break some coriander leaves with hand and add to the gravy. Add the grilled chicken pieces and cook on low heat for three to four minutes.', 'Add half teaspoon of garam masala and mix well.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Matar ke Samose
method: ['Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan. Add carom seeds and asafoetida and saute for  1/2  minute.', 'Add ginger paste, coriander powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, salt, sugar, cashewnuts and raisins. Mix well and saute for 2 minutes.', 'Add green peas, mix well and saute. Add  1/4  cup water and cook for 2 minutes.', 'Chop coriander sprigs and add. Mix well and cook till dry.', 'Add lemon juice and switch off heat. Crush the mixture with a masher and transfer into a bowl. Cool to room temperature.', 'Spread little flour paste on one end of a samosa patti and fold into a triangle with a pocket. Fill little cooked peas mixture and fold over and make into a samosa sealing the end flap with the flour paste.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Deep-fry samosas till golden ad crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot with green chutney.']

title: Guava Popsicles
method: ['Put guava juice, cumin powder, chilli powder, black salt, salt, lemon juice and mint leaves in a bowl and mix well.', 'Put lemon slices in the popsicle mould tray and fill them with prepared guava mixture. Cover and put in freezer till set.', 'Demould and serve immediately.']

title: White Gravy
method: ['Place onions in a pan. Add a cup of water and boil till soft. Drain and cool. Grind into a smooth paste.', 'Soak the cashewnuts in half cup of warm water for half an hour and grind to a smooth paste. Heat oil in a handi and add boiled onion paste.', 'Stir and add garlic paste, ginger, paste, green cardamoms, slit green chillies.', 'Stir and add grated mawa and cashewnut paste. Stir. Add half cup of water and mix. Cook on low heat for five to ten minutes.', 'Add whisked yogurt, salt and white pepper powder. Stir and cook for a minute. Cool.']

title: Rasiya Muthiya
method: ['Take rice in a mixing bowl, add gram flour, wheat flour,  1/4  teaspoon turmeric powder,  1/2  teaspoon red chilli powder, coriander powder, cumin powder and salt and mix well. Add 1 tablespoon oil and mix. Add water as required, mix and knead into a soft dough. Let the dough rest for 2 minutes.', 'Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and once they start to splutter, add asafoetida, remaining turmeric powder, remaining red chilli powder, buttermilk, 2-3 tablespoons water and salt, mix and bring to a boil.', 'Divide the rice dough into equal portions, shape into muthiyas and add to the pan. Rinse the bowl with a little water and add the pan, mix and cook till the muthiyas turn soft.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.']

title: Thai Lamb Wraps
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add garlic and saute for a minute.', 'Add onions and saute till they turn translucent.', 'Add red curry paste, mix well and saute well.', 'Add little water and saute further till the oil separates.', 'Add lamb mince, mix well and cook. Add salt and mix well. Sprinkle little water, mix, cover and cook on low heat till the lamb is fully done.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa. Place the chapattis one by one on it and heat till warm.', 'Add torn basil leaves and coconut milk to the lamb mixture and mix well.', 'Place spoonful of lamb mixture on the chapattis and roll.', 'Serve immediately garnished with basil leaves.']

title: Aloo Fingers
method: ['Take cooked samo in a bowl, add ginger-green chilli paste, rock salt, coriander leaves and amaranth flour. Grate the potatoes into the bowl and mix well.', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape each portion into medium sized finger.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai, slide in the aloo fingers and deep fry on high heat till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange the aloo fingers on a serving platter and serve hot with green chutney.']

title: Herb Crusted Basa
method: ['Preheat oven to 180deg C.', 'Place fish fillets in a bowl, add ginger-garlic paste, salt and lemon juice, mix well and set aside to marinate for five to seven minutes.', 'To make the crust, tear the bread slices and put in a grinder jar. Add parsley, coriander leaves, mint leaves, torn basil leaves and half teaspoon butter and grind into a coarse powder.', 'Line a baking tray with aluminium foil and grease the foil with a little butter.', 'Add crushed red chillies to the crust mixture and mix well.', 'Arrange the marinated fish fillets on the lined baking tray and place the crust mixture over each fillet. Press well.', 'Keep tray in the preheated oven and bake for five to seven minutes or till the fish is tender.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Fruit and Vegetable Popsicles
method: ['Peel and put bananas in a blender jar. Add sweet potato, blueberries, cranberries, kale, peaches and apple juice and blend well.', 'Pour the prepared mixture into popsicle moulds and freeze till set.', 'Demould and serve immediately.']

title: Chapatti
method: ['Take flour in a parat. Add 2 tablespoons oil and salt and mix well. Add some water and knead into a dough. Add remaining oil and knead into a stiff dough. Cover with a wet muslin cloth and set aside for 10-15 minutes.', 'Heat a non-stick pan.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions and roll out into chapattis dusting with flour.', 'Roast the prepared chapattis equally from both sides on the hot pan. Press the chapatti with a cloth and remove from heat.', 'Spread some ghee over chapattis. Serve hot.']

title: Dal Dhokli - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat a non-stick pan, add pigeon peas and sufficient water, cover and bring to a boil.', 'Once it is almost done, add peanuts,  1/2  teaspoon turmeric powder and some water, mix, cover and cook till almost done.', 'To make dhokli, mix together gram flour, wheat flour, a pinch asafoetida,  1/2  teaspoon chilli powder, remaining turmeric powder and salt. Add sufficient water knead into a hard dough. Add 1 tablespoon oil, knead and set aside.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions, place on the worktop, dust with some wheat flour and roll out into thin rotis. Cut into small cubes.', 'Heat ghee in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add cumin seeds, curry leaves and garlic, mix and saute well.', 'Add red chillies and asafoetida, mix and saute till fragrant. Add green chilli paste, mix and saute for a minute.', 'Add the tempering to the dal and mix well. Add water as required, kokum petals and jaggery and mix well, mix and simmer for a few minutes.', 'Add dhokli strips, salt and coriander leaves, mix well and cook till the dhokli pieces are fully done.', 'Transfer into serving bowls and serve hot garnished with coriander sprig.']

title: Grilled Chicken Kathi Roll
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan.', 'Tear grilled chicken into pieces and put on a plate.', 'Add  3/4  of sliced onion to the pan along with salt and saute on medium heat till onion turns golden. Add tomato, mix and saute for a minute. Add turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon chilli powder, cumin powder and coriander power, mix and cook on medium heat for 4-5 minutes.', 'Add coriander leaves and grilled chicken and mix well. Add some water, mix and cook for 2-3 minutes. Switch off heat, add salt and garam masala powder and mix well.', 'To prepare salad, put green capsicum, remaining onion, salt, chaat masala and a pinch chilli powder and mix well.', 'Take each roti, spread some green chutney over, place some salad and chicken mixture on one side, roll and halve.', 'Serve immediately.']

title: Aloo Ke Sooley
method: ['In a large bowl combine gram flour, rice flour, red chilli powder and turmeric powder.', 'Combine green cardamoms, coriander seeds and cumin seeds. Grind to a powder and add it to gram flour mixture. Mix well. Add yogurt, salt and two to three tablespoons water. Blend it well.', 'Add potatoes and marinate for thirty minutes. Preheat oven to 200degC.', 'Skewer potato halves pieces onto sticks and cook in the preheated oven, basting in between with ghee, till golden brown. Serve with green chutney.']

title: Mixed Sprouts Poha
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Roughly chop green chillies.', 'Add mustard seeds to the pan and let them splutter. Add onions and saute till translucent. Add green chillies and turmeric powder and mix well. Add mixed sprouts, pressed rice, salt, sugar and lemon juice and mix well. Cook for 4-5 minutes.', 'Transfer the poha onto a serving plate and serve immediately.']

title: Crab in Black Pepper Sauce
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick wok, add garlic and saute for half a minute. Add crushed peppercorns and mix well.', 'Add crab claws and cook for two to three minutes. Add sugar and salt and mix well.', 'Add chicken stock and mix well. Cover and cook for five to six minutes.', 'Transfer onto a serving plate, garnish with spring onion flower and serve hot.']

title: Dum Chicken Keema
method: ['In a blender jar, add almonds, roasted chickpeas, cumin seeds, caraway seeds, green cardamoms and blend to a fine powder.', 'In a wide pan, add chicken mince,  1/4  cup yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, green chillies and lemon juice. Add ginger, prepared powder and salt. Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder and Tata Sampann Chicken Masala and mix well. Add remaining yogurt and mix well.', 'Place the pan on heat and add mint leaves in the pan. Drizzle 1 tbsp oil, cover and cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.', 'Add remaining oil, mix well. Add chopped coriander and saute for 8-10 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, heat a charcoal piece on direct flame.', 'Place a small stainless steel bowl in the centre of the keema, transfer the charcoal in it, add cloves and drizzle a little oil. Cover with a lid, switch the heat off and place a heavy object on top of the lid. Let the smoke infuse for 2-3 minutes.', 'Take the bowl out and transfer the prepared dum chicken keema into a serving bowl.', 'Garnish with ginger strips, green chilli strips, chopped coriander and mint sprig. Serve hot.']

title: Banana Walnut Chocolate Ice Cream
method: ['Cut each banana into 3 pieces and put in a grinder jar. Add cocoa powder, cream, honey, walnuts and vanilla essence and grind into a smooth mixture.', 'Pour this mixture into an air tight container and put the lid on. Keep it in the freezer for 6-8 hours or overnight.', 'Once set take the ice cream out of the freezer. Dip ice cream scooper in warm water and then scoop out 5 scoops of ice cream into a serving bowl. Skew the banana coated with melted dark chocolate onto a skewer and place it on the rim of the bowl. Use sugar fondant to create eyes and nose of a penguin. Garnish with crushed walnuts and serve immediately.']

title: Brownie Trifle
method: ['Take cream cheese in a bowl. Add whipped cream and vanilla essence and whisk well. Fill it in a piping bag fitted with star nozzle.', 'Roughly crumb the brownies and put into individual serving glasses. Pipe out some cream mixture, put some hazelnut and drizzle some caramel sauce on top. Repeat the process.', 'Dust some cocoa powder on top and serve immediately.']

title: Chicken Cutlet
method: ['Take chicken mince in a large bowl, add garlic, ginger, green chillies, coriander leaves, mint leaves, crushed black peppercorns, kasundi sauce, salt and Tata Sampann Meat Masala and mix well.', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions.', 'Spread bread crumbs on a plate and break in the eggs in a shallow bowl and whisk well with a fork.', 'Grease the palm of the hands with oil, shape the chicken portions into balls and dip in the eggs and roll on breadcrumbs and place on a worktop. Flatten the ball and shape into a triangle.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick tawa, place the prepared triangles and shallow fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot with green chutney, tomato ketchup and salad.']

title: Paneer Pizza Sandwich - SK Khazana
method: ['To make stuffing, take sweet corn in a large bowl, add yellow capsicum, red capsicum, green capsicum, cottage cheese and vegetarian mayonnaise. Grate cheese into the bowl, add red chilli flakes, mixed herbs, salt and paneer masala and mix well.', 'Halve the pizza bases horizontally and apply butter and green chutney on the cut sides of all the halves. Spread a portion of the stuffing on one side of each pizza base and cover it with the other.', 'Heat a griller, apply a little butter on top of each sandwich and place it on the griller. Grill till golden brown and crisp on both sides.', 'Arrange them on serving platter and serve hot with tomato ketchup and green chutney.']

title: Black Pav Bhaji - SK Khazana
method: ['To make the black spice mixture, dry roast the dried coconut piece on direct flame till charred well from all sides. Set aside to cool.', 'Heat a non-stick pan, add bay leaves, driedcoconut slices, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, cloves, cinnamon stick, black peppercorns, black cardamom and stone flower, and dry roast on low heat till fragrant and well browned. Set aside to cool slightly.', 'Transfer the roasted spices into a blender jar. Cut the charred coconut into small pieces and add to the spice mixture and blend into a fine powder.', 'To make the bhaji, heat butter in a kadai. When it melts, add onions and saute till golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste, mix and saute for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add tomato and salt, mix well and saute till tomato is pulpy. Add potatoes, capsicum and green peas and mix well.', 'Add pav bhaji masala powder and 2 1/2  tbsps roasted spice powder and mix well. Add 2 cups water, mix well and let the mixture come to a boil. Cook for 4-6 minutes or till it thickens. Add coriander leaves and mix well. Take the pan off the heat.', 'Heat a little butter on a non-stick tawa, slit the pavs and place them on it and toast on both sides till golden brown.', 'Transfer bhaji into a serving plate, garnish it with butter and coriander leaves and serve hot with pavs, chopped onion and lemon wedges.']

title: Kashmiri Lamb Chops
method: ['Wash lamb chops and beat with a steak hammer to break the fibres.', 'Heat a pressure cooker. Add lamb chops, milk, cinnamon, fennel seeds, green cardamoms and black peppercorns and cook till the pressure is released three times. Open the lid once the pressure is completely reduced.', 'Add khoya and salt and put the cooker back on heat and cook till all the moisture is absorbed.', 'Whisk together yogurt, refined flour, garam masala powder, ginger-garlic paste, salt and turmeric powder in a bowl to make a smooth thick batter.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Dip the chops in the batter and deep-fry in the hot oil on medium heat till golden. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving plate and serve hot.']

title: Muesli
method: ['Mix together oats and orange juice in a bowl and keep aside for 10-15 minutes.', 'Add pear, apple, apricots, walnuts, kiwi, orange segments and yogurt and mix well.', 'Add honey and mix. Chill in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with fresh pomegranate pearls and serve.']

title: Southern Style Chicken Drumsticks
method: ['Take chicken drumsticks in a bowl. Add tomato ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, ginger, brown sugar, garlic and onion and mix well. Add salt and mix. Set aside to marinate for 30 minutes.', 'Preheat oven to180deg C. Grease a baking tray with some oil.', 'Place the marinated chicken on it and apply the leftover marinade on the pieces. Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 15 minutes.', "To make the sauce, take tomato ketchup, cider vinegar, brown sugar, chilli flakes, bird's eye chillies and parsley in a bowl and mix well.", 'Drizzle the sauce on the baked chicken drumsticks, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.']

title: Kadai Vegetables
method: ['Grind the coriander, cumin seeds and three red chillies coarsely. Grind the garlic, green chillies and half the ginger to a paste. Cut the remaining ginger into thin strips. Heat the oil in a kadai. Add the coarsely ground spice powder and saute for a while. Add the onions and saute till golden brown.', 'Add the garlic-green chilli-ginger paste and saute for one minute. Add all the vegetables, except the capsicums, and stir. Cook, covered over low heat, till the carrots are almost done. Sprinkle a little water if necessary. Add the turmeric powder, coriander powder and chilli powder and stir-fry continuously.', 'Add the tomatoes, salt and half a cup of water and cook till the vegetables are cooked and the water has dried up. Add the capsicums and salt. Cook for four or five minutes over low heat. Sprinkle with garam masala powder. Serve hot, garnished with ginger strips and coriander leaves.']

title: Hummus
method: ['Soak the chickpeas overnight. Drain and boil in fresh water till soft. Cool and remove the skin and put them in a food processor container.', 'Add garlic, salt and tahina and blend. Add two tablespoons olive oil and blend. Add lemon juice and continue to blend till absolutely smooth.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and chill in the refrigerator. Just before serving drizzle the remaining olive oil. Sprinkle red chilli powder.', 'Place two to three whole chickpeas on top and serve with pita bread.']

title: Missal Pav - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a deep non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add asafoetida and curry leaves and saute till curry leaves crackle.', 'Add  3/4  chopped onion and saute till light golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and saute for 1 minute.', 'Reduce heat, add turmeric powder, chilli powder and goda masala and mix well.', 'Add  1/4  cup water, moth sprouts, mix and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add 2-3 cups water and salt, mix and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and cook till the sprouts are fully done.', 'To prepare kat, heat remaining oil in a non-stick pan, add remaining chilli powder and swirl. Add salt and 1 cup water, mix and cook on low heat till the oil separates. Transfer into a bowl.', 'Put missal in a serving bowl. Top with some farsan and garnish with remaining chopped onion, coriander leaves and lemon wedge.', 'Serve hot with pav and kat.']

title: Mutton Dalcha-SK Khazana
method: ['Pressure cook pigeon peas, Bengal gram with salt,  1/4  teaspoon turmeric powder in sufficient water till pressure is released 2-3 times.', 'Heat ghee and oil in another pressure cooker. Add caraway seeds and saute till seeds change colour.', 'Add cinnamon, cardamoms, cloves and onions, mix and saute till onions are well browned.', 'Add ginger-garlic paste and mix. Add mutton and mix. Add tomatoes and mix.', 'Add chilli powder, remaining turmeric powder, coriander powder and salt, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add yogurt and mix well. Add green chillies and sufficient water, cover and pressure cook till the pressure is released 4-5 times.', 'Add bottle gourd and cooked pigeon peas and Bengal gram, mix well, cover and pressure cook till the pressure is released 2-3 times.', 'Add garam masala powder and lemon juice, mix well and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Add coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.']

title: Date & Walnut Cookies
method: ['Preheat the oven to 180deg C', 'Heat butter in a non-stick pan, add sugar and stir till both the butter and sugar melt and combine well.', 'Sieve flour, baking soda and baking powder into a bowl.', 'Transfer the sugar-butter mixture into a large mixing bowl, break in an egg in the bowl and add a 1 tbsp flour mixture, and mix well. Break in the remaining egg and repeat the process.', 'Take walnuts and dates in another bowl, add a little flour mixture and mix.', 'Add the remaining flour mixture to the sugar-butter-egg mixture and mix well. Add the walnuts and dates and mix well.', 'Add milk and mix. Add vanilla essence, mix well to make a smooth lump free batter. Add chocolate chips and mix.', 'Grease a baking dish with butter. Pour the prepared batter in this dish, keep it in the preheated oven and bake for 30-40 minutes.', 'Take it out of the oven and cut into squares. Set aside to cool down to room temperature.', 'Remove the pieces from the baking dish, arrange them on a serving plate and serve.']

title: Chicken Biryani
method: ['Cut chicken in one inch pieces. Boil rice and set aside. Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cinnamon, bay leaves, cloves, cumin seeds, green cardamoms and saute for half a minute.', 'Add sliced onions and saute. Add slit green chillies and chicken cubes and continue to saute. Add turmeric powder and mix. Add tomatoes and salt and mix. Add ginger-garlic paste, red chilli powder and yogurt. Mix well.', 'Add half the fried brown onions. Add the boiled rice on top. Sprinkle garam masala powder, ginger strips, mint leaves and coriander leaves. Sprinkle milk, rose water and remaining browned onions.', 'Cover and cook on low heat for about ten minutes. Garnish with the egg slices and serve hot.']

title: Oodles Of Noodles
method: ['Diagonally slice spring onions and French beans. Cut the red and yellow capsicums into strips.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add spring onions and saute for a minute. Add French beans and saute for a minute on high heat.', 'Add corn kernels, boiled noodles, red and yellow capsicums, soy sauce, tomato ketchup, sweet chilli sauce and salt.', 'Toss and mix. Chop spring onion greens and add along with bean sprouts. Toss and mix well.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Mexican Fried Rice
method: ['Heat half tablespoon of oil in a non-stick pan. Keep a round mould in the centre and break an egg into it and fry. This way the egg will get a perfect shape. Set aside.', 'Heat the remaining oil in a separate non-stick pan. Add the garlic and onions and saute till the onions turn light brown', 'Add the grated carrots, red capsicums, yellow capsicums, tomato ketchup and red chilli sauce. Mix well and cook for two to three minutes', 'Add the grated carrots, red capsicums, yellow capsicums, tomato ketchup and red chilli sauce. Mix well and cook for two to three minutes.', 'Add the rice, salt and mixed dried herbs. Toss well.\nKeep a round mould on a serving dish and transfer the rice into it and pack it in tightly. Gently remove the mould, place the fried egg on top and serve immediately garnished with parsley sprigs.']

title: Grilled Veggie Sandwich
method: ['Preheat an electric griller.', 'Put oil, crushed peppercorns, salt, chilli flakes, torn thyme sprigs and garlic in a bowl and mix. Add yellow zucchini, green tomato, red tomato, separated onion roundels, green zucchini and brinjal and mix well.', 'Grease the preheated griller with some oil, place the marinated vegetables and grill till golden on both sides. Transfer them onto a plate.', 'Take mayonnaise in another bowl. Add sriracha sauce and mix well.', 'Spread some mayonnaise-sriracha mixture on 4 toasted bread slices. Put some iceberg lettuce and grilled vegetables on top and cover with remaining bread slices.', 'Halve each sandwich and serve immediately.']

title: Prawn Fritters On Sugarcane Sticks
method:
['In a bowl mix together prawns, onion, green chilli, spring onion, coriander leaves, salt and crushed black peppercorns.', 'Add lemon juice and mix well.
Coarsely grind this mixture and transfer into a bowl.', 'Scrape the sugarcane and cut into thin long strips.
Remove the sides of the bread and grind into crumbs.', 'Whisk egg in a bowl.
Add 1 tbsp water and whisk well to make egg wash.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a deep pan.
Dampen your hands, take small portions of prawn mixture and pat it around a sugarcane stick and shape them like lollipops.', 'Dip them in the egg wash and coat with bread pieces.
Deep fry in hot oil till golden brown.', 'Drain on absorbent paper.
Serve hot with tomato sauce.']

title: Brown Bread - SK Khazana
method: ['Sieve whole wheat flour, refined flour and milk powder into a bowl. Add castor sugar and salt and mix well. Make a well in the centre, add yeast and mix. Add sufficient water and knead into soft dough.', 'Dust plain flour on the worktop, keep the dough on it and knead stretching it a little. Apply softened butter and continue to knead. Keep the dough in a bowl, cover with a damp cloth and set aside for 20-25 minutes to prove.', 'Dust flour on the worktop, keep the dough on it and knock back the dough. Roll the dough into a disc of medium thickness. Fold from one end to the other to make a log.', 'Place the log in a greased and dusted bread tin and cover with a damp muslin cloth. Keep aside to prove for 15-20 minutes.', 'Preheat the oven at 180o C.', 'Brush milk on top, keep the tin in the preheated oven bake it for 15-20 minutes. Take it out of the oven and brush melted butter on top.', 'Let it cool down to room temperature. Slice and serve.']

title: Chicken with Walnuts
method: ['Put egg, four tablespoons cornflour, salt and one tablespoon soy sauce in a bowl and mix. Add chicken pieces and set aside, to marinate, for half an hour.', 'Mix remaining cornflour in one cup of water.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a wok and deep-fry marinated chicken for two to three minutes. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Heat three tablespoons oil in a non-stick wok. Add garlic and red chillies and saute for half a minute. Add onion, celery, button mushrooms and all the capsicum pieces and continue to saute for a couple of minutes.', 'Add remaining soy sauce, sugar, chicken stock and salt and mix. Bring the mixture to a boil and stir in the cornflour mixture. Cook on medium heat, stirring continuously, for a minute or until the sauce starts to thicken.', 'Add fried chicken and walnut kernels and continue to cook for a couple of minutes on high heat, tossing and turning continuously.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.']

title: Palak Bahar
method: ['Puree the blanched spinach along with one green chilli. Chop the remaining green chillies.', 'Heat half the oil, add ginger and garlic and stir fry. Add onion and green chillies and stir fry till onions are pinkish in colour. Add nutmeg powder and continue cooking on medium heat for a couple of minute, stirring frequently. Add pureed spinach, cook it for a minute and add salt. Set it aside.', 'Blanch carrots, French beans and cauliflower.', 'Heat the remaining oil in a frying pan, add cumin seeds and when it starts to change colour, add tomatoes.', 'Cook on medium heat for three to four minutes, stirring continuously.', 'Add blanched vegetables and stir-fry lightly. Add lemon juice and season with salt and red chilli powder. Lastly add garam masala powder and coriander leaves.', 'Spread prepared spinach on a flat serving dish and place cooked vegetables in the center and serve hot.']

title: Pyaaz Tamatar Ka Bun
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan.', 'Add cumin seeds and when they change colour add onions and saute till the onions are soft. Add tomatoes, salt and red chilli powder and mix. Add sugar and mix. Slit the buns without cutting through.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa. Apply a little butter and some of the onion-tomato mixture on the inner side of the buns. Place them on the tawa, drizzle a little oil or butter. Press them lightly, turn over and roast till both sides are crisp.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Prune & Spinach Kebab
method: ['Blanch spinach in boiling hot water for a minute and then refresh in cold water. Chop roughly. Stuff each prune with a baby tomato and set aside.', 'Heat oil in pan. Add chopped onions and saute for two to three minutes. Add chopped green chillies, ginger paste and garlic paste and saute for two minutes. Add chopped spinach and mix well. Add salt, mix and remove from heat.', 'Put the spinach mixture in a bowl. Add mashed potatoes, salt, garam masala powder and chaat masala and mix well. Add cornflour and mix.', 'Divide into eight equal portions. Stuff each portion with a prune (stuffed with baby tomato) and shape into a tikki.', 'Heat oil in a fry pan and place the stuffed tikkis. Shallow fry, turning sides, till both the sides are evenly browned. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot with a chutney of your choice']

title: Wholemeal Fresh Dough Thin Crust Pizza
method: ['Take whole meal flour in a bowl. Enrich it with wheat bran and soya flour. Dissolve sugar and salt in a little water. Dissolve separately yeast in a little warm water.', 'Add the two solutions to the flour mixture and mix. Add one tablespoon of olive oil and mix. Add sufficient water to make a soft dough.', 'Dab a little oil over the dough, cover with a wet muslin cloth and keep aside in a warm place for about forty-five minutes to ferment.', 'Apply a little more oil and knead the dough to remove excess air and keep covered once again for half an hour.', 'Preheat oven to 200degC.', 'To make the pizza sauce, heat olive oil in a pan. Add chopped onion, chopped garlic, tomato concasse and saute. Add tomato puree, salt and freshly ground pepper and stir. Add fresh basil torn with hands. Add fresh oregano and simmer for five minutes. Add', 'Dust the tabletop with a little flour. Roll out a portion of dough on the tabletop to form a thin roundel of approximately eight inch diameter.', 'Grease a baking tray and place the pizza base on it. Prick with fork. Spread a portion of the pizza sauce over it. Place onion roundels, corn niblets, sun-dried tomatoes, paneer cubes, grated mozzarella cheese. Add the toppings on cheese again.', 'Top with three coloured peppers, olives and some more mozzarella cheese.', 'Bake in the preheated oven at 200degC for fifteen to twenty minutes or till done.', 'Cut into slices and serve hot.']

title: Chicken Cau Cau
method: ['Heat sufficient water in a non-stick pan. Add chicken, two tablespoons chopped mint and salt, mix, cover and simmer for ten minutes. Strain and reserve the stock.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add the onion and garlic, mix and saute till onion turns light brown.', 'Add cumin seeds and turmeric powder, mix well and saute. Add jalapeno paste, mix and saute for two to three minutes.', 'Add four cups of the reserved stock, potatoes and remaining chopped mint, stir to mix and simmer for fifteen minutes or till the potatoes are soft.', 'Add salt and cooked chicken, mix well and cook for two to three minutes.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Date Chocolate
method: ['Heat a non-stick pan and add the almonds, cashewnuts and pistachios and lightly toast them. Set aside to cool.', 'Heat another non-stick pan and add desiccated coconut and sugar and roast lightly.', 'Coarsely powder the toasted nuts. Reserve some ground nuts for decoration.', 'Sprinkle a little water on desiccated coconut mixture and saute till the mixture turns light brown.', 'Divide the ground dates into sixteen equal portions. Flatten them and stuff some portions with ground nuts and some portions with desiccated coconut mixture. Shape some into balls and others into bars.', 'Melt dark chocolate and white chocolate separately.', 'Coat the date balls and bars with dark chocolate. Then coat them with white chocolate and nuts and place them on a tray lined with silicon sheet. Refrigerate for ten to fifteen minutes.', 'Arrange on a serving plate and serve.']

title: Rice Gnocchi Aglio Olio
method: ['To make the gnocchi, Heat 1 cup water, salt, oil and turmeric powder in a deep pan. Let the mixture come to boil. Gradually add the rice flour and mix with a wooden ladle till it starts forming a dough.', 'Transfer the dough onto the worktop, and knead the dough with a small greased stainless steel bowl. Once the dough is warm, knead with your hand till a soft dough is formed. Cover with a damp muslin cloth and let it rest for 15-20 minutes.', 'To make gnocchi, grease your hands with a mixture of oil and water and divide the dough into small portions, around 5 grams each. Press each portion on the back of a fork and roll it. This is a gnocchi.', 'Heat sufficient water in a steamer, arrange the gnocchi on the steamer basket, cover and steam for 8-10 minutes. Transfer them into a bowl and drizzle some oil over them.', 'To make the sauce, heat olive oil in a non-stick pan. Add garlic and red chilli flakes, mix and saute for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add chopped herbs and parsley, mix saute for a few seconds. Add the gnocchi and toss them well.', 'Add salt and crushed black peppercorns and toss again. Continue to cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add butter and parmesan cheese powder and mix gently till well combined.', 'Transfer onto a serving plate, garnish with parsley sprig and parmesan cheese shavings. Serve hot.']

title: Ice Cream Cake
method: ['Preheat oven to 180@ C. Grease a loaf tin and set aside.', 'Take castor sugar in a bowl, add eggs and beat with a hand blender till light and fluffy. Add melted ice cream and beat till well incorporated.', 'Sift together flour and baking powder into the mixture. Add chocolate chips and fold in till well mixed.', 'Pour the mixture into the prepared loaf tin and tap it gently. Sprinkle some chocolate chips on top. Keep the tin in the preheated oven and bake for 40-45 minutes. Remove from oven and let it cool down to room temperature.', 'De-mould and keep the cake on a serving plate and drizzle chocolate sauce on top. Slice and serve.']

title: Chicken Mayo Roll
method: ['Take the grilled chicken in a bowl, add mayonnaise, chilli flakes, mustard powder, crushed black peppercorns, castor sugar and salt and mix well.', 'Sit the hot dog buns on the top side without cutting through. Insert 1 lettuce leaf in the slit of each bun and fill it with chicken mixture.', 'Place them on a serving platter, garnish with spring onion greens and serve immediately with lettuce leaves and cherry tomatoes.']

title: Herb Bhujiya - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Take potatoes in a parat, add red chilli powder, garam masala powder, dried mint leaves, asafoetida, salt and gram flour, mix well and knead into soft dough.', 'Grease a sev press with a little oil and fill the dough into it.', 'Press out bhujiya directly into the hot oil and deep-fry till golden and crisp. Drain on an absorbent paper. Make more bhujiya with the remaining dough.', 'Keep the bhujiya in a plate and sprinkle dried mixed herbs. Crush the bhujia Store in an air tight container when it has cooled down to room temperature or serve.']

title: Paneer Cutlets
method: ['Mix together cottage cheese, potato, soya granules, processed cheese, ginger-garlic paste, green chillies, chilli powder, garam masala powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, salt and coriander leaves in a bowl.', 'Divide the cottage cheese mixture into equal portions, shape into balls and lightly flatten between your palms.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Mix together semolina and panko breadcrumbs on a plate.', 'Dip each cutlet in slurry and coat with semolina-breadcrumb mixture.', 'Put the cutlets in hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot with tomato ketchup.']

title: Ratlami Sev - SK Khazana
method: ['Take gram flour in a bowl, add, clove powder, garam masala powder, carom seeds, salt and hot oil. Add sufficient water and knead to a soft dough. Add 2 tbsps oil and knead again.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Grease a chakli press fitted with sev stencil with oil, put a portion of the dough in it. Screw on the lid and press the sev directly into hot oil and deep-fry till light golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper and set aside to cool. Make more sev with the remaining dough.', 'Transfer onto serving plate, crush and serve.']

title: Watermelon and Fresh Mozarella Salad
method: ['Heat balsamic vinegar in a non-stick pan. Add castor sugar, swirl and cook till the mixture reduces slightly.', 'Place one cheese ball on each basil leaf and insert in a plastic skewer along with a watermelon cube.', 'Place some mixed micro greens on a serving platter and place skewered cheese balls-watermelon on one side.', 'Drizzle some balsamic reduction over the skewers and micro greens and serve immediately.']

title: Pastama
method: ['Heat olive oil in a non stick pan. Add mustard seeds, green chillies, black gram, Bengal gram, curry leaves, peanuts, button chillies and saute till fragrant. Add onions and saute well.', 'Add boiled pasta, turmeric powder and red chilli powder and toss well. Add veg Bolognese sauce and salt and mix well. Transfer into a serving bowl. Sprinkle black olives on top and serve hot.']

title: Coorg Style Dry Chicken
method: ['Put chicken pieces in a bowl, add salt and turmeric powder and mix.', 'Dry roast green cardamoms, cinnamon, cloves, black peppercorns, mustard seeds and dried red chillies in a small non-stick pan till fragrant. Let them cool down.', 'Heat oil in another non-stick pan, add onions and saute till golden.', 'Transfer the roasted spices into a mixer jar grind them to a powder.', 'Add chicken to the onions, mix and saute for 2-3 minutes on high heat.', 'Add tomatoes, mix and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add  1/2  cup water and ground spices and mix well.', 'Adjust salt and  1/4  cup water, mix, cover, reduce heat and cook till chicken is almost done.', 'Add kodumpulli water and mix. Cover and cook on low heat till chicken is fully cooked.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.']

title: Green Banana Tuk
method: ['Heat sufficient oil in a pan. Cut the bananas into big pieces and peel them. Press them lightly and slide them into hot oil and deep fry till light golden.', 'Mix together salt, dried mango powder, roasted cumin powder, roasted coriander powder and red chilli powder.', 'Drain the banana pieces on absorbent paper and let them cool slightly. Crush each piece slightly and refry again till golden and crisp.', 'Drain absorbent paper. Sprinkle the masala mixture and toss well so that each piece is well coated with the masala. Serve hot.']

title: Gilafi Kabab
method: ['Combine mutton mince, tomato, onion, capsicum, ginger-garlic paste, chopped coriander, green chillies, cashewnut paste, lemon juice, garam masala powder, salt, 1 teaspoon oil and torn bread slices in a bowl and mix well.', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into kababs.', 'Heat some oil in a non-stick pan. Place the kababs on it and shallow-fry till evenly done and golden from both the sides. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot garnished with coriander sprigs and lemon wedge.']

title: Dosa - SK Khazana
method: ['Wash and soak split black gram with fenugreek seeds in sufficient water for 4 hours.', 'Drain and grind parboiled rice and kolum rice with sufficient water into semi-thick and smooth batter. Transfer into a large mixing bowl.', 'Drain and grind split black gram-fenugreek seed mixture with sufficient water into semi-thick and smooth batter. Transfer into the same bowl and mix well. Cover with cling film and set aside to ferment for 8-9 hours.', 'Add salt to fermented batter and mix well.', 'To prepare coconut chutney, put coconut in a blender jar. Chop green chillies and add to blender jar. Roughly chop coriander sprigs and add to the blender jar along with salt and 3-4 tablespoons water and grind into coarse paste. Transfer it into a small bowl.', 'Heat oil in a tempering pan. Add mustard seeds and let it splutter. Add split black gram, asafoetida, broken dried red chillies and curry leaves and let the curry leaves crackle. Add the tempering to coconut chutney and mix well.', 'To prepare each dosa., heat a non-stick tawa. Remove from heat, put some oil and rub using an damp absorbent paper. Pour a ladleful of batter, place the tawa back on heat and spread the batter to make a thin large disc. Increase heat, drizzle some oil on the sides and cook till golden brown from underside. Fold and transfer onto a serving plate.', 'Serve hot with coconut chutney.']

title: Mutton Seekh Kabab - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat a piece of coal on direct flame.', 'Put mutton mince in a food processor. Add ginger, onion, garlic, green chillies, coriander leaves, garam masala powder, chilli powder, coriander powder, crushed peppercorns and salt, cover and grind well.', 'Add egg , cover and grind again. Transfer into a bowl.', 'Add gram flour and mix well. Make a well in the center, place a small steel bowl and put the hot coal in it. Put butter on top of hot coal, cover and set aside for 10 minutes.', 'Remove the steel bowl and mix the smoked mutton mixture well.', 'Heat some oil in a non-stick grill pan.', 'Dampen your hand and divide the smoked mutton mixture into equal portions. Insert 2 satay sticks into each portion and spread the mixture along the length of the satay sticks leaving a a little bit on either sides empty.', 'Place the kababs in hot oil and grill on medium heat for about 15 minutes, rotating the sticks so that the kababs get evenly golden and cooked all around. . Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving platter, garnish with onion rings and mint leaves and serve hot with green chutney.']

title: Dal Pakwan - SK Khazana
method: ['To prepare dal, heat a pressure cooker. Add split Bengal gram, salt,  1/2  teaspoon chilli powder, turmeric powder,  1/2  teaspoon garam masala powder and 4-5 cups water, mix, cover and cook under pressure cook till 3 whistles are given out.', 'To prepare pakwan, mix together refined flour, salt, crushed peppercorns, wheat flour, semolina, oil and cumin seeds in a bowl. Add sufficient water and knead into semi-stiff dough. Cover with cling film and set aside.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions and shape into balls. Lightly flatten each ball between your palms, dip each portion in hot oil and roll out into thin discs.', 'Prick each disc using a fork, put in hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Open the lid of the pressure cooker when the pressure has reduced completely. Place the pressure cooker back on heat and cook till the mixture thickens slightly.', 'Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan. Add cumin seeds and when it changes colour, add curry leaves and saute.', 'Add green chillies and saute. Add asafoetida, remaining chilli powder and remaining garam masala powder and saute for 30 seconds. Add cooked split Bengal gram mixture, and mix well.', 'Adjust salt and add dried mango powder, switch off heat and mix well.', 'Put the fried pakwan on a serving plate and place on one side of a serving platter. Pour the dal in a patal and place on other side of the platter and place lemon wedge on the side.', 'Garnish the dal with some onion and a coriander sprig.']

title: Banana, Walnut and Chocolate Chip Loaf
method: ['Preheat oven to 180deg C', 'Break eggs into a large mixing bowl, add brown sugar and beat with a hand blender till fluffy.', 'Sift refined flour and baking powder into another bowl.', 'Take butter in a third bowl and melt it in the microwave. Add melted butter to the flour mixture and mix well. Add banana puree and mix well. Add vanilla essence and mix.', 'Add egg mixture and mix. Add walnuts and mix. Add half the chocolate chips and mix.', 'Pour the batter into a silicon mould, sprinkle the remaining chocolate chips on top and mix lightly with a spoon.', 'Keep the mould in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Remove from the mould, slice and serve hot.']

title: Moong Mooshur Daal
method: ['Heat oil in a pressure cooker, add cumin seeds, reduce heat and saute till they change colour. Add garlic, mix and saute for a minute. Add onions, mix and saute on medium heat till they turn golden brown.', 'Chop the tomato and add, mix and continue to saute on medium heat for 2-3 minutes or till soft and pulpy. Add turmeric powder, salt, sugar and broken green chillies, mix and saute for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add split green gram and split red lentils, mix and saute on high heat for 2-3 minutes. Add sufficient water and mix well. Cover and cook under pressure on medium heat till 3 whistles are given out or till the both the grams are completely cooked.', 'Open the cooker once the pressure has reduced completely, transfer cooked dal in into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.']

title: Khajuri Khasta
method: ['Take refined flour in the container of the dough maker. Add salt, sugar, soda bicarbonate, baking powder and butter and start the machine. Add yogurt, egg, milk and continue to process the dough.', 'Mix dates and cottage cheese in a bowl. Add green chillies, chaat masala and coriander leaves and mix well. Add oil to the dough and process till the dough is ready.', 'Take a portion of the dough, spread it on work top with finger tips.', 'Place some stuffing in the centre and shape into a ball. Take onion seeds in a plate and press the stuffed dough balls on it on one side only. Using your fingers pat each ball into a thin chapati.', 'Heat a tawa, place the chapati over it and roast. Apply a little butter and roast on both sides till lightly browned.', 'You can also cook it in a preheated oven at 250degC.', 'Place the chapattis on a greased tray and cook in the oven till lightly browned.']

title: Black Grape Pani Puri
method: ['Grind mint leaves, coriander leaves and green chillies into a fine paste.', 'Mix together fresh black grape juice, the ground paste, tamarind pulp, salt, black salt, roasted cumin powder, red chilli powder and lemon juice.', 'Chill in the refrigerator till use. If you want to, you may fill each puri with a little sprouted green gram, then fill it up with the grape juice mixture and relish this unusual pani puri.']

title: Sandesh-SK Khazana
method: ['Bring the milk to a boil in a deep, thick-bottomed non-stick pan. Add lemon juice and stir till the milk curdles and becomes chenna.', 'Place a strainer lined with muslin cloth over a bowl and pour the chenna into it and drain excess liquid.', 'Put some ice cubes in a large bowl, add sufficient water and dip the muslin cloth with the chenna in it to cool it down completely.', 'Further squeeze the muslin cloth potli till all the water is drained out.', 'Put the chenna in a parat, add castor sugar and cardamom powder and knead with the heel of your hand.', 'Transfer the mixture into a non-stick pan and cook on medium heat for 6-8 minutes. Remove from heat and transfer the mixture into a bowl and let it cool.', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions, shape into balls and flatten slightly.', 'Top with some pistachios and serve.']

title: Tender Coconut Kulfi
method: ['Heat milk in a non-stick pan. When it comes to a boil, reduce heat and simmer till it reduces to  1/3  its original quantity (approximately 330 ml).', 'Add sugar and coconut powder and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add pistachios. Finely chop coconut flesh and add to the milk and mix well. Cook for 1-2 minutes.', 'Pour the mixture into kulfi moulds and place in the freezer to set overnight.', 'Remove from moulds and serve.']

title: Squids in Brown Masala
method: ['Place squids in a bowl, add salt and turmeric powder, mix well and set aside.', 'Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a non-stick pan. Add peppercorns, cloves, cinnamon, star anise and fennel seeds and saute till fragrant.', 'Add half the onions and saute till light brown. Add fresh coconut, mix and saute till it turns light brown.', 'Add dried coconut, mix and saute till it turns light brown.', 'Switch off heat, cool the mixture down to room temperature and grind with tamarind pulp and a little water into a fine paste.', 'Heat 1 tablespoon oil in another non-stick pan. Add remaining onions and saute till translucent.', 'Add marinated squids, mix and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add coriander powder, cumin powder and red chilli powder and mix well. Add  1/2  cup water, mix, cover and cook for 5-6 minutes.', 'Add ground paste, mix well, cover and cook for 5-10 minutes.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Tendli Pickle - SK Khazana
method: ['Dry roast salt in a non-stick pan till the moisture gets evaporated. Transfer into a bowl and let it cool down to room temperature.', 'Heat mustard oil in the same pan till it starts smoking. Take it off the heat and let it cool down to room temperature.', 'Meanwhile, trim both the edges of the ivy gourds and chop into small pieces. Transfer them into a large bowl.', 'Spread rai kuria in a circle on a plate. Spread methi kuria over it. Spread asafoetida in the center and pour 1 tbsp mustard oil on it. Spread roasted salt in a circle over the methi kuria and sprinkle Turmeric Powder and mix well. Add Kashimiri red chilli powder and spicy red chilli powder and mix well.', 'Add 3 tbsps mustard oil and mix well. Store in air tight container to use when required.', 'Add 5 tbsps of the masala to the tendli. Add a little salt and 1 tbsp spicy red chilli powder and remaining mustard oil and mix well.', 'Transfer into an airtight container and can be used upto 2-3 days but keep it in the refrigerator.']

title: Lemon Steamed Fish
method: ['Heat sufficient water in a wide non-stick pan.', 'Diagonally slice spring onions and put into a bowl. Slice 2 green chillies and 1 fresh red chilli diagonally and put into the bowl. Add ginger slices. And 2 tsps lemon juice.', 'Slice lemon into thin roundels.', 'Separate leaves of halved cabbage, add to the hot water and cover for 2 minutes to soften them.', 'Cut fish fillets into large chunks and add to the bowl. Add salt and mix gently. Set aside to marinate for about 15-20 minutes.', 'Line a bamboo steamer with softened cabbage leaves and place it in the pan with hot water. Place the fish chunks over them and top with the remaining marinade. Sprinkle some green capsicum strips and place the lemon roundels all around. Cover the bamboo steamer and also cover the pan and cook till fish is just done.', 'Serve it in the bamboo steamer itself. Or carefully lift the fish along with the cabbage leaves and place it on a serving dish and serve hot.']

title: Chilli Garlic Shrimps
method: ['Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Take shrimps in a bowl. Add salt,  1/2  tablespoon chilli flakes, chopped garlic and cornstarch and mix well.', 'Deep-fry the shrimps till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Slice the garlic cloves and spring onion bulbs thinly.', 'Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a non-stick pan. Add sliced garlic, mix and saute till golden. Add sliced spring onion bulbs, mix and saute for a minute.', 'Add sweet chilli sauce and remaining chilli flakes and mix well.Add fried shrimps and toss to mix.Add peanuts and mix well.', 'Cut spring onion greens, add to the pan and toss to mix. Switch off heat, add lemon juice and mix well.', 'Spread iceberg lettuce leaves on a serving plate and put the prepared shrimps on them.', 'Serve hot garnished with yellow and red bell pepper curls and coriander sprigs.']

title: Brown Rice Khichdi
ingredients: ['1 1/4  cups quick cooking brown Basmati rice', ' 1/2  cup soaked split skinless green gram (dhuli moong dal)', 'Salt to taste', ' 1/2  teaspoon turmeric powder', '2 tablespoons ghee + to drizzle', '1 1/2  teaspoons cumin seeds', '2 tablespoons chopped garlic', ' 1/2  tablespoon chopped ginger', ' 1/4  teaspoon asafoetida (hing)', '2 green chillies, chopped', '2 medium onions, chopped', '2 medium tomatoes, chopped', '1 teaspoon red chilli powder', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves', 'Fresh coriander sprig for garnish', 'Roasted papads for serving', 'Raita for serving']
method: ['Take quick cooking brown Basmati rice in a bowl, add sufficient water and wash for 2-3 times. Add sufficient water and soak for 25-30 minutes. Drain.', 'Transfer soaked rice into a pressure cooker. Drain split green gram and add to the cooker.', 'Add salt, turmeric powder and 4 1/2  cups water and mix well. Cover with the lid and cook on medium heat till 5-6 whistles are released. Open the lid once the pressure settles completely. Mix well.', 'For the tempering, heat ghee in a kadai. Add cumin seeds and once they start to change colour, add garlic, ginger and asafetida, mix and saute for 30 seconds.', 'Add green chillies and mix well. Add onions, mix and saute till onions turn translucent.', 'Add tomatoes and salt and saute on medium heat for 3-4 minutes or till the tomatoes are pulpy.', 'Add red chilli powder and mix. Add rice mixture and mix. Add  3/4  cup water and mix. Cook for 2-3 minutes or till the mixture is heated thoroughly.', 'Add coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl. Drizzle ghee, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot with roasted papads and raita.']
Main ingredients: Quick cooking brown Basmati rice, Slit skinless green gram (dhuli moong dal), Turmeric powder, Ghee, Cumin seeds, Garlic, Ginger, Asafoetida, Green chillies, Onions, Tomatoes, Red chilli powder, Fresh coriander leaves

title: Stuffed Bombil Tikki - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan, add green chillies and onion, mix and saute till translucent. Add tomato, mix and saute for 1 minute. Add salt and mix well and saute till tomato softens.', 'Add red chilli paste, mix and saute for 1 minute. Add raw mango and mix well. Add 1 tbsp coriander leaves and mix well. Cook till mixture is pulpy.', 'Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder and red chilli powder and saute well.', 'Add 2 tbsps water and mix, cook for 1-2 minutes. Add small prawns and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes or till the mixture dries. Take the pan off the heat and cool down to room temperature.', 'Meanwhile, slit all the bombil vertically in half and discard the bone. Cut into small pieces and transfer into a chopper jar. Break and add fresh red chillies, 2 tbsps coriander leaves and process it to a coarse paste. Add potato and salt, and process till well combined. Transfer into a bowl.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Take the beaten eggs in a bowl. Spread semolina in a large plate. Add black sesame seeds, white sesame seeds, coriander leaves and salt and mix well.', 'Grease your palms with oil, take a portion of the fish mixture and spread it out slightly. Place some prawn mixture in the centre, bring the edges together and seal carefully. Further roll into a ball, dip it in the egg and roll in the semolina mixture. Again dip in the egg and roll in the semolina mixture. Flatten the ball lightly and slide into hot oil . and deep-fry till light golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving plate, garnish them with mint leaves and lemon wedges and serve hot with green chutney.']

title: Phoolkopi Motorshuti Diye Bhaja Mungerdaal
method: ['Dry roast moong dal in a non-stick pan on medium heat till golden brown. Take the pan off the heat and transfer the roasted dal into a pressure cooker. Add 3 cups water and mix well. Cover the cooker and cook under pressure till 4-5 whistles are released. Set aside for the pressure to be reduced completely.', 'Heat mustard oil in a non-stick pan till it begins to smoke. Add cauliflower florets, turmeric powder and salt, mix and saute till the florets are golden.', 'Add green peas and cooked dal and mix well. Cook till the mixture comes to a boil. Take the pan off the heat.', 'For the tempering, heat ghee in a small non-stick pan. Add bay leaves, dried red chilli and cumin seeds, mix and saute till the colour of the seeds change.', 'Add asafoetida, cinnamon, cloves, green cardamoms, mix and saute till fragrant.', 'Add green chillies and ginger, mix and saute for 1 minute. Add this to the dal mixture and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, sprinkle Bengali garam masala powder (equal proportions of green cardamoms, cloves and cinnamon roasted together and powdered).', 'Sprinkle scraped fresh coconut, green chilli and chopped coriander on top and serve hot.']

title: Chicken in Foil
method: ['Make slits on the chicken breasts.', 'Put ginger-garlic paste,  1/2  teaspoon red chilli powder and salt in a bowl. Add lemon juice and mix well. Add chicken breasts, apply marinade all over and within the slits and set aside to marinate for 5 minutes.', 'Heat a non-stick pan.', 'Roughly chop dried red chillies.', 'Add coriander seeds, black peppercorns, cloves, cumin seeds, cardamoms and red chillies to the pan and dry roast on low heat till fragrant.', 'Cut capsicum into thin strips. Thinly slice onion. Seed and cut tomato into thin strips.', 'Put roasted spices in a blender jar. Roughly chop ginger and add along with garlic cloves and a little water and blend into a coarse paste.', 'Apply this paste evenly over the marinating chicken breasts. Adjust salt if required and set aside for 10 minutes.', 'Preheat oven at 180degC.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan.', 'Roughly chop coriander sprigs.', 'Add garlic to the oil and saute for 10-15 seconds.', 'Add onion, toss and saute till they turn translucent. Add capsicum and toss. Add tomato, toss and saute.', 'Add salt, remaining red chilli powder, toss to mix and saute for a minute. Switch off heat and add coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Spread an aluminium foil on a worktop. Place marinated chicken breast and top with half the sauteed vegetables. Wrap to seal from all sides. Similarly wrap the other chicken breast.', 'Place wrapped chicken on a baking tray, place tray in preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes or till the chicken is fully cooked.', 'Serve hot garnished with coriander sprigs and lemon slices.']

title: Spring Onion and Pimento Quesadilla
method: ['Deseed peppers, capsicum and tomatoes and cut into thin strips.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add garlic and mix. Add onions, mix and saute till translucent.', 'Add peppers and capsicum strips and toss to mix. Add salt and jalapenos and mix well.', 'Add tomato strips and turn off the heat. Add spring onion greens and chopped coriander and mix well. Transfer the vegetable mixture into a bowl.', 'To prepare peach salsa, grind togetherchopped peaches, onion, tomato, lemon juice, jalapenos and salt to a fine paste.Transfer into a bowl.', 'Cut the whole peach into small pieces.', 'Add chopped peach and chopped coriander to the salsa and mix well. Refrigerate to chill.', 'To make quesadilla, warm tortillas in a non-stick pan. Spread some mozzarella cheese on one side of tortilla. Layer with some prepared vegetable mixture and again add some cheese. Fold and cook till evenly done from both sides, brushing with some oil.', 'Slice the prepared quesadillas and serve hot with peach salsa.']

title: Orange Curd Rice
method: ['Combine yogurt, castor sugar and orange marmalade in a bowl and mix well.', 'Add some orange juice from the orange segments and mix well. Add rice and mix well.', 'Roughly chop orange segments and add. Mix well.', 'Add orange zest and mix well. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.', 'Serve chilled in orange shells garnished with orange marmalade and orange zest.']

title: Multigrain Cookies - SK Khazana
method: ['Sieve finger millet flour into a large bowl. Sieve refined flour and baking powder into the same bowl. Add brown sugar, castor sugar, pumpkin seeds, sunflower seeds, melon seeds, cinnamon powder, nutmeg powder, raisins and oats and mix well. It will keep for upto 21 days stored in an airtight container.', 'Preheat oven to 180o C. Line a baking tray with parchment paper.', 'Take 2 cups of the premix in a mixing bowl, add butter and mix well. Add 2 tbsps water and knead into a dough.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions and shape them into cookies. Place them on the prepared baking tray. Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes.', 'Place them on a serving plate and serve when cooled.']

title: Chilli Chana Aloo
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds, garlic and ginger, mix well and saute for 2 minutes. Add onions, mix and saute till translucent.', 'Cut potatoes into small cubes, add and cook for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add red chilli sauce, soy sauce, vinegar, red chilli powder, Schezwan sauce and brown Bengal gram, mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add spring onion greens and toss.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with spring onion greens, Schezwan sauce and fried noodles and serve hot.']

title: Goan Sorak Curry - SK Khazana
method: ['Finely chop one onion. Roughly chop the remaining onion and transfer them into a blender jar. Add coconut, dried red chillies, coriander seeds, garlic, ginger, cumin seeds, turmeric powder and  1/2  cup water and blend to a fine paste.', 'Heat coconut oil in an earthen pot, add chopped onion and saute till golden brown. Add the coconut paste, mix well and saute till oil separates. Rinse the blender jar with 2 1/2  cups water and add to the pot and mix till well combined. Let the mixture come to a boil.', 'Add kokum petals, green chillies and salt and mix well. Cook for 2 minutes. Take the pot off the heat.', 'Pour some of the mixture over a bowl of steamed rice, garnish with a coriander sprig and serve immediately.']

title: Namkeen Champakali
ingredients: ['2 cups refined flour (maida)', 'Salt to taste', 'A large pinch of castor sugar', '1 teaspoon red chilli powder', '2 tablespoons hot oil', 'Oil for deep fryingSpice mix', ' 3/4  teaspoon red chilli powder', '1 1/2  teaspoons dried mango powder (amchur)', '1 teaspoon dried pomegranate seeds (anardana) powder', ' 1/4  teaspoon roasted cumin powder', 'Salt to taste']
method: ['Take refined flour in a large shallow bowl. Add salt, castor sugar and red chilli powder hot oil and mix till the mixture resembles bread crumb consistency. Add  1/2  cup water little by little and knead into a stiff dough. Cover with a damp muslin cloth and set aside for 10-15 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, mix together red chilli powder dried mango powder, dried pomegranate seeds powder, roasted cumin powder and salt in a bowl.', 'Heat sufficient oil on low heat in a kadai.', 'Take a portion of the dough, roll it out into a thin roundel. Cut into small squares with the help of small cookie cutters. Make lengthwise cuts at equal distance in the middle of each square, leaving the edges intact. Apply some water on the edges. Gently pleat the cuts one over the other from one end to the other. Bring them together and press two ends to secure. Lightly twist once.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai, gently slide in a few champakalis at a time, deep-fry on medium heat till golden. Drain on absorbent paper and immediately sprinkle some of the spice mix. Set aside to cool down.', 'Serve or store in an airtight container.']

title: Vegan Methi Matar Malai
method: ['Preheat the oven at 180@C.', 'Spread the cashew nuts on a baking tray and roast for 5-7 minutes or till lightly golden brown.', 'Finely chop onions, ginger, garlic and green chilli and set aside. Wash fresh fenugreek leaves thoroughly and finely chop them and set aside.', 'Transfer the roasted cashew nuts in a blender jar and blend till smooth.', 'Heat a pan, add chopped onion, ginger, garlic and green chilli. Add rock salt and mix well. Add  1/4  cup water and mix and cook till the onion turns golden brown.', 'Add chopped fresh fenugreek leaves and mix well. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Pour cashew cream and mix well. Add  1/2  cup water and mix, cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add cinnamon powder, green cardamom powder and mix. Add green peas and mix well.', 'Add 2 tbsps of the prepared cashew butter and mix and add  1/4  cup water. Mix till well combined. Adjust rock salt, mix and cook for 1 minute. Take the pan off the heat.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.']

title: Schezwan Chicken - SK Khazana
method: ['For schezwan sauce, heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add garlic, ginger and celery, mix and saute till lightly browned.', 'Add red chilli paste, mix and cook till the oil separates and mixture thickens.', 'Add salt and sugar and mix well. Add vinegar and black pepper powder and mix well. Add tomato ketchup, mix well and take the pan off the heat.', 'Heat oil in another non-stick wok, add spring onions and saute for 1 minute on high heat.', 'Add chicken cubes and mix. Add a little salt and add 2 tbsps of the prepared schezwan sauce and mix well. Add soy sauce and mix well.', 'Add chicken stock and mix well. Cook till chicken is completely cooked.', 'Add cornflour mixed in 1 tbsp water and mix well and cook till the mixture thickens slightly.', 'Add spring onion greens and mix well. Transfer into a serving dish and serve hot.']

title: Cheese Paneer Fruit Salad
