method: ['Heat oil in a deep pan, add onions and saute till golden brown. Add garlic paste andginger paste, mix well and saute for 1 minute.', 'Add turmeric powder and mix. Add mutton and mix. Add salt, mix well and sauteon high heat for 4-5 minutes. Add 3 cups water and mix well.When the mixture comes to a boil, cover and cook till the mutton is cooked completely.', 'Add prunes and mix. Add 1 1/2  cups water, mix well and let the mixture to come to a boil. Add black pepper powder, mix, cover and cook for 10-15 minutes. Take it off the heat.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with ginger strips, coriander sprig and lemon wedge and serve hot.']

title: Sweetcorn Crabmeat Soup
method: ['Boil chicken stock in a non stick pan. Mix cornstarch with  1/4  cup water till smooth. Mix salt, pepper powder,  1/2  tbsp sugar and little water in another bowl.', 'Add cream style corn to the boiling stock and mix well.Add sugar-pepper mixture and cornstarch mixture.', 'Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Adjust salt and add remaining sugar. Mix well and cook till comes to a boil.Beat egg whites and add. Mix well.', 'Add crabmeat and mix again. Cook for 1 minute.', 'Serve piping hot garnished with chopped spring onion greens.']

title: Papad ki Sabzi
method: ['Heat oil in a deep non-stick pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds and asafoetida and let the seeds splutter.', 'Add onions and saute till they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add tomato puree and mix well. Cover and cook on medium heat for 4-5 minutes or till oil separates.', 'Add yogurt and mix well. Cook on medium heat for 2-3 minutes. Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder and coriander powder and mix well. Saute for 2-3 minutes on medium heat.', 'Add salt and jaggery and garam masala powder, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes on medium heat.', 'Crush and add papads and coriander leaves and mix well. Add 2-3 tablespoons water and mix well. Add dried fenugreek leaves and mix well. Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes on medium heat.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.']

title: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
method: ['Put dark brown sugar in a planetary mixer bowl, add castor sugar and coconut oil and process with the whisk attachment till well combined.', 'Add the soy milk, gradually and keep processing. Add vanilla essence and process till sugar dissolves.', 'Dislodge the whisk attachment, and keep a sieve over the bowl. Put flour, salt and baking soda into the sieve and sift the mixture into the mixer bowl. Attach the hook attachment and process till the dough comes together. Be careful not to over mix.', 'Add chocolate chunks and process to make a dough. Refrigerate the dough for 30 minutes.', 'Preheat the oven to 180@C. Line a baking tray with a silicon mat.', 'With an ice cream scoop take the dough and place the scoops on the prepared tray keeping at least 2 inches distance between each.', 'Keep the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 12-15 minutes.', 'Bring the tray out of the oven and let the cookies cool down to room temperature.', 'Arrange them on a serving plate and serve.']

title: Full Tandoori Chicken - SK Khazana
method: ['Make incisions on whole chicken and put in a bowl. Add 2 teaspoons chilli powder, salt and 1 1/2  tablespoons lemon juice and apply well all over inside out. Set aside.', 'Mix together hung yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chilli paste, dried fenugreek leaves powder, garam masala powder, remaining chilli powder, salt, remaining lemon juice and mustard oil in another bowl.', 'Add chicken and apply well all over inside out. Set aside to marinate for 1-2 hours.', 'Preheat oven to 200o C.', 'Place the chicken on a baking tray, put tray in preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes.', 'Brush some butter on chicken, sprinkle chaat masala on top and serve hot with green chutney and salad.']

title: Garlic Mushrooms
method: ['Preheat oven to 180deg C.', 'Remove the stems of the mushrooms and put them into a bowl.', 'Heat extra virgin olive oil in a non-stick pan, add garlic and saute till raw smells disappear.', 'Add mushrooms, salt and crushed black peppercorns and mix well.', 'Add white wine, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add pinenuts, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Transfer into 4 individual shallow baking dishes evenly, drizzle 1 teaspoon extra virgin olive oil on each dish, keep them in the preheated oven and cook for 15-20 minutes.', 'Bring them out of the oven and serve immediately.']

title: Baked Vada Pav
method: ['Put yeast and castor sugar in a bowl and mix. Add two tablespoons of warm water, mix well and set aside to activate.', 'Heat half tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.', 'Add green chillies, curry leaves, turmeric powder, coriander powder and two tablespoons water and mix well. Add potatoes and toss well.', 'Add coriander leaves, salt and lemon juice and mix well. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.', 'Place flour on the worktop and make a well in the center. Add milk powder, salt and activated yeast mixture in the well, mix and knead into a soft dough using water as required.', 'Add two and a half tablespoons butter and knead again. Cover with a damp muslin cloth and set aside to ferment for twenty to twenty-five minutes.', 'Preheat oven to 180deg C. Grease a cake tin with some oil.', 'Dust the worktop with some flour, place the dough on it and roll. Divide the dough into eight equal portions shaped into balls. Make a cavity in the centre ensuring that the edges are thin, while the center is thick. Stuff cooked potato mixture in the center and top it up with vada pav chutney. Shape into smooth balls.', 'Place the stuffed vada pavs in the greased tin, cover with a damp muslin cloth and set aside to prove for fifteen minutes.', 'Brush the proved vada pavs with some milk. Place the tin in the preheated oven and bake for fifteen to twenty minutes.', 'Remove from oven, brush with the melted butter, remove from the tin and serve hot.']

title: Chennar Payesh
method: ['Boil milk in a deep non-stick pan, reduce heat and let it simmer till it is reduced to half the original quantity.', 'Add the sugar and cook till it dissolves.', 'Mash the chenna in a bowl. Add it to the milk and simmer for 2 minutes.', 'Garnish with almonds and pistachios and serve chilled.']

title: Kadai Chicken - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat oil in a kadai, add cumin seeds and let the seeds change colour. Add chopped onion, mix and saute till golden brown in colour.', 'Add ginger-garlic paste, mix well and saute till raw smells disappear. Add chopped tomato and mix well. Add tomato puree, mix well and saute till the mixture is pulpy.', 'Add red chilli powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, salt and  1/2  cup water, mix well and saute for 3-4 minutes.', 'Add chicken cubes and kadai masala powder and mix well. Add  1/4  cup water and mix well. Add cashew nut paste, mix well and cook for 8-10 minutes.', 'Add dried fenugreek leaves powder, diced onion, diced tomato and diced capsicum tomato, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes.', 'Squeeze the juice of  1/2  lemon and add coriander leaves, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.']

title: Squid Fry
ingredients: ['8-10 squids, cleaned and washed', 'Salt to taste', ' 3/4  teaspoon turmeric powder', '2 lemons', '2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste', '4-5 kokum petals', '1 tablespoon red chilli powder', ' 1/2  cup rice flour', 'Oil to deep fry', 'Green chutney to serve']
method: ['Slice squids into rings and transfer into a large bowl. Sprinkle salt, and turmeric powder.', 'Halve the lemons, remove seeds and squeeze their juice directly into the bowl and mix well.', 'Add ginger-garlic paste and kokum petals and mix well.', 'Add red chilli powder and mix well. Add rice flour and mix till all the squid rings are well coated.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai, drop in the squid rings, one at a time, and deep fry till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Transfer onto a serving plate and serve hot with green chutney.']

title: Sabz Biryani
method: ['Chop one onion and slice the remaining two. Soak saffron in warm milk. Place the rice in a microwave casserole with five cups of water and salt to taste. Cook, covered, on Microwave HIGH (100%) for ten minutes. Drain and set aside.', 'In a separate microwave bowl place sliced onions with two tablespoons of oil. Cook, uncovered, on Microwave HIGH (100%) for four minutes. Drain the onion on an absorbent paper. Place three tablespoons of ghee with chopped onion, ginger, cumin seeds, green chillies, black cardamoms, green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon and bay leaf in a large microwave casserole.', 'Cook, uncovered, on Microwave HIGH (100%) for three minutes. Mix in peas, carrot, cauliflower, French beans, tomato, coriander leaves, yogurt, red chilli powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, salt and one and a half cups of water. Cook, covered, on Microwave HIGH (100%) for twelve minutes.', 'In another large microwave casserole, place half the vegetables and cover them with half the rice. Repeat the layers once. Cook, covered, on Microwave HIGH (100%) for twenty minutes.', 'Sprinkle saffron, cooked sliced onions, mint leaves and kewra water on rice and cook, covered, on Microwave HIGH (100%) for ten minutes. Serve hot.']

title: Brioche
method: ['Take yeast in a bowl. Add a pinch of castor sugar and 2 tablespoons warm water, mix and set aside to activate.', 'Take flour in an electric kneading machine. Add 2 tablespoons castor sugar, butter and activated yeast and knead. Break in eggs and knead into a soft dough.', 'Transfer dough onto worktop and knead well. Dust a bowl with some flour, transfer the dough, cover with cling film and set aside to prove for 15-20 minutes.', 'Dust the worktop with some more flour, transfer the dough and knock back to release excess air.', 'Divide the dough into 4 equal portions and shape them into balls. Brush some egg yolk, coat with some white sesame seeds on top and transfer into a loaf tin. Cover with damp muslin cloth and set aside to prove for 15-20 minutes.', 'Preheat oven to 180deg C.', 'Put the tin into the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven, cool and demould.', 'Serve.']

title: Mild Chicken 65
method: ['Take chicken pieces in a bowl. Add ginger-garlic paste, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, chilli powder, cornflour, refined flour, salt and lemon juice and mix well.', 'Add coriander leaves and mix well. Add yogurt, mix well and set aside to marinate for 15-20 minutes.', 'To make the tempering, heat ghee in a non-stick pan. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add cumin seeds, mix and saute for 10 seconds. Add curry leaves, mix and remove from heat. Set aside.', 'Heat a griller.', 'Skewer the marinated chicken pieces onto satay sticks, place them on the griller and grill, rotating the sticks and basting with the tempering, till golden all around and fully cooked.', 'Serve hot garnished with coconut.']

title: Dal Pakhtooni
method: ['Heat a pressure cooker. Drain and add the sabut urad. Add 4 cups water and salt.', 'Grind garlic, ginger and red chillies with a little water to a fine paste and add it to the cooker.', 'Cover the cooker with the lid and cook under pressure till 4-5 whistles are given out.', 'Grind onions.Heat oil and butter in a deep non stick pan.', 'Add onion paste and saute, stirring, till fragrant and golden.', 'Add coriander powder and cumin powder and saute for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add tomato puree and saute till raw smells disappear and fat surfaces.', 'Open the pressure cooker when the pressure reduces completely and add the sauteed masala and mix well.', 'Add garam masala powder and adjust salt. Mix well and simmer for 15-20 minutes.', 'Add red chilli powder and most of the cream and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot decorated with a swirl of cream. It goes well with roti or rice.']

title: Blueberry Triffle with Mascarpone Cream
method: ['Take Mascarpone cheese in a bowl and beat with an electric beater till creamy.', 'Add whipped cream and beat again. Strain the mixture if the cheese leaves water while beating. Transfer cheese-cream mixture in another bowl and set aside.', 'Scrape the top most uneven part of sponge cake and set aside. Slice the sponge cake horizontally into 3 parts.', 'Place 3 parts one on top of the other, place a small glass dish on it and mark. Trim off the extra edges so that the 3 parts fit into the glass dish. Keep the trimmings aside.', 'Crumble trimmings and add to cheese-cream mixture. Mix well.', 'Place the base part of the cake in the glass dish and press lightly. Spread a portion of cheese-cream mixture on it evenly. Spread a portion of blueberry jam on top evenly. Place the second cake part on top and press lightly. Repeat the layers of cheese-cream mixture and jam on top. Place the third cake part on top and press lightly. Spread a layer of remaining cheese-cream mixture on top and even it out with a palate knife. Spread remaining jam on top and refrigerate for 1 hour.', 'Garnish with a fresh mint sprig and serve chilled.']

title: CrEMe Brulee
method: ['Heat cream in a pan till it reaches the boiling point. Set aside to cool.', 'Place egg yolks and whole egg in a bowl, add sugar and mix. Cook over a double boiler till the sugar gets dissolved, taking care that the eggs do not get scrambled.', 'Add egg mixture to the cream and mix well. Preheat oven to 180degC. Add vanilla essence to the cream mixture. Mix well.', 'Strain the entire mixture into another bowl. Pour the cream mixture into six ramekin moulds. Take a tray, pour some water in it.', 'Place the moulds in this water bath and place the tray in the preheated oven. Bake at 180degC for twenty to twenty-five minutes.', 'Remove from oven. Take the moulds out of the water bath and let them cool down to room temperature.', 'Chill in the refrigerator. Just before serving sprinkle a tablespoon of brown (demerara) sugar over the set custard in each of the moulds and brulee it with a torch. Serve immediately.']

title: Santra Basundi
method: ['Heat milk in a non-stick pan and bring to boil. Reduce heat and stir continuously till reduced. Remove from heat, cool and transfer into a bowl.', 'Add condensed milk and mix. Add cardamom powder and orange juice and mix well.', 'Add orange segments reserving some for garnishing and mix well. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.', 'Put few reserved orange segments in the bottom of a serving glass, put some basundi and serve.']

title: Garlic Bread Sticks
method: ['Take yeast in a bowl. Add castor sugar and 2-3 tablespoons warm water, mix and set aside for 5 minutes to activate.', 'Sift flour into another bowl. Make a well in the centre and add activated yeast and mix well. Add some water and knead into dough. Add salt and 1 teaspoon olive oil and knead into a soft dough. Cover with damp muslin cloth and prove for 10-15 minutes.', 'To prepare spice mix, lightly crush together dried basil, dried oregano, dried rosemary, crushed peppercorns, garlic powder, salt and paprika in a mortar using a pastel. Transfer in a bowl.', 'Transfer dough on worktop. Dust some polenta and flour on the worktop, place the dough on it and lightly press to flatten. Divide into 2 portions and shape them into balls.', 'Preheat oven to 180o C. Grease a baking tray with some olive oil.', 'Roll out each portion into a thick disc and place them on the greased baking tray. Brush some milk on the edges of each disc and fold into half. Cover with damp muslin cloth and prove for 10 minutes.', 'Brush some milk on top of proven dough, sprinkle some spice mix and make slits.Place the baking tray in preheated oven and bake for15-20 minutes.', 'Slice and serve hot.']

title: Dal Pakwan
method: ['To make dal, heat 1 tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan. Add Bengal gram, tamarind pulp, garam masala powder, chilli powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder and dried mango powder, mix well and cook for 5-10 minutes. Add salt and mix well.', 'To prepare pakwan, heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions and roll out into thin puris. Prick them lightly and deep-fry in hot oil till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Garnish dal with a coriander sprig, drizzle some ghee on top and serve hot with pakwan.']

title: Noon Chai - Sk Khazana
method: ['Heat 3 cups water in a deep saucepan, add tea leaves, mix well and bring it to a boil.', 'Add cinnamon stick, green cardamoms and star anise, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add salt, baking soda and milk and mix well. .', 'Add sugar and cook till sugar melts. Take the pan off the heat.', 'Strain the tea into cups, garnish with powdered pistachios and dried rose petal and serve hot with cookies.']

title: Mangalorian Fish Curry
method: ['Place fish darnes on a plate. Add salt and turmeric powder and rub in well. Set aside.', 'Heat  1/2  tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan. Add fenugreek seeds and cumin seeds and saute till fragrant.', 'Grind together sauteed spices, coconut,  1/4  of the chopped onion and tamarind pulp with some water to a fine paste.', 'Heat remaining oil in a non-stick pan. Add curry leaves and garlic and saute till garlic turns golden. Add remaining onion and tomato, mix and cook on high heat for 2 minutes.', 'Add coriander powder, chilli powder and pepper powder and mix well. Reduce heat, add ground paste, mix well and cook for 2 minutes.', 'Add some water, mix and bring to boil. Add fish, mix and cook on low heat for 4-5 minutes.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Eggless Pineapple Mousse
method: ['Chop pineapple slices roughly. Heat  1/2  cup water in a bowl in a microwave oven.', 'Add carrageenan and stir till well blended.', 'Place condensed milk in a deep glass bowl, add pineapple (keeping aside a few pieces for garnish) and whipped cream and mix well.', 'Add pineapple essence, yellow colour and mix well.', 'Add dissolved carrageenan and mix.', 'Pour the mixture into individual glasses or bowls or ramekin moulds.', 'Keep them in a refrigerator to set for 2-3 hours.', 'Garnish with pineapple pieces and glace cherries and serve chilled.']

title: Singhada Salad
method: ['Slice water chestnuts. Halve cucumber, remove seeds and chop roughly.', 'Roughly chop red chillies, remove seeds and place in a grinder jar with peanuts and crush coarsely.', 'Put chestnuts and cucumber into a bowl, add salt, sugar, 1 1/2  tbsps crushed mixture, lemon juice and coriander leaves and mix well. You can use the remaining crushed mixture in other salads.', 'Finely chop mint leaves and add. Mix well and serve chilled.']

title: Mango and Mint Lemonade
method: ['Put mango, sugar, lemon juice, roasted cumin seeds, black salt, mint leaves and ice cubes in a blender jar and blend till smooth.', 'Take four serving glasses and fill half them with mango mixture. Put a mint sprig into each glass.', 'Fill the glasses with drinking soda and mix lightly.', 'Arrange a lemon wedge on the rims of each glass and serve chilled.']

title: Keema Chana Pulao Taka Tak
method: ['Heat ghee in a deep non-stick pan, add black peppercorns, bay leaves, black cardamoms and cumin seeds and saute till cumin seeds change colour. Add onion and saute till it turns golden brown.', 'Add tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste and green chilli paste and saute for a minute. Add salt and saute till tomatoes turn pulpy. Add red chilli powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, 2 tsps garam masala powder and chickpeas and mix well.', 'Take keema in a bowl, add 1 cup water and mix well. Add this mixture to the pan and cook, stirring occasionally, for 15-20 minutes on medium heat.', 'Add green chillies, ginger and mint leaves and mix well. Add cooked rice and mix. Add remaining garam masala powder and lemon juice. Cover and cook on dum for 10-15 minutes on medium heat.', 'Transfer onto a serving platter and serve hot garnished with mint sprig.']

title: Chikki Chocolate Balls
method: ['Mix together peanuts and jaggery in a non-stick pan and cook, stirring continuously, till the jaggery melts.', 'Transfer the mixture into a bowl, add chocolate powder and cocoa powder and mix well.', 'Add chocolate chips and mix.', 'Make small balls of the mixture and coat them with cocoa powder.', 'Transfer the balls into a serving bowl and serve.']

title: Kesari Phirni
method: ['Bring the milk to a boil in a deep pan.', 'Lower the heat and let it simmer till it reduces a little. Grind the soaked rice to a coarse paste.', 'Add a little milk to it and mix to make it a little thinner.']

title: Hare Pyaaz ki Sabzi
ingredients: ['4-6 spring onion with greens', '2 tablespoons oIl', '1 teaspoon mustard seeds', '1/4 teaspoon asafoetida', 'Salt to taste', '1 teaspoon red chilli powder', '1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder', '1 cup gram flour (Besan)', 'Rotis to serve']
method: ['Chop spring onions and the greens.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add asafoetida and the spring onions, mix and saute for 3-4 minutes.', 'Add salt, red chilli powder and turmeric powder and mix well.', 'Add 1 cup water and mix and let the mixture come to a boil. Add gram flour and mix well. Cover and cook on low heat for 6-8 minutes. Take the pan off the heat.', 'Serve hot with rotis.']

title: Blueberry Crumpet
method: ['Bring milk to a boil and switch off heat. Add  1/4  cup water and set aside.', 'Combine refined flour, salt, baking soda and 6 teaspoons castor sugar in a bowl.', 'Take yeast in another bowl. Add little milk-water mixture and 1 teaspoon castor sugar, mix well and set aside till the yeast activates.', 'Make a well in the flour mixture, add the activated yeast mixture and half the milk-water mixture and whisk well. Add remaining milk-water mixture and whisk well into a thick smooth batter. Cover and set aside in a warm place for 1 hour to ferment.', '5. To make blueberry jam mix, heat  1/4  cup castor sugar in a non-stick pan and let it caramelize. Add dried blueberries, mix and add some water. Mix and switch off heat. Add blueberry jam, mix well and put it back on heat.', 'Grate lemon into it to get the zest and mix well. Add juice of  1/2  lemon, mix well and switch off heat. Set aside.', 'Stir the batter.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa. Grease a medium size ring mould with butter and place it on the tawa. Pour ladleful of batter in it, reduce heat and let the underside of the crumpet turn golden. Remove the ring, flip and cook till the other side also turns golden.', 'Serve hot with blueberry jam mix.']

title: Rajasthani Kadhi-SK Khazana
method: ['Whisk together yogurt, gram flour, ginger-garlic-green chilli paste and salt and whisk together. Add turmeric powder and chilli powder and whisk again.', 'Heat ghee in a deep non-stick pan. Add cinnamon, cloves, bay leaf, peppercorns, fenugreek seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, ginger and onions, mix and saute till onions turn translucent.', 'Add yogurt mixture and mix well. Add 2 cups water and mix again. Add salt, mix and bring to a boil.', 'Garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot with steamed rice.']

title: Gajar Mooli Gobhi Ka Instant Achar
method: ['Pour vinegar into a deep pan and heat. Add sugar, black peppercorns, bay leaves, salt and when the mixture is hot add carrots, radishes and cauliflower.', 'Stir and take off the heat. Keep covered for about twenty four hours. Dry roast fenugreek seeds, cumin seeds, split mustard till it gives out a nice aroma. Crush the spices coarsely in a mortar with a pestle.', 'Take the vegetables out of the pickling solution and keep in a bowl. Heat mustard oil to smoking point and cool. Add asafoetida to the oil and mix. Add the crushed spices to the vegetables and mix. Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder, salt and mix. Add lemon juice and mix. Add the oil and mix once more.', 'Keep covered for about four to six hours and then serve.', 'If you want to keep it for some time keep it in a refrigerator but for not more than ten days.']

title: Dal Dhokli - SK Khazana Recipe
method: ['Take boiled split pigeon pea in a bowl and blend with a hand blender till smooth.', 'Heat oil in a deep non-stick pan, add asafoetida, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves and raw peanuts, mix and saute for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add tomatoes and mix well. Cover and cook till they turn soft and pulpy.', 'Add ginger, mix and saute for 30 seconds. Add salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, clove powder, cinnamon powder and the blended pigeon peas and mix well.', 'Add  1/2  cup water, mix well. Add jaggery, mix and cook till the jaggery dissolves.', 'Add tamarind water, mix, cover and cook for a 4-5 minutes.', 'Take whole wheat flour in a large bowl, add gram flour, salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, carom seeds, oil and sufficient water, mix well and knead to a semi-stiff dough.', 'To make the stuffing, take coconut in a bowl, salt, sugar, lemon juice and red chilli powder and mix well.', 'Divide the dough into 2 portions. Roll out one portion into a large disc. Trim the edges to straighten them and cut into 1 inch diamonds with a pastry cutter. . Transfer them on a plate.', 'Divide the remaining dough into small portions and shape them into balls. Dust with a little flour and roll out each ball into a small disc. Place a little stuffing mixture in the centre, apply a little water on the edges, bring the two sides together and press to seal. Further gather the edges and shape into a potli.', 'Slide the diamond shaped pieces and the potlis into the dal. Cover and cook for 6-8 minutes or till completely cooked.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and cherry tomatoes. Serve hot.']

title: Christmas Cracker Santa
method: ['Place cheese spread in a piping bag fitted with a nozzle.', 'Finely chop black olives for the eyes. Halve green olives for moustaches.', 'Place a cracker biscuit on a worktop. Using the cheese spread as a glue, stick the following: nachos making a hat, 2 pieces black olives pieces as the eyes and green olive halves as the moustache. Finally pipe out the cheese spread on the biscuit making the beard, hair and other decorations. Similarly assemble remaining Santas.', 'Serve immediately.']

title: Dal Chawal Arancini-SK Khazana
method: ['Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan. Add cumin seeds and saute till seeds change colour.', 'Add ginger, garlic and green chilli, mix and saute for a minute.', 'Add asafoetida, curry leaves and turmeric powder and mix well. Add pigeon peas and salt and mix well.', 'Add coriander leaves, mix and cook till the mixture dries. Transfer into a bowl, add rice and mix well.', 'Grease your palms with some oil. Divide the mixture into equal portions, stuff each with a cheese cube and shape into balls.', 'Dip the balls in slurry and coat with breadcrumbs. Repeat the process.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Deep-fry arancini till golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Deep-fry papad and slit green chillies in the same oil. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot arancini topped with papad pieces and fried chillies.']

title: Gulkand Phirni
method: ['Put rice and  1/4  cup milk in a mixer jar and grind coarsely.', 'Heat remaining milk in a non-stick pan and add ground rice. Cook, stirring continuously, till the rice is fully cooked and the mixture thickens.', 'Add sugar and gulkand, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Pour the phirni into the earthen kasore and drizzle a little rose syrup over each kasore.', 'Garnish with pistachios.', 'Serve hot or chilled.']

title: Hot And Sweet Chicken Wings
method: ['Take salt, ginger paste, garlic paste and paprika powder in a bow.', 'Add chicken wings and mix well to coat the chicken with the mixture and let it marinate for fifteen minutes.', 'Remove the chicken and coat with cornflour.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a frying pan and deep fry the chicken wings until golden in colour.', 'Drain on an absorbent paper.', 'To make hot and sweet sauce, combine soy sauce, malt vinegar, sugar and ginger juice in a pan. Add water as required and bring the mixture to boil.', 'Add garlic and red and green chillies and stir well.', 'Continue boiling until the sauce is reduced to half.', 'Add chicken wings and stir till they are well coated with the sauce.', 'Transfer the chicken wings to a serving plate, sprinkle sesame oil and serve with steamed rice.']

title: Low Fat Mushroom Burger
method: ['Roughly chop onion and carrot, put them into a processor. Add mushrooms, brown rice, coriander sprigs, salt and crushed black peppercorns and chop finely.', 'Transfer this mixture into a bowl, add breadcrumbs and mix well. Divide this mixture into 4 equal portions, flatten them into patties.', 'Halve burger buns.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a non-stick pan. Shallow-fry the patties, turning sides, till they are crisp and brown on both the sides. Drain them on absorbent paper.', 'Heat oil in another non-stick pan, slit the burger buns and place them in the pan and toast them.', 'Slice tomato.', 'Spread 1 tsp red chilli sauce on the inner sides of each burger buns, place 2-3 iceberg lettuce leaves on one half of the bun, place a mushroom patti over it, top with some of the tomato slices. Cover with the other halve of the bun.', 'Keep the burgers on a serving plate and serve immediately.']

title: Lychee Baked Yogurt - SK Khazana
method: ['Preheat the oven to 160@C.', 'Put the lychees in a blender jar and blend to a coarse paste.', 'Take yogurt in a large bowl, add condensed milk, fresh cream and lychee paste and whisk till well combined.', 'Transfer into shot glasses till  3/4  filled and cover each glass with aluminium foil. Place them on a deep baking tray. Pour water into the baking tray, keep the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes.', 'Take the glasses out of the oven and allow to cool down completely.', 'Garnish each glass with a lychee, pistachio slivers and dried rose petals and serve.']

title: Steamed Pesto Fish - SK Khazana
method: ['To make pesto, blend together basil leaves, almonds, garlic, parmesan cheese powder, salt, crushed peppercorns and olive oil to a smooth paste.', 'Put fish pieces on a plate. Add prepared pesto and rub well on both sides.', 'Heat sufficient water in a steamer. Grease the steamer plate with some oil, place fish pieces on it and steam for 10-15 minutes.', 'Cut into pieces and serve hot with salad.']

title: Jeera Rice
method: ['Heat 4 - 5 cups water in a deep non-stick pan. Add salt and rice, mix, cover and cook on medium heat till rice is half cooked. Strain the excess water and spread rice evenly on a plate.', 'Heat ghee in another non-stick pan. Add cumin seeds and saute till fragrant. Add cooked rice and sprinkle coriander leaves and toss. Add salt and sprinkle some water, toss, cover and cook for 4-5 minutes.', 'Serve hot garnished with a coriander spring.']

title: Kothimbir Chicken
method: ['Marinate chicken with salt and turmeric powder.', 'Take cashewnuts, poppy seeds, green cardamoms, garlic, ginger, green chillies, cumin seeds, cloves, peppercorns and cinnamon in a blender jar. Reserve 1 tablespoon chopped coriander and add remaining alongwith some water and blend to a fine paste.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add onions and saute till golden.', 'Add prepared paste, saute and cook on high heat. Add marinated chicken, mix well and cook on high heat for a minute.', 'Add some water, mix, cover and cook on low heat for 7-8 minutes.', 'Add reserved chopped coriander, mix well and cook for a minute.', 'Serve hot garnished with chopped coriander.']

title: Pasta in Cheese Sauce-SK Khazana
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add garlic and saute well. Add red and green capsicums, broccoli and corn kernels, mix and saute for 1-2 minutes.', 'Roughly chop sausages and add along with salt, chilli flakes, oregano and mix well.', 'Add penne and fusilli and toss well. Add white sauce, mix well and cook for a minute. Add crushed peppercorns and mix well.', 'Garnish with cheese, sprinkle some pepper powder and serve hot.']

title: Easy Marshmallow Mousse
Main ingredients: Marshmellows, Milk, Dark chocolate, Cocoa powder, White chocolate chips

title: Tomato Chilli Baked Fish
method: ['Heat 4 tablespoons olive oil in a non-stick pan. Add garlic and saute for a minute.', 'Peel, remove seeds and finely chop tomatoes. Add to the pan along with salt and thyme leaves, mix and saute well. Add chilli flakes and mix well.', 'Marinate the fish fillets with lemon juice and salt.', 'Preheat oven to 180o C.', 'Divide broccoli florets equally between 4 pieces of baking paper. Place one fish fillet on each, puttomato mixture on top and drizzle some olive oil. Bring in the edges to make a packet.', 'Place the packets on a baking tray, put the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes.', 'Open the packets, garnish with micro greens and lemon wedges and serve hot.']

title: Smoked Aam Panna
method: ['Peel the raw mangoes and put them into a pressure cooker. Add 1 cup water, put the lid on and cook under pressure till 1-2 whistles are given out. Open the lid when the pressure reduces completely.', 'Heat a piece of coal on direct flame.', 'Deseed the cooked raw mangoes and take out the pulp in a bowl.', 'Heat raw mango pulp in a non-stick pan, add sugar, mix and cook till it melts. Add salt, cumin powder and black salt, mix and cook for 1-2 minutes. Transfer into a bowl and cool.', 'Put the hot coal in a small steel bowl and place the steel bowl in the center of raw mango pulp mixture. Drizzle some ghee on it, cover quickly and keep for 2-3 minutes. Remove the steel bowl with the coal.', 'To prepare each portion, blend together 3-4 tablespoons raw mango mixture, few ice cubes and  1/2  cup chilled water into a smooth mixture.', 'Mix together salt and chilli powder on a plate.', 'Apply some lemon juice on the rim of each serving glasses. Place the glasses upside down over the chilli powder-salt till their rims are well coated.', 'Put few ice cubes, 2-3 lemon slices and 4-5 mint leaves in each glass. Pour the raw mango mixture and serve chilled garnished with mint sprigs.']

title: Mocha Date Milkshake
method: ['Dissolve instant coffee powder with 2 tbsps water in a bowl. Put this mixture into a blender jar.', 'Add dates and half the milk and blend. Add the remaining milk and chocolate ice cream and blend well.', 'Pour the prepared mocha date milkshake into 4 stemmed glasses and serve chilled.']

title: Soyabean Pie
method: ['Preheat oven at 180degC. Place a silicon sheet on a baking tray.', 'Combine refined flour, salt and butter in a bowl. Mix well and rub them to resemble bread crumbs. Add  1/4  cup chilled water slowly and knead well into a stiff dough. Set aside.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add cumin seeds, green chillies, garlic and saute till the garlic turns golden.', 'Add onion and saute well.', 'Dust dough with little flour and roll out into a large thin sheet. Take a cookie cutter, a size larger than a 4 inch steel katori and cut out 4 discs from the dough sheet.', 'Add turmeric powder in the pan and mix well. Add red chilli powder, coriander powder, salt and mix well.', 'Add tomatoes, toss and cook till the oil leaves the sides of the pan.', 'Roll out the leftover dough again into a large sheet and using the 4 inch katori, cut out 4 more discs from it.', 'Grease four 4 inch katoris with little butter and dust with little flour. Line the katoris with the second batch of discs pressing well. Prick the inside with a fork.', 'Add soyabean granules and  1/4  cup water in the pan. Mix well and cook further.', 'Add chopped mint, chopped coriander and ginger and mix well. Cook till fully done.', 'Roll out leftover dough into a sheet and cut thin strips from it.', 'Fill the lined katoris with the cooked soyabean mixture and cover with the first batch of dough discs pressing at the edges to seal. Apply little water on top and place the dough strips on top to make a mat design.', 'Brush little butter on top of the pies and place the katoris on the baking tray and put the tray in the preheated oven. Bake for 16-18 minutes or till the crust turns golden.']

title: Pindi Chole Gujiya
method: ['Heat ghee in a non-stick pan. Add onions and saute on medium heat till onions turn golden brown.', 'Add ginger-garlic paste and saute till fragrant. Add tomato puree, mix well and saute for 3-4 minutes till oil separates. Add salt and mix well.', 'Add chole masala, mix well and saute for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add boiled chickpeas with cooking liquor and mix well. Cook on medium heat for 2-3 minutes.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions, apply little ghee on worktop, apply ghee on each portion and roll out into thin discs. Cut out medium round discs with a cookie cutter', 'Mash the chole slightly and cook till the mixture dries up. Transfer into a plate and set aside to cool.', 'Place a little pindi chole in the centre of each disc. Apply water on edges, fold into half and seal the edges and shape into gujiyas by slightly pinching the sealed edges and folding inwards.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai on medium heat, slide in gujiyas, a few at a time, and deep-fry till golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Transfer into a serving basket lined with butter paper and serve hot with green chutney.']

title: Mini Koki
method: ['Take flour in a bowl. Add onion, coriander leaves, green chillies, pomegranate seeds, salt and sufficient milk and knead into a semi-stiff dough. Add 1 tablespoon oil and knead well. Set aside for 15-20 minutes.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions. Dust the worktop with some flour and roll out each portion into  1/2  cm thick sheet. Cut into squares using a small square cookie cutter.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa. Roast the squares, turning sides and basting with some oil, till they are evenly golden on both sides. These are koki.', 'Place kokis in pairs one on top of other, on a serving platter, put hung yogurt quenelles on top and sprinkle some sumac powder.', 'Serve immediately.']

title: Besan Cheela Burrito - SK Khazana
method: ['Add Besan and whole wheat flour in a large bowl. Add dried red chilli flakes, salt, turmeric powder and drizzle 2 tsps oil. Add chopped coriander and  3/4  cup water and mix well. Knead to a semi-soft dough. Cover with a damp muslin cloth and set aside for 10 minutes.', 'Take a portion of the dough and shape it into a ball, slightly flatten it. Dust the work top with whole wheat flour and place the portion of the dough on it and roll into a thin disc.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa, cook the prepared disc for 1-2 minutes on each side. Drizzle a little oil and cook further for 1 minute on each side. Transfer on a worktop.', 'Add a few romaine lettuce leaves, add a portion of the herbed rice and add baked beans on top. Top up with salsa and drizzle sour cream. Fold the sides and roll into a burrito.', 'Cut in half and serve with sour cream and salsa.']

title: Thai Sizzler
method: ['Heat a sizzler plate.', 'Heat 2 cups water in a deep non-stick pan, add Thai rice and salt, mix well and cook.', 'Cut red and yellow capsicums into  1/2  inch pieces. Slice spring onion bulbs.', 'Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan. Make small crisscross incisions on the chicken breasts, sprinkle crushed peppercorns and salt. Keep them, the incision side downwards, in the pan and cook, turning sides, till lightly browned on both sides. Drain and place on a plate.', 'Add Thai green curry paste to the same pan, add 2-3 tbsps hot water and mix well and cook. Add coconut milk and mix. Add 1 tsp brown sugar and mix well. Add chicken and 10-15 basil leaves and cook till the chicken is fully done. Cover and set aside.', 'Heat 1 tsp oil in another non-stick pan. Break egg directly into the pan and cook till done. Transfer it on another plate', 'Strain the cooked rice put into a bowl.', 'Heat 1 tsp oil in the same pan, add yellow and red capsicum pieces, salt and crushed peppercorns and saute till lightly browned. Transfer the sauteed capsicums into a bowl and set aside.', 'To make lemon grass and ginger tea, diagonally slice the lemon grass and put into a glass kettle. Slice ginger and put into the same kettle. Add 2-3 cups boiling water, cover the kettle and set aside.', 'Heat 1 tsp oil in the same pan, add spring onion, flat noodles,  1/2  cup water, salt, tamarind pulp, remaining brown sugar and crushed peanuts and toss well. Add remaining basil leaves and red chilli paste, toss well and cook for 1-2 minutes.', 'Pour the lemon grass-ginger tea into serving cup. Pack some Thai rice into a small bowl.', 'Place the hot sizzler plate on its wooden base, arrange cabbage leaves on it, upturn the bowl of rice on one cabbage leaf. Place the chicken breasts in the centre leaf leaving the gravy in the pan itself and place cooked noodles on the third leaf. Place the sauteed capsicums around the chicken breasts. Gently lift the glass bowl from the rice and pour the chicken gravy all over, top with the egg and serve hot immediately.']

title: Blooming Onions
method: ['Mix together flour, salt, dried thyme, onion powder, dried oregano, garlic powder, 1 teaspoon crushed black peppercorns, paprika and red chilli powder in a bowl.', 'Whisk together milk, egg, vinegar, a little crushed black peppercorns and salt in another bowl.', 'Make 8 slits on the onions without cutting through. Separate the layers to create flowers.', 'Dust the onion flowers with the flour mixture taking care that the flour mixture goes into the slits too. Dip in the milk-egg mixture and dust them with the flour mixture once again. Refrigerate for 10-15 minutes.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Gently slide the onions into hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving plate and serve hot with green mayonnaise and tomato ketchup.']

title: Fruit Ball Float
method: ['Halve the watermelon, deseed and scoop out small balls using a melon scooper.', 'Halve the musk melon, deseed and scoop out small balls using a melon scooper.', 'Combine orange juice and guava juice in a shaker. Add crushed ice and shake well.', 'Pour the drink into four individual glasses and add the watermelon and musk melon balls in them.', 'Top up with drinking soda and fix an orange slice on the rim of each glass. Serve immediately.']

title: Teriyaki Chicken Lollipop - SK Khazana
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add chicken lollipops and cook on high heat till golden brown from all sides, turning sides in between. Remove the pieces from heat and transfer into a bowl.', 'In another bowl, add brown sugar, mirin, apple cider vinegar, sesame oil and sake and mix well. Set aside.', 'Heat the same pan and add garlic and spring onion bulbs and saute for 1 minute.\nAdd the prepared sauce in the pan and mix well. Add the chicken pieces and toss well. Add corn flour slurry. Mix well and cook till the sauce thickens.', 'Add chopped spring onion greens and toss. Take the pan off the heat.\nTransfer into a serving plate and garnish with spring onion greens and chopped fresh red chillies.']

title: Aam Papad Challi
ingredients: ['Few pieces regular aam papad', 'Few pieces kala aam papad', '1 corn on cob', 'Oil for drizzling', 'Butter for brushing', '1 teaspoon red chilli powder', 'Black salt to taste', '1 teaspoon chaat masala + for sprinkling', '2 tablespoons lemon juice']
method: ['Peel corn on cob and roast directly on high flame.', 'Heat a non-stick grill pan.', 'Cut roasted corn on cob into 3 portions, halve and place on the hot pan. Drizzle some oil and toss well.', 'Brush the corn pieces with some butter, add red chilli powder, black salt, chaat masala and lemon juice. Top with regular and kala aam papad pieces and cook till soft.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, sprinkle chaat masala and serve immediately.']

title: Angry Potatoes
method: ['Heat oil in a non stick wok. Add soy sauce, 1 tsp red chilli paste and 1 1/2  tbsps cornflour to potato wedges and mix well. Arrange the potato wedges in the wok in a single layer.', 'Slice onions. Cut spring onions greens into finger size pieces and further cut into thin strips and keep them dipped in iced water.', 'Toss the potatoes in the wok and cook till golden. Drain and transfer the potato wedges into a bowl. To the oil remaining in the wok add ginger, garlic, dry red chilies, onion and toss.', 'Add remaining red chilli paste, tomato ketchup, salt, 1 tsp crushed black peppercorns and mix.Mix remaining cornflour with 3 tbsps water.', 'Add a little water to the wok and mix. Crush Sichuan peppers and add. Add cornflour mixture and cook till it thickens.', 'Add salt and mix. Add potatoes and mix till all the wedges are well coated with the sauce.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, sprinkle remaining crushed peppercorns and garnish with spring onion green strips. Serve hot.']

title: Bread Upma
method: ['Break the bread slices into smaller pieces with or without the crust. Heat oil in a kadai. Add a pinch of asafoetida. Add cumin seeds and mustard seeds.', 'When the cumin seeds change colour and mustard seeds crackle, add onion and saute. When the onion turns translucent, add diced potatoes and saute for two minutes.', 'Add turmeric powder and bread pieces. Mix and add red chilli powder and toss to mix well. Sprinkle some water and cook for two minutes.', 'Add lemon juice, green chillies and coriander leaves. Toss and serve hot.']

title: Pumpkin Cutlet
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, red chillies, asafoetida and shallots, mix and saute for 2 minutes.', 'Add pumpkin and toss well. Add sambar masala and salt and toss well. Cook for 1 minute.', 'Mash the mixture and cook till the moisture evaporates. Take the pan off the heat and set aside to cool.', 'Add breadcrumbs and mix well. Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape each into a tear drop.', 'Spread semolina on a plate. Coat each cutlet with semolina on all sides.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a shallow non-stick pan, place the cutlets in it and shallow-fry, turning sides, till evenly golden brown and crisp on both sides. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange the cutlets on a serving plate and serve hot with coconut chutney.']

title: Ginger Cookie Tiramisu
method: ['Take mascarpone cheese in a bowl. Add powdered sugar and whisk well. Add coffee concoction and whisk well.', 'Add some whipped cream and fold. Add remaining whipped cream and fold well. Fill the cream mixture in a piping bag fitted with a nozzle.', 'Put some crushed ginger cookies in a serving glass bowl. Put some black coffee to soak the cookies and pipe out some cream cheese mixture on top and tap.', 'Pipe out some drops of cream cheese mixture on top, covering the layer. Refrigerate to set for 1-2 hours.', 'Serve chilled.']

title: Bloody Mary
method: ['Combine tomato juice, celery salt, crushed peppercorns, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, vodka and salt in a jug.', 'Place some ice cubes in a cocktail shaker and pour the combine drink into it. Cover.', 'Spread some salt onto a plate. Rub the rim of individual glasses with lemon wedges and dip in the salt so that the salt sticks to the rims. Set aside.', 'Trim ends of celery sticks and cut into halves lengthwise.', 'Shake the cocktail shaker well and pour the drink into the prepared glasses. Add  1/2  teaspoon Tabasco sauce into each glass.', 'Place celery stick in the glass and garnish with lemon wedges on the rim. Serve chilled.']

title: Vegetable Hyderabadi Biryani
method: ['Heat sufficient oil in a kadai and deep-fry sliced onions till golden brown. Drain on an absorbent paper.', 'Beat yogurt. Add two tablespoons of biryani Masala, half of the fried onions, ginger paste and garlic paste, salt and vegetables. Allow to marinate for thirty minutes.', 'Drain the soaked rice.', 'Add four- five cups of water to a deep non-stick pan along with green cardamoms, cloves, bay leaves, black peppercorns and salt. Bring to a boil, add rice and cook till the rice is three fourth done. Drain and spread on a plate.', 'Dissolve saffron in warm milk.', 'Heat ghee in a thick-bottomed vessel, add the marinated vegetables and saute for two to three minutes.', 'Add three-fourth cup of water and bring to a boil, then simmer for two to three minutes.', 'Layer rice evenly over vegetables.', 'Sprinkle the remaining biryani masala, mint leaves, coriander leaves. Reserve some fried onions and sprinkle the remaining on top. Sprinkle cashew nuts, almonds and raisins.', 'Drizzle saffron milk. cover with a lid and seal with dough.', 'Put the sealed handi on a heated tawa and cook on very low heat for fifteen to twenty minutes.', 'Garnish with some fried onions, mint leaves and serve hot.']

title: Melon Slush
method: ['Put melons in a blender add orange squash,  1/4  cup water and blend.', 'Add ice cubes and blend again.', 'Pour into individual stemmed glasses and serve chilled.']

title: Cauliflower Garlic Sticks
method: ['Preheat oven to 180deg C. Grease a loaf tin with some butter and dust with some flour.', 'Mix together cauliflower and salt in a bowl. Set aside.', 'Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan. Add garlic and saute for  1/2  minute. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Squeeze out the excess water from cauliflower and place in another bowl. Add sauteed garlic, egg, cheese, dried herbs, green chillies,  1/3  cup breadcrumbs, 1 tablespoon coriander leaves and crushed peppercorns and mix well. Adjust salt.', 'Mix together remaining cheese, remaining coriander leaves and remaining breadcrumbs in a bowl.', 'Spread cauliflower mixture in the prepared loaf tin. Place the tin in the preheated oven and bake for till golden brown from top. Flip and bake again till golden brown on the other side as well.', 'Sprinkle the prepared cheese mixture on top and bake once again till the cheese melts. Remove from heat, cool and cut into sticks.', 'Serve.']

title: No Bake Chocolate Peanut Butter Cookies
method: ['Heat butter in non stick pan. Add sugar and mix well. Add cocoa powder and mix well. Add condensed milk and mix well. Cook, stirring frequently.', 'Add peanut butter and mix well. Add milk and mix well. Add oats and mix well. Cook till thick and switch off heat.Coarsely crush almonds in a grinder. Add walnuts and crush again.', 'Reserve some crushed nuts for garnish and add remaining to oats mixture and mix well.Drop portions of the oat mixture with help of a spoon on a butter paper and sprinkle reserved crushed nuts on top.', 'Refrigerate for  1/2  an hour or till completely set. Store in an airtight container.']

title: Mla Dosa
method: ['Grind moong and rice with little water. Add green chillies, curry leaves and ginger and grind to a coarse paste.', 'Transfer into a bowl, add water to adjust consistency. Add salt and mix well and set aside.', 'For upma, heat oil in a non stick pan. Chop onion roughly. Add mustard seeds, asafoetida, cumin seeds, urad dal, curry leaves and onion to the pan and saute till fragrant.', 'Add semolina and saute for 2 minutes.Heat a non sticktawa, pour a ladle full of batter to 4-inch diameter dosa.', 'Add 1  1/2  cups hot water and salt to rawa and mix well and let it cook till done.Turn over the dosa, put some upma on one side, fold the other side over.Serve hot.']

title: Kalakand Fruit Custard
method: ['Roughly chop walnuts. Dry roast the walnuts in a non-stick pan till crisp. Transfer into a bowl.', 'Take milk in another bowl, add custard powder and mix well.', 'Transfer the custard mixture into a deep non-stick pan and cook on medium heat, whisking continuously till the mixture starts thickening and reaches pouring consistency.', 'Add castor sugar. Break kalakand pieces and add and mix well with a whisk till the mixture thickens further. Add half the roasted walnuts and apple and mix well.', 'Pour half the custard into a deep serving plate. Add pears and pour the remaining custard mixture. Garnish with orange segments, pomegranate pearls, remaining roasted walnuts and red grapes. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours or till set.', 'Serve chilled.']

title: Besan Burfi
method: ['Heat the ghee in a non-stick pan, add the gram flour and saute it on low heat, stirring continuously, for ten to fifteen minutes or till it starts changing colour and gives out a nice aroma.', 'Add the cardamom powder, almonds and pistachio slivers and mix. Remove from heat and let it cool.', 'Add the powdered sugar and mix well.', 'Grease a tray with ghee. Pour the gram flour mixture and spread it evenly on the tray.', 'Let it cool and then cut into square or diamond shaped pieces and serve.', 'Store in an airtight container.']

title: Rawa Idli
ingredients: ['1 cup semolina (rawa/suji)', '3 tablespoons ghee', '6-8 cashewnuts, broken', ' 1/2  teaspoon mustard seeds', ' 1/2  teaspoon cumin seeds', '6-7 curry leaves', '1-2 green chillies, finely chopped', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves', ' 1/2  teaspoon crushed black peppercorns', ' 1/2  cup sour yogurt', 'Salt to taste', '1 teaspoon fruit salt', 'Oil for greasing', 'Green coconut chutney for serving']
method: ['Heat 1 tablespoon ghee in a non-stick pan. Add semolina and roast till golden brown. Transfer in a bowl and cool.', 'To prepare tempering, heat remaining ghee in the same non-stick pan. Add cashewnuts and saute till golden brown. Drain in the same bowl and cool.', 'Add mustard seeds to the hot ghee and let it splutter. Add cumin seeds and when they change colour, add curry leaves and let it crackle.', 'Add the tempering, green chillies, coriander leaves, crushed peppercorns, yogurt and salt to roasted semolina mixture and mix well.', 'Add 1 cup water and mix well. Set aside for 10 minutes.', 'Heat some water in a deep non-stick pan. Place a steamer, cover and let the water boil.', 'Add fruit salt to the semolina mixture and mix well.', 'Grease an idli mould with some oil and place in the hot steamer.', 'Pour some semolina mixture in the greased mould filling  3/4 th of it, cover and steam for 10 minutes. Remove from steamer, slightly cool and demould.', 'Serve hot with green coconut chutney.']

title: Rose Coconut Drink-SK Khazana
method: ['Rub a lemon slice on the rim of each of 4 serving glasses. Dip the rims in dried rose petals kept in a plate and set the glasses upright on the worktop.', 'Put 4-5 ice cubes, 1 tablespoon sabza seeds and 2 tablespoons rose syrup in each glass.', 'Top with  1/2  cup coconut water in each glass, mix and garnish with few fresh rose petals.', 'Serve chilled.']

title: Flourless Chocolate Cake
method: ['Preheat oven to 180deg C. Grease a square baking tin with some butter and dust with some flour.', 'Melt dark chocolate on a double boiler. Add butter and mix well. Remove from heat and bring down to room temperature.', 'Take egg yolks in another bowl. Add  1/4  cup + 2 tablespoons castor sugar and whisk well with an electric beater till the mixture is pale, fluffy and is of ribbon consistency.', 'Beat egg whites in a third bowl with an electric beater. Add  1/4  cup castor sugar gradually and whisk till medium peaks appear.', 'Add melted chocolate mixture gradually into yolk mixture and mix well. Add  1/3  of egg white mixture and fold in gently. Add remaining egg white mixture and mix well. Transfer the batter into the greased tin and tap gently.', 'Place the tin in the preheated oven and bake for 30-40 minutes. Remove from oven and cool.', 'To prepare chocolate garnish, spread melted chocolate on an acetate sheet and level it out. Set aside to cool. Transfer the sheet on a tray and refrigerate for 1 minute.', 'Remove the chocolate sheet from the refrigerator. Lightly heat the edges of a medium size cookie cutter and cut out roundels.', 'To prepare espresso anglaise, heat cream in a small deep non-stick pan. Add castor sugar and bring to boil. Slit a vanilla pod and add to pan.', 'Take egg yolks in a bowl. Add some cream mixture and mix well. Add yolk-cream mixture to the remaining cream mixture in the pan, place the pan back on heat and cook for 1-2 minutes. Strain in another bowl.', 'Take coffee powder in a small bowl. Add 2-3 tablespoons hot water and mix well.', 'Add the coffee mixture to yolk-cream mixture and whisk well. Refrigerate to chill.', 'Add whipped cream gradually to coffee anglaise and fold in well and fill it in a piping bag.', 'Demould the cake, halve horizontally and trim off the edges. Cut each halved cake into 3 different sized roundels using medium, small and smaller sized cookie cutters.', 'Line individual wine glasses with smaller cake roundel and pipe out coffee anglaise on top. Repeat with this with small and medium cake roundels.', 'Place one chocolate garnish on top and dust some cocoa powder on top.\nServe immediately.']

title: Mushroom Do Pyaza
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add green chilli, ginger paste and mix well. Add chopped onion, mix and saute till it turns golden brown.', 'Add tomato, mix and saute till pulpy. Add tomato puree, mix and saute for a minute. Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder, garam masala powder and salt, mix well and saute for 1 minute.', 'Add  1/2  cup water and mix well. Cover and cook for 4-5 minutes. Add cubed onion, capsicum and mushrooms and mix well. Cover and cook for 4-5 minutes.', 'Add fresh cream and coriander leaves and mix well. Cook for a few seconds and take the pan off the heat.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and garnish with coriander sprig and slit green chilli. Serve hot with laccha paranthe.']

title: Breakfast Pizza
method: ['Preheat oven to 200deg C', 'Halve the buns horizontally to make pizza bases.', 'Mix tomato ketchup and mustard sauce in a bowl and apply this mixture on all the pizza bases.', 'For each pizza, heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan and keep a silicon ring in the centre of the pan. Break an egg into it and cook.', 'Slice tomato into slightly thick roundels.', 'Sprinkle a little salt on the egg. Remove the ring and turn the egg over.', 'Place a basil leaf on the pizza base and over this place the fried egg. Place 2 tomato roundels over the egg.', 'Cut slightly thick slices of mozzarella cheese and place a slice of cheese over the tomato roundels.', 'Shred the remaining basil leaves and sprinkle over the cheese.', 'Place the pizzas in a cake tin and bake in the oven till the base is crisp and the cheese melts. Serve hot.']

title: Dark Chocolate and Orange Marmalade Waffles-Cook S
method: ['Take refined flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a bowl and mix well.', 'Break eggs into another bowl. Add brown sugar and whisk well. Add vanilla essence and beat again.', 'Add oil to the flour mixture and mix. Add 1 cup buttermilk and mix well.', 'Add egg mixture and chocolate and mix well into a smooth batter. Add remaining buttermilk and mix well. Add orange marmalade and mix again.', 'Heat a waffle iron and grease with a little oil. Pour batter on it, cover and cook till fully done. Make more waffles similarly.', 'Brush with some butter and drizzle some honey and serve hot.']

title: Strawberry Cheesecake in Jar
method: ['Crush biscuits to a coarse powder and put it into a bowl. Add melted butter and mix. Put this mixture at the base of a dessert jar reserving some.', 'Mix gelatine in a little water and heat in the microwave for 1 minute. Remove from the microwave and set aside.', 'Blend condensed milk, hung yogurt, dissolved gelatin and cream cheese in a blender till smooth and transfer into a bowl. Add strawberry puree, most of the strawberries and whipped cream and mix.', 'Put this mixture into a piping bag and pipe it into the jar over the biscuit layer. Arrange some of the remaining strawberries on top, put some of reserved crust and finish with the layer of the chopped strawberries.', 'Garnish with a strawberry and keep in the refrigerator till set. Serve chilled.']

title: Uniappam
method: ['Put rice and jaggery in a grinder jar and grind with little water, ginger powder and green cardamom seeds.', 'Peel bananas, cut into roundels and add to the grinder jar and grind into a smooth batter. Transfer into a bowl.', 'Heat 1 tsp ghee in a non-stick pan, add coconut and saute till lightly browned. Add black sesame seeds, mix and add this to the batter and mix well.', 'Heat unniappam mould. Fill the dents with sufficient ghee and heat. Pour batter into the dents till they are  3/4  full and cook, turning the appams once with a skewer, till golden and crisp from all over.', 'Remove the unniappams from the mould, arrange them on a serving plate, dust icing sugar on top and serve immediately.']

title: Mushroom and Cherry Tomato Crumble
method: ['Preheat oven to 180deg C.', 'Roughly chop spring onions with greens, garlic, brown bread slices, onion and parsley sprigs in a chopper.', 'Place button mushrooms in a bowl and add cherry tomatoes. Roughly chop oyster mushrooms and add along with salt, crushed black peppercorns, crushed red chillies, 2 tbsps extra virgin olive oil, 2-3 tbsps of spiced breadcrumbs and mix well.', 'Transfer this mixture into a glass baking dish and press lightly. Top with the remaining spiced breadcrumbs. Drizzle 2-3 tbsps extra virgin olive oil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Mixed Bean Sprouts Wrap
method: ['To make the filling, heat 3 tbsps oil in a non-stick pan, add ginger and green chillies and saute for  1/2  minute. Add onion and saute till lightly coloured. Drain and add ground soya chunks, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, 1 tspchaat masala, mix and saute for 2 minutes or till the raw smells disappear.', 'Add tomato ketchup and red chilli sauce and mix. Add mixed bean sprouts and mashed potato and mix well. Add salt and mix well and saute for 2-3 minutes. Transfer the mixture into a bowl. Add juice of  1/2  lemon and mix well. Chop coriander leaves and add and mix well.', 'To make the chutney, put coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chillies, chaatmasala, sugar, yogurt, salt and juice of  1/2  lemon in a grinder jar and grind finely.', 'Spread a little chutney on each roti, place a generous amount of the filling mixture at one end and roll.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa and drizzle a little oil on it. Keep the rolls on it and cook, turning sides, till they are evenly golden and crisp on all sides.', 'Halve them horizontally, place them on a serving plate and serve hot.']

title: Beguni
method: ['Cut the brinjals vertically into thin slices. Sprinkle salt and sugar on the brinjal slices, mix well and set aside for 10-15 minutes.', 'Take gram flour in a mixing bowl, add rice flour, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, ginger-garlic paste, sugar, salt, baking powder and sufficient water, whisk well and make a smooth thin batter.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Dab the brinjal slices between absorbent papers to remove excess moisture. Dip them, one by one, in the batter, shake off excess batter and slide into hot oil. Deep-fry till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot with kasundi mustard.']

title: Chicken Miraoni
method: ['Heat 1 teaspoon ghee in a small non-stick tempering pan, add peppercorns and let them splutter. Add  1/2  tablespoon garlic and saute till pink. Switch off the heat, cool and grind alongwith coconut, tamarind pulp and some water and grind to make a fine paste. Set aside.', 'Heat remaining ghee in a non-stick wok, add remaining garlic and saute till brown. Add onions and saute further for 2 minutes.', 'Add chicken cubes and cook on high heat for a minute.', 'Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt and mix well. Add  1/2  cup water, cover and cook on simmer for 5-7 minutes.', 'Add the ground paste and mix well. Cook on simmer for 2-3 minutes.', 'Serve hot.']

title: Matar Kulcha
method: ['Pressure cook dried white peas alongwith some water, salt and turmeric powder till 4-5 whistles are released. Open the lid when the excess air is completely released. Transfer in a bowl.', 'Grind together mint leaves, 2 teaspoons cumin seeds, peppercorns, black cardamom fennel seeds, dried red chillies, asafoetida,  1/2  teaspoon dried mango powder, black salt, tamarind pulp and 1 tablespoon water into smooth mixture.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add remaining cumin seeds and when it changes colour, add garam masala powder, chilli powder, 1 teaspoon chaat masala, coriander powder and dried mango powder and mix.', 'Add cooked white pea mixture and mix. Add salt and mix. Add 1 cup water, mix and cook for 1-2 minutes. Mash lightly.', 'Add ground mint leaves mixture, mix and cook for 2 minutes or till the mixture slightly thickens.', 'Put some white pea mixture in a serving bowl. Put some onion and tomato on top.', 'Garnish with some coriander leaves, ginger strips and slit green chilli. Sprinkle some chaat masala on top and place a lemon wedge on top.', 'Serve hot with kulchas.']

title: Sabudana Coconut Laddoo
Main ingredients: Sabudana, Desiccated coconut, Ghee, Cashewnuts, Powdered sugar

title: Pinacolada Cheesecake
method: ['Chop pineapple and transfer into a bowl.', 'Heat pineapple syrup in a non-stick pan. Add star anise, swirl and bring to boil. Remove from heat, add to pineapple in the bowl, cover with cling film and refrigerate.', 'Grind broken biscuits to a fine powder and transfer into another bowl. Add butter and mix well till it resembles breadcrumbs.', 'Line a serving jar with biscuit-butter mixture and press gently. Refrigerate.', 'Take  1/4  cup water in a microwave proof bowl. Sprinkle gelatin and set aside to bloom.', 'Take cream cheese, hung yogurt and condensed milk in a bowl and whisk well. Add coconut cream and whisk. Add edible yellow colour and whisk well.', 'Heat bloomed gelatin in microwave for 1 minute.', 'Add whipped cream to cream cheese mixture and fold in well.Add some of this mixture to bloomed gelatin and mix well.', 'Add the gelatin-cream mixture to remaining cream mixture and fold in well.Pour the cream cheese mixture in the lined jar and tap. Refrigerate till semi-set.', 'Spread the cooked pineapple over the cheesecake and place a star anise on top. Garnish with a mint sprig and refrigerate till fully set.', 'Serve.']

title: Chocolate Flan
method: ['Preheat oven at 180oC.', 'Melt chocolate in a double boiler and keep whisking once a while.', 'Combine condensed milk, eggs and vanilla essence in a bowl and whisk well.', 'Remove chocolate from heat and whisk till smooth.', 'Add milk to chocolate and keep whisking. Place it back on the double boiler and keep whisking till well blended. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.', 'Grease individual ramekin moulds with butter.', 'Heat a non-stick pan. Add sugar and let it caramelize.', 'Pour caramelized sugar into the greased moulds.', 'Add chocolate-milk mixture to the egg mixture and whisk well.', 'Pour the prepared mixture into the moulds, put moulds on a deep baking tray and cover them individually with aluminium foil. Fill the tray with water, put in preheated oven and bake for 40-45 minutes.', 'Bring the moulds out of the oven and let them cool down to room temperature.', 'Gently turn a toothpick around the mould and demould the flan onto a serving plate, garnish with chocolate curls and serve warm.']

title: Mini Croquembouche
method: ['To make choux paste, preheat oven at 180oC. Line a baking tray with a silicon mat.', 'Combine milk with  1/2  cup water and transfer in a deep non-stick pan on heat. Bring to a boil.', 'Add butter and let it melt completely. Remove from heat, add flour and fold well.', 'Place the pan back on heat and cook till everything comes together. Transfer into a bowl and let it cool.', 'Add eggs, one by one, and beat with an electric beater. Put the choux paste into a piping bag fitted with a nozzle.', 'Pipe out small portions onto the silicon mat. Dip your finger in water and press the tip of each portion. These are profiteroles. Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 10-15 minutes. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature.', 'To make pastry cream filling, separate the egg yolks from the whites and take the yolks into a bowl.', 'Combine cream and milk in a non-stick pan on heat and bring to a boil.', 'Add castor sugar to the egg yolks.', 'Slit vanilla pod, scrape of the beans and add to the egg yolk mixture. Whisk well.', 'Add flour and cornstarch and whisk well. Add some of the cream-milk mixture and whisk. Add the remaining cream-milk mixture and whisk well.', 'Pour the flour-cream mixture back in the pan and cook on low heat till it thickens. Transfer in a bowl and refrigerate to chill.', 'To make caramel, heat castor sugar in a non-stick pan. Add a drop of water and let it caramelize.', 'Place the chilled pastry cream filling in a piping bag fitted with a nozzle. Pipe the pastry cream filling inside the profiteroles.', 'To assemble the croquembouche, dip the sides of a few profiteroles in caramel and stick them together to make a circle base on a serving plate. Make a smaller second row similarly and stick onto the base with the caramel. Similarly create rows smaller than the previous until all the profiteroles are used and stick them on top of one another.', 'Cool the remaining caramel and create thin strips of caramel to create spun sugar. Decorate the croquembouche with the spun sugar.']

title: Dairy Free Spinach Soup
ingredients: ['1 medium bunch spinach', '2 medium onions', '1 tbsp oil', '1 tbsp finely chopped garlic', '2 medium potatoes', ' 1/2  cup brown rice, soaked in 2 cups of water', '1 cup soya milk', 'Salt to taste', '1 tsp black pepper powder + for sprinkling', 'A few thin strips of red capsicum, for garnishing']
method: ['Heat 1 cup water in a deep non-stick pan, add spinach and cook.', 'Quarter onions.', 'Heat oil in another non-stick pan, add garlic and onions and saute for a minute. Cut potatoes in big cubes and add to the second pan.', 'Add brown rice with the water in which it was soaked and cook till brown rice and potatoes are done. Switch off the heat.', 'Add the brown rice mixture to the spinach mixture and mix well.', 'Switch off the heat, strain, cool and grind with soya milk to a smooth puree.', 'Heat this puree in another deep non-stick pan. Add salt and pepper powder and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Pour the soup into a soup bowl, sprinkle pepper powder, garnish with red capsicum strips and serve immediately.']

title: Khajur Dryfruit ki Barfi
method: ['Heat ghee in a non-stick pan. Add pistachios and almonds and saute till they become golden brown in colour.', 'Add dates andquarter cup water and continue to cook till they become soft.', 'Add green cardamom powder and mix well. Remove from heat.', 'Grease the barfi tray with ghee and spread the mixture evenly in it.', 'Allow it to set for thirty minutes and then cut into equal squares.', 'Arrange them on a serving plate and serve at room temperature.']

title: Motichoor Custard
method: ['Mix custard powder and milk well in a bowl ensuring there are no lumps left.', 'Heat a non stick pan, pour the custard solution in it and cook, stirring, till it thickens.', 'Crumble 4 motichoor laddoos and put them in 4 ramekin moulds, pour the hot custard over it and pat on the table top to remove any air gaps that may have formed and ensure that the custard goes down right to the bottom of the moulds.', 'Crumble the remaining laddoos and sprinkle on top.', 'Chill in the refrigerator and serve. If you wish you can have it hot too.']

title: Malabar Prawns
method: ['Take prawns in a bowl, add salt, lemon juice and chilli powder, mix well and set aside to marinate for 10-15 minutes.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add onions, mix and saute till translucent. Add ginger, green chillies and fresh turmeric, mix and saute for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add curry leaves and mix well. Add prawns, mix well and cook for 5-7 minutes or till the prawns are done.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coconut and a coriander sprig and serve hot.']

title: Kaleji Pav
method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add peppercorns, cardamoms and cumin seeds and saute for 30 seconds.', 'Add ginger-garlic paste and little water, mix and saute for a minute. Add onions, mix and saute till golden.', 'Add coriander powder, cumin powder, chilli powder, turmeric powder and garam masala powder and mix. Add little water, mix and cook till the oil separates from the sides of the pan.', 'Add green chilli and mix well. Add mutton liver, mix and cook for a minute. Add salt and some water, mix and cook for a minute. Cover and cook till the liver is fully done.', 'Add mint leaves and coriander leaves and mix. Add butter, mix and let it melt. Add lemon juice, mix and switch off heat.', 'Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with pavs, onion rings and lemon slices.']

title: Chenna Icecream With Patali Gud Syrup
method: ['Melt palm jaggery in a non stick kadai. Mash kalakand in a bowl.', 'Add 4 cups of vanilla ice cream, mix well and place in the deep freezer for 5 minutes.', 'Add 1 cup water to the jaggery and cook till it thickens. Switch off the heat and keep on stirring so as to cool the syrup.', 'Transfer the jaggery syrup into a bowl and keep aside.', 'Pour some jaggery syrup in a serving bowl. Place 2 scoops of ice cream, one above the other and drizzle some Rooh afza over it. Serve chilled.']

title: Veg Sandwich - SK Khazana
method: ['Slice cucumber tomato and purple cabbage into thin roundels. Transfer them on a plate. Slice potato and set aside.', 'Apply butter on all the brown bread slices. Spread spicy tomato chutney evenly on all the slices .', 'Tear and place a few romaine lettuce leaves on 4 bread slices, place potato roundels over the lettuce and sprinkle a little chaat masala on them. Top with cucumber slices and tomato slices and sprinkle a little chaat masala over them. Over these place a purple cabbage roundel and a cheese slice.', 'Cover all the sandwiches with the remaining 4 slices.', 'Trim the edges and halve all the sandwiches.', 'Arrange them in a serving plates with romaine lettuce leaves, cherry tomatoes and tomato ketchup and serve immediately.']

title: Anda Chilli - SK Khazana
method: ['Take corn flour in a bowl, add refined flour, crushed black peppercorns, salt and  1/2  cup water and mix till a smooth batter is formed.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Dip each egg halves in the batter and slide into the hot oil. Deep fry the eggs till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'To make the sauce, heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add garlic, ginger, green chillies and fresh red chillies and saute for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add onion, green capsicum, yellow capsicum and red capsicum and mix and saute for 1-2 minutes on high heat.', 'Add red chilli sauce and oyster sauce and mix well. Pour  1/4  cup water, mix and cook for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add fried eggs and adjust salt and mix till each egg is coated with the sauce. Add spring onion greens, mix and take the pan off the heat.', 'Transfer anda chilli in a serving bowl and garnish with spring onion green curls and serve hot.']

title: Orange Custard
method: ['Heat orange juice in a deep non stick pan. Put egg yolks in a bowl, add sugar and whisk till sugar dissolves. Add cornflour and mix well. Add gelatine to  1/4  cup warm water and let it stand for a while. Add the warmed orange juice to the egg yolk mixture and mix well.', 'Transfer it back to the pan and cook on low heat, stirring continuously, till it begins to thicken. Switch off the heat. Transfer the custard into a big bowl. Add orange marmalade, mix well and let it cool.', 'You can keep it in the freezer for it to cool faster. Stir the gelatine till it dissolves completely and add to the custard. Add whipped cream and mix everything well. Pour into individual cups or bowls and keep them in a refrigerator to set. Garnish with orange segments and serve chilled.']

title: Chocolate Cupcakes
method: ['Preheat oven to 180degC/350degF/ Gas Mark 4. Grease moulds or paper cups. Melt chocolate in a double boiler and add five tablespoons of boiling water. Cool this mixture slightly. Beat butter until soft. Add the sugar gradually.', 'Blend these ingredients until they are very light and creamy. Beat in one egg yolk at a time. Add the chocolate mixture and mix. Sieve the flour with baking powder and salt. Mix milk and vanilla essence.', 'Add the flour mixture in three parts to the butter-sugar mixture alternately with milk. Beat the batter until it is smooth after each addition.', 'Whip egg whites until stiff but not dry. Fold them lightly into the cake batter. Pour into prepared moulds or paper cups till two thirds full and bake at 180degC/ 350degF/ Gas Mark 4 for thirty minutes.', 'Cool on a wire rack before de-moulding. Sprinkle with icing sugar and serve.']

title: Veg Clear Soup
ingredients: [' 1/2  cup kidney beans', '1 tsp oil', '1-2 green chillies, chopped', '4-5 baby corn, finely chopped', '4-5 florets of broccoli, finely chopped', ' 1/2  small yellow zucchini, finely chopped', ' 1/2  small green zucchini, finely chopped', '2 tbsps boiled sweet corn', 'Salt to taste', 'Crushed black peppercorns to taste', '3-4 tbsps corn starch slurry', '2 1/2  tbsps finely chopped tofu', '3 tsps lemon juice', '1 tbsp freshly chopped coriander leaves', 'Bread sticks to serve']
method: ['Take kidney beans  and water. Wash it 2-3 times and soak it for 2-3 hours in hot water. Pressure cook till 6-7 whistles are released. Drain and set aside.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick deep pan, add green chillies, baby corn, broccoli, yellow zucchini, green zucchini, sweet corn and saute for 1 minute.', 'Add 3 cups water and mix well. Add salt, crushed black peppercorns, and mix well. Allow the mixture to come to a boil.', 'Add the corn starch slurry, boiled Tata Sampann Rajma, tofu and mix well. Cook till the mixture comes to a boil and lemon juice and switch the heat off.', 'Add chopped coriander and mix well. Transfer into serving bowl.', 'Serve hot with bread sticks.']

title: Polenta Cookies
method: ['Preheat the oven to 180deg C. Line a baking tray with a silicon mat.', 'Cream together the butter and castor sugar in a bowl using an electric beater.', 'Add the egg and vanilla essence and whisk. Add the salt and fold. Add the polenta and flour and fold again. Add the milk and mix well.', 'Put small scoops of dough onto the lined baking tray and lightly flatten using the back of a fork. This makes twelve cookies.', 'Put the baking tray in preheated oven and bake forten to fifteen minutes. Remove from oven and cool.', 'Serve.']

title: Rawa Medu Vada
method: ['Take semolina in a large bowl, add yogurt, salt, cumin seeds, green chillies, coriander leaves, curry leaves, crushed black peppercorns and coconut and mix well. Set aside for 10-15 minutes.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Grease your palms with oil, take a portion of the mixture in your palm and shape it into a ball. Flatten it slightly and make a hole in the center.', 'Gently slide in medu vadas into hot oil, a few at a time and deep-fry till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving platter and serve hot with coconut chutney.']

title: Mirchi ka Salan
method: ['Heat a non-stick pan add white sesame seeds, coriander seeds and cumin seeds. Saute till they are fragrant and they crackle.', 'Transfer the roasted spices into a mixer jar, add roasted peanuts, dried red chillies, ginger, garlic and some water and blend to a smooth paste.', 'Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds. Once they splutter add curry leaves.', 'Saute for half a minute and add onion. Saute, stirring continuously, till onion is light golden brown. Add salt, stir well.', 'Add turmeric powder and mix well. Add masala paste and cook for 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Add 1 1/2  cups of water and bring it to a boil.
